review_body: We wanted to visit Yoyogi Park, so this was a great location for that. It is also close to Shibuya Station. We had fun crossing the "Scramble Crossings" in the area, where people cross the streets diagonally as well as the usual ways. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. The people at the desk were very friendly. We were looking at the umbrellas that were for sale, as it was raining, and someone came out from behind the desk with 2 umbrellas for us to borrow, since we were guests. We only stayed one night, but they kept our luggage behind the desk all day (after we checked out) as we walked around the area before heading elsewhere for the night.

Hotel was very well located, and for the price and location served perfectly well its purpose for a 1 night stay in the heart of Shibuya Neighborhood. Nothing fancy but for the location amd price i’m willing to look over the size and simplicity of the room which a bit cramped

The room and location were perfect, the service upon arrival however was disappointing. The check in process was confusing, we were told varying things from the same staff member which made the process incredibly frustrating and lengthy.

You definitely will pay a premium for the location. The hotel is very central and it's easy to shop around Shibuya. Delicious Japanese food all around and very close to train station and famous Shibuya Crossing.

Shibuya Tobu Hotel was an excellent experience. When Airbnb cancelled my room a day before my flight, I was able to book Tobu and a very reasonable rate. They have attentive staff, spoke enough English to communicate well with us Americans. Located VERY conveniently in the heart of Shibuya, tons of stuff to do around. Would recommend every time.

This is our fourth time staying here and just love it and the location. Yes the rooms are small but they are clean, tidy and have everything you need. It is a short ten minute walk to the famous Shibuya Crossing and train station. There are dozens of restaurants near by and you could shop up a storm at anytime you wanted. Love this fun, young area of Tokyo. Also if you are feeling tired, the restaurant in the foyer is fantastic with a large selection of drinks, tapas and meals, so you can stay in if you want without a care in the world. We will be back.

The hotel is strategically located within 5 minutes walking distance to most shops such as Animate, Mandarake, Bape, Tokyu Hands, Ichiran, etc. The newly opened Parco Shibuya is 1 minute walk away. Shibuya Station is about 10 minutes walk away. Hotel room is clean and although a little small (like most hotel rooms in Tokyo) is comfortable enough. The hotel staff is helpful in assisting us to procure a taxi to go to Shinjuku Station at the end of our stay.

Very nice hotel a short walk from everything the station shops restaurants ,close to the scramble crossing ,a easy walk with a large bay in tow ,hotel has a good cafe and is close to shops .the staff were very helpful and pleasent, room was a good size .

This hotel very dangerous and if u cleaning room staff very dangerous one day have someA lot cigarette in my room i ask receptionHim ask a bit problem staff and ask sorry, Oh i never smoke but why have a lot cigarette clot in my room and reception don't care this ask only staff problem sorry and check in 15.00 check out 11.00 if u late a bit you must pay 1200¥/per hour And room if u see in pic look big but real is very small and no free water everthing must need money no service for u good luck if u want to try this hotel , and no more staff can Speak eng !!!! Good luck

I arrived 2 hours before their check-in time and they actually charged me for those 2 hours! They charged me €10 for each hour! Never happened to me before. Besides that the room was ok, bathroom was small, location is good.

This is a small basic room with minimum amenities. this is a review for single room. Hardly enough place to move around. The bath room is very tiny. Not much options at the breakfast, but a $10 addition to the basic room is not bad.

Family stop over in Shibuya for one night - so location was most important. And it could not have been better for the park, crossing, restaurants, the list is endless. Rooms small but well fitted, although beds a tad on the small size. Together with location, the standout feature was the amazing staff.

I like so much its easy to go everywhere by train and near atom club can walking around if im come again im sure i will choose this hotel every floor have like a beer water for sale like a japanese style

We loved Shibuya our favourite place in Japan so far. Very clean rooms comfortable close to train station but out of the noise loved it Thankyou for a memorable time in your beautiful part of the world.

This hotel is in the perfect location of Shibuya neighborhood, only 3 minutes walking to downtown Shibuya. Two convenient stores are located besides the property as well as several restaurants, so it is very easy to find food.Overall, it is a perfect hotel to stay in Shibuya area.

The Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The location near Shibuya Station is very good to explore Tokyo.As everywhere in Tokio, the rooms are quite small. And we missed the opportunity to take stairs instead of an elevator.

Now don't let the pictures fool you, the rooms are very small, no dresser or closet to put away you clothes, we lived out of our suitcases for our 10 day stay here. But the cleanliness, amenities and staff could not have been better. It is perfect if you are on a budget and don't plan on spending much time in your room. We didn't we were out and about the whole time soaking in the city and culture. The bowing bell hop was a treat to see when we came back, highly recommend this location too.

its near yoyogi park, quiet area in shibuya, clean tiny room , can hardly walk around because the chair is stuck between the bed and table, toilet is also very tiny maybe 2x2 meter, no cabinet , no english channel, window cant open , staff not so friendly.

If you need to stay in Shibuya, on a budget and will spend very little time in your hotel room, Shibuya Tobu Hotel is the perfect answer. The single room is compact with a fold-down desk, hooks for your hangers. Less than a 10-minute walk from Shibuya station, there are many small restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood. Lots of shopping too, from Tower Records to the Disney Store around the corner and Seibu and Tokyu department stores nearer the train station.Breakfast was delicious, loved the grilled salmon.

Had a great stay, about 8 minutes walk from Shibuya station (Hachiko exit) and crossing and walking distance to great restaurants, bars and shopping. Room /bed is compact, but this is what you expect for Tokyo. Would stay here again in a heartbeat

Great location right near Shibuya station, famous crossing, great food places, great bars, shopping and sights. Hotel has discounted transport railway day passes. Good value, take advantage of deal and purchase for 24hr access to subway. Very nice breakfast available at hotel too.

The location was perfect in Shibuya, quiet street but at 8 min walks from the Shibuya station. The room was small but fully provided. Bed clean and comfortable. Hot water, tea and coffee are provided. Fridge in the room. The bathroom was perfectly clean and convenient with a lot of goodies.

Just chanced upon this property on Agoda and it offered the rate I was looking for. Turned out to be relatively good for a one night stay. It was only about 10 mins walk from the Shibuya Mark City Highway Bus Terminal. The checkin was super efficient and the staff were English speaking - that helped. The room is small, so was the bathroom but the bathroom amenities were good-even had face wash, toner, tonic. Wifi connection was good. The Bed was the the most comfortable of all the hotels I stayed in for this 6 days Tokyo/Kawaguchiko trip. I had a good night sleep.Location-good proximity to things to do-there is a Family Mart just next door. Interestingly the Umbrella at Hotel was priced cheaper than in Family Mart - great for that rainy day.

Great location, nice attentive staff but rooms are quite dated and internet connection is extremely poor inside the rooms.Even though Shibuya is an expensive area to stay, Tobu Hotel seems overpriced for what it offers.

Shibuya Tobu Hotel is a lovely hotel. They made sure we had enough toiletries and there is a laundry space to wash and dry your clothes. It is near Shibuya Crossing, but a short enough walk away to not be inundated with people. It was perfect!

Central and easy here-great place to stay. Dehumidifier kept temp very comfortable. Helpful staff with ideas about what to do and how. Breakfast places nearby and also breakfast offered in hotel. Close to the huge park and new Olympic Park to be built for next year.

This was a very conformable hotel with a great atmosphere. The room was clean and functional. Excellent location. Great price. There are so many great places to eat near the hotel -we were absolutely spoiled for choice!

It is located in the heart of the city. for smokers and since smoking is prohibited on the streets in Tokyo, this hotel has a smoking room in the lobby and makes your life easier. Staff are nice and room were well served.

We enjoyed our stay at Shibuya Tobu hotel. Beds were comfortable n bathroom were cleaned. Restaurants in the lobby area is okay. I rather go out and eat at other restaurants around the area. The staff are nice n friendly . They don’t hve a bell/luggage staff to help with your luggage. so that’s the sad part. Very close to great restaurants n small convenient mini stores to buy water n snacks. Overall the area is great! Walking distance to the famous cross walk and plenty shopping

Vice nice hotel about 10 minutes walk from form the Train Station, the staff spoken English and were very helpful. The room was nice but a little small by western standards but more than enough for me. The WIFI in my could be a little stronger but other wise and over all nice stay.

the single budget room was absolutely perfect for my 10 day stay. This hotel is minutes walk from the hustle and bustle if Shibuya. The staff both front desk and cleaners were amazing and efficient. The room itself is small but perfect and cosy for a single traveller. I find myself even missing the place!!

Room was cozy with a lovely view overlooking the street. The room itself had everything a hotel would and it was worth the last minute purchase. The bed was very comfy and staff were friendly and it was a couple streets away from the main shopping/ food/ train station. 8/10 price for room 9/10 for view for room 7/10 for the cafe in the lobby.

This is a good 3 star hotel. Bed is just too soft. Like most hotels in Japan, the size is really small. The toilet seat is good for small to medium sized people. Not comfortable for people like me. I’m 6’ tall with a heavy build. Overall it’s a good place to stay in around the Shibuya area because of its location.

Great location and good place to relax after a long day.If you have a medium budget and are looking for a good place to stay in shibuya then this is perfect.It’s not a very posh hotel, it is quite basic and simple but it’s easy to get to and the restaurant downstairs is good for snacks and coffee and breakfast.Location, location! And next door is a small shop which seemed to be always open if you need snacks and drinks.Easy to find and not complicated to communicate.

Very good location.Weak breakfast (they have a six photos for our chose, but they have to remember that can receive people from around the world with different habits), small rooms and no gym it's the worst things that I found in Shibuya Hotel.

If you are looking for an hotel well located in Shibuya but not in the crowded streets, this is hotel is a good option. It's about 9/10 minutes walf from the famous crossing. The rooms are small but you can find everything except a locker.

The hotel was very convenient to shops and subway. Everything was crisp and clean. (Remember that this is Japan and there is no was of space - the room was compact but had everything I needed). The people at the desk were helpful and polite. There were some English stations on the television. It was just a short walk from Shibuya station.

This is a nice hotel in a great location. A few minutes walk to Shibuya station, lots of food outlets around and shopping options are varied.The rooms/toilet are simple in decoration but kept very clean daily. The toiletries provided are of good quality. We had been concerned about booking a smoking room but we were pleasantly surprised that the room smelled clean and fresh.The hotel staff are friendly and very helpful.I have every reason to recommend this hotel to anybody.

This hotel is located in the busy district of Shibuya. It is decent enough if you are familiar with Tokyo and don't have much luggage. Not a place to stay if you are new to the city.Our check in process was straightforward enough, but for a hotel of its size, we expected the hotel staff to be a little more helpful and able to communicate in English.The rooms were of a satisfactory size. Bear in mind that hotel rooms in Tokyo are smaller than that of Western countries. The cleaning staff were friendly and kept our room tidy.However, every time we would seek help from the front desk staff (including the use of the hotel provided laundry room), our query was met with utter confusion. We were told by one staff member that we could easily get a taxi from the hotel to our airport bus terminal only to discover on the day (from another staff member) that taxis would not stop at the hotel. On the whole, the front desk staff seemed rather indifferent and did not provide quality of service expected from a hotel of this price.

The situation of the hotel in Shibuya is absolutely great. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and the staff is very nice and helpful. We even had breakfast there everyday and it was worth the price. It's a 5 minutes walk from Hachiko Gate of Shibuya Station so it is a great place to be and visit around Tokyo.

Very convenient location, easy walk to Shibuya Station, yet very quiet. Clean, good size bedroom, cold water in reception, friendly and helpful staff. Make sure you claim your free cocktail at the Pronto Restaurant. Breakfast is not terrific, but does the job.

An overall sub par experience. Single rooms are smaller than the average of hotels of this caliber. Service attitude was less than enthusiastic, they seemed generally uninterested in the quality of your stay. Will not consider staying in this hotel again.

Wonderful location in Shibuya at an affordable price. It's a few miles away from Harajuku and the Shibuya crossing. It's centrally located near restaurants, convenience stores, and shopping areas. The hotel staff was courteous and friendly. Our room was a bit small, but we didn't mind the size. We enjoyed our stay!

In this hotel, location is what you pay for - and location is perfect for shopping and public transportation (as Well as the famous Shibuya Crossing)Having said this, it must also be said that the room rate is much too high for the standard of the hotel. Rooms are very small, breakfast below basics however, the staff is friendly and overall cleanliness is good

The hotel rooms were tiny and barely had room to store suitcases and walk from the bed to the bathroom, but the included breakfast was the worst part of the stay. There were only 6 options to choose from (pick one off the menu) and none were appetizing. No scrambled egg or omelet option, no bagel/croissant and cream cheese, cereal, or other basic breakfast options. I chose the one of the only vegetarian options (pizza toast) and there wasn’t supposed to be bacon on it. The staff preparing the breakfast spoke minimal English (they didn’t even understand “no meat” and I had to google translate to Japanese). I found this frustrating since there were so many foreigners/English speakers staying at the hotel. The staff put bacon on the pizza toast, and I requested a new pizza toast dish without bacon. They were planning on just picking off the bacon, but I had to specifically request that they make it without bacon so it wouldn’t smell like bacon. The pizza toast I wanted finally came out and the tomato sauce tasted like ketchup. They only give hard-boiled egg and don’t make scrambled or other types. This is frustrating because it’s inconvenient to have to pick off the shell.

Shibuya Tobu is a nice option to stay in Shibuya. Although the rooms are a little older, it is still a comfortable place to stay. We stayed in a double room, it was a little cosy but no more than you would expect in a Tokyo hotel. It is back just enough from the busyness of Shibuya, but a 5-10 minute walk to the train station. Good location with convenience stores and food close by.

This hotel is perfectly situated. It is a 8 minute walk to the busy rail and bus station, it is just off the very busy main streets so u do not get hundreds of people walking past all night . Shibuya is very busy during March but we didn’t notice the hassle and bustle of street life below us as the our room (519) was away from the street , and far enough off the main drag to be quiet. Room sizes vary but our small double room was adequate for our stay although suitcases had to remain packed and on the floor at end of bed as there is very limited hanging space and NO wardrobes. Kettle / fridge were handy . Room was immaculately cleaned every day and new nightshirts and towels left out for us . Tea coffee replaced as required. Didn’t really use the tv but sure it would be useful to people . Main complaint I will have to say is the low pitched rumble we could hear 24/7 from next room A/C we think or water boiler ?!?! At night it was quite intrusive at times and actually kept me up for few hours . Not sure how it can be remedied but it wasn’t nice . Many other reviewers have said about smoke smell etc . Our room didn’t smell at all although there was ashtray in it for smokers but on our 1st day arriving the hall outside did smell and I was really dreading opening our door so was really pleased when it was ok . No other negativity, just a pleasant friendly helpful staff . Great location and good price .

Overall experience was good.Pros:Hotel is near to Station and other famous tourist spots, Hotel is super clean with courteous staff.Cons: Rooms are smaller and very limited options for breakfast, specially for vegetarians. Wifi speed was so so.

We booked a three person room. But one of our party changed trip plan and couldn’t join us. When we checked in, we asked hotel staff if they could adjust the rate from 3 people to 2. She agreed and called the booking source to cancel our original reservation, which is completely at hotel’s discretion, and allowed us to make a new reservation for two people. We were nicely surprised by this nice accommodation. Great customer service.

Close to busy Shibuya activities but in quiet location. Easy walking access to trains and metro so convenient for getting around Tokyo too. Staff at hotel very helpful. Room on the small side but we were prepared given dimensions. Not much room for moving around especially with luggage. Good base to explore from. Breakfast in hotel very average.

I stayed for 4 nights at Shibuya Tobu Hotel Japan. The rooms is so clean , breakfast is good and staffs are so friendly. Smooking room is available . Just walk around 10 minutes to Shibuya crossing and Shibuya station.

We booked a twin-bedroom (x2 single beds). The size of the room is typical Japanese ie. small. It's challenging for 2 medium size luggages. Once they're opened, we don't have much walking space. There's no cupboard & most importantly, there is NO safe in the room :( Standard set of toiletries available, including body wash, hair shampoo & conditioner. There's hair dryer but no complimentary daily bottled water. It's approximately 10mins walk to/from the station. There's a c-store just next door & behind (7-11), Flipper pancake is just across the road! Hard to find a cafe in its vicinity when we wanted breakfast if u don't intend to eat in the hotel.Overall, it's an average affordable hotel in Shibuya from room to service.

When I booked the room, I was booking a room with “2 full beds, and 1 sofa bed” when I got there it turned out to be 3 twin beds and no sofa at all, the room was barely big enough for us to walk around. The other thing that sucked was the fact that the WiFi was horrible and it wasn’t portable, that’s a major dealbreaker when you don’t have international data on your plan. In the end, the hotel was clean and the location was perfect but I can’t reccomend it because it’s just simply not worth what you’re paying for it. And it is not as described on Booking.com

disappointed husbands wedding ring was taken from the room, informed hotel however ring could not be found.. completed police report, didn't expect things like this happens in hotels in Japan. Prob won't stay here again

The Hotel is within 5 minutes from Shibuya station and even 10 minutes from Harajuku.The rooms are good (not so small comparing to japanese standard). The staff is professional.I definetely recommend this hotel, good price/quality deal

We stayed at their triple room, was a bit too small for 3 people no extra space for our luggage bathroom was also really small and tight, not recommended for tall people pass 6 foot high because ceiling is low, air condition controls not working, room was a bit warm, breakfast is 1000 yen per head, no free bottled water

i stayed here because a friend told me it was the best location for my first time in Tokyo, and he was right...Location is the best part; 5 minute walk from Shibuya crossing, but in a quiet area.I booked a single room which was the smallest I have ever stayed in but it was super clean. If you like just a place to sleep this is super ok.What I definitely didn't like at all is BREAKFAST (worst hotel breakfast ever for me actually). It's not buffet and the options are not great nor tasty (soup, rice, salad, egg). I tried it the first day decided to go somewhere else for the rest of my stay even when it was included.

We found this hotel at the last minute and the price we go for a triple room was unbelievable. The room was very spacious compared to some of the other hotel rooms in Tokyo. The hotel is also located within walking distance to Shibuya JR station, shopping areas and the famous Shibuya crossing. The room offers a mini fridge and can accommodate two suitcases very comfortably. The hotel also has two onsite restaurants. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and provides good customer service. The staff is very helpful and will go out of the way to help you. The hotel also offers an onsite coin operated laundry service and vending machines. Very convenient hotel to stay at if you are planning to visit Shibuya. Can be recommended for families. Overall, excellent hotel and was very impressed with the room size for the price we paid.

The best part of staying in this hotel was how close it was to Shibuya Station and also a walking distance to Yoyogi Park, Meiji Shrine and Harajuku. We love how the area was quiet and away from the madness of Shibuya but it’s only a 6 min walk so it’s very convenient. It’s also close to a few cool bars and restaurants so if you feel like staying local, but not be around too many tourists, this area is the place to be!The room was small but its standard in Tokyo. They have a laundry room which is handy to have. Also having a 7-11 and Family Mart next door was convenient.Now for the not so good bit:The air conditioning was not working in our room and when we asked on our first night if it’s going to get fixed and when, they said they can’t fix it and for us to just open our windows. There was no compensation offered, no apologies about the situation and no explanation as to why they can’t fix it. They just said it will never be fixed. Luckily it was cooler during the night time, but the construction of a nearby building woke us up every morning & also had some mosquitoes come in due to the windows being opened as per their advice. Disappointed with the customer service. For an almost $200 per night hotel (not including breakfast), you would think that they would offer better service or just get the air conditioning working. I don’t think we got the value for our money at all.

Toilet shoud is dirty and toilet water tank is dirty too .I love the cleaner are not from the china because they are very dirty , never good cleaning the room , no smiling . Cleaner from local or from different nationalities but still good .

I stayed I the hotel for 9 nights for my solo travel to explore Tokyo. I booked a small one person smoking room (even though I don't smoke). The room was pretty small, which I expected, but it was just right for me. The room was very clean and did not smell of smoking. Inside the room there was a small bath with toilet, small bath tube and shower and everything necessary. Next to the bed, was a TV (jap. program), a small retractable desk, a refrigerator and an air cleaner. An air conditioning was also there. The hotel had a free WLAN, which works for mobile devices, but is a little bit unsteady for bigger things. But you could use a LAN cable connection for PC inside the room. As I booked inclusive breakfast, I got 9 breakfast coupons for the "Pronto" Cafe on the 1F. There you can get up to 6 different menus (3 western ans 3 Japanese style) between 6.00 and 9.30 AM, which was pretty good.The hotel was located inside shibuya and is reachable in 5 minutes from the shibuya train station. The near park I also reachable in 5 to 10 minutes if you walk a little. In overall it was a nice stay and a good base for exploring Tokyo :)

Shibuya Tobu is a short walk to the infamous Shibuya Crossing. Upon arriving, I dealt with an impolite front desk staff. I don't know his name, but when I said in Japanese, "Hi, I have a reservation..." he just looked at me blankly and said in English, "Well, I don't know your name." Maybe it's a language barrier that made it seem rude? The rest of the staff was nice though.They held our luggage until we could check-in. The room was decent size for the average Japanese size hotel room. The bathroom was nice with a deep tub. Cons? The A/C in the room never fully cooled off. We tried it at every setting but were still sweating while packing before we left. There was also construction going on that we weren't made aware of until after we checked in. I believe it will continue until the end of the year. Noise wasn't too bad, but it was noticeable in the late mornings.50/50 on if we'd stay here again.

First day in Tokyo Japan, i worried what kind of hotel that we will get. But, its beyond my expectation, the hotel is great.Location 10 mins walks from Shibuya Station. Room not too big but enough. Very clean environment. Price : OK, Smoking Room : available at the lobby.

Very clean; very small rooms; good located next to Shibuya-Station; very friendly staff; acceptable price; stayed there with my family (two small kids). Room was a bit tight for four people but we spent most of the time outside doig sightseeing;

It was my first solo trip and while making by reservation main criteria was the location of the hotel and Shibuya Tobu hotel did not disappoint. Staff is very helpful and friendly. They understand English. It was a very comfortable stay.

Fabulous hotel located in quiet part of Shibuya with quick walking access to the scramble, all the shops, bars, restaurants and clubs the town has to offer. Plus easy walks to Yoyogi / Harajuku. Will definitely come back here.

Excellent location, friendly staff, very clean and good price. Next to Shibuya Station (5min walking), stores and restaurants. There is a very convenient Family Mart next to it. I totally recommend it.

Near family mart and seven eleven. Located between shibuya and haraju. Good location for those with teenager. But be aware that the room for 3 person is very small, and leave no space for the luggages. I asked to remove the third bed, but they didnt do it.

Highly recommended place to stay when in Shibuya. The hotel staff are very accommodating, helpful and friendly. Truly a very good location and this is actually my second time to stay when in shibuya and still an exceptional when it comes to service and its cost. Thank you!

location was perfect , all hotel facilitates are available,staff are friendly and very helpful , rooms are small but conformable, I like that they provide nightwear every day . I would recommend this Hotel to any one .

Nice hotel in Tokyo. No cloaets in the room. Excellent attention. So near Shibuya crossroad and there is a little supermarket right next to the hotel (24 hours open). Room too small but with a comfortable bed.

Location close to the station but off the noisy parts of Shibuya. Check-in was a breeze, the front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. Rooms were of Japanese standards but the beds were soft, bathroom amenities superb. When we asked for extra pillows, they were quick to respond. Breakfast is not buffet but their choices were delicious. The staff very attentive to your needs and requests. Would definitely stay in this place again

We stayed in Shibuya Tobu Hotel for 4 nights. Customer ServiceWe were greeted every time we entered the hotel and check-in and check-out was very fast and easy. When we requested an iron, it was delivered within minutes.RoomThe rooms are small but seems to be the average size to Tokyo standards. There were a few stains and signs of wear and tear on the furniture, but it was clean. There are toiletries that are replenished when needed. We were given a smoking room. At booking we requested a NON smoking room and upon arrival we requested to be moved, but there was not a NON smoking room available. The stench of cigarettes was overwhelming and alarming.Location:The location is great! Train station, a park, food markets, cafes, restaurants and nightlife all in walking distance.We didn't eat at the cafe downstairs, as there are so many restaurants and cafes in the immediate area. The WIFI is good. We didn't watch TV, so can't comment on that. In regards to location, this hotel is great. I wouldn't classify this hotel as luxurious, but more so basic and clean. If we weren't given a smoking room, I would have probably given this hotel a 4 out of 5.

Nice and quite place to stay. Near shibuya station, near familymart.You can walk to many places for shopping!You can get food easily..... and the favorit is ichiran ramen!! Open 24 hours.You can enjoy shibuya.You can walk to the largest sinto temple near shibuya.... there is a large forest in town!!! The hotel provide the washing machine.

Location is very close to Shibuya Cross and sourrounding by shipping centre. Shibuya station is only 8 minutes from hotel. Easy to access. Staffs are really polite, helpfull, and friendly. Next door to Seven Elevent and Family Mart

Must try hotel in shibuya!!! The location is beyond amazing! The hotel room is very cozy, neat, beautifully decorated, and they have provided everything you’ll be needing in a room! The most amazing part? The toiletries are not the typical small size tubes, its full size and they refill it every room service!! Totally a great value for money. The staff are very accommodating too!! No bad thing to say about this hotel!! Amazing!!!
