Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Good location and good price, with cafes, convenience stores and restaurants all minutes away. 10 mins walk from Shibuya station. Staff were all very friendly. I would stay here again and would recommend it.

Just unpleasant and unhelpful staff. Good location, but much rather stay elsewhere when it comes to the service i received. I can see why I usually stay at SPG hotels. Many hotels in the Shibuya area and I would 100% avoid staying at the Shibuya Tobu.

The hotel is conveniently located near restaurants, shopppng, subway, and a 15-minute walk to the Harajuku area. The English speaking staff was also helpful, especially a young lady in the front whose name I failed to obtain. She was very helpful and assisted in every way that she could with a pleasant demeanor. The room is a standard hotel room for the Tokyo area.

I stayed here for a weekend just to get away from military policies with friends. Great room and it’s close to the night scene. The room was a good size and the view from my room was nice. The perfect hotel for those late nights!

Shibuya Tobu is an ideal option for a first time traveller to Tokyo. Located in the heart of the city, all the shopping districts are just a 15 to 20 min walk.The Harajuku street is 10 mins cab drive.The rooms are tiny as Tokyo is famous for but have all the amenities and very comfortable.The washrooms are also very tiny but extremely well equipped.The best part was the availability of vegetarian options in food.A great option to stay when you are on a budget and need a fuss free yet comfortable hotel stay in Tokyo.

First time in Tokyo, stayed here for 5 nights! Rooms are small but there was enough space to open two suitcases which was still a blessing for Japan standards. Hotel clean, comfortable and only 5 mins walk from Shibuya station. Starbucks, 7/11 and so much more only 1-2 mins walk! Definitely recommend this place!

This hotel amazed me! I expected a very small room, and along the way to get there I was afraid that the 5 minutes away from Shibuya Crossing were invented. Instead it turned out to be a great hotel, comfortable, beautiful, complete. The location is enviable: a little 'sheltered from the madness typical of Shibuya, in a side street (uphill) very quiet. Yet it is very close to everything: shops, the subway, and the main street of the neighborhood where you can find entertainment and many restaurants! The Family Mart kombini is immediately at the exit. On the ground floor you will also find an Italian bar-restaurant that I have not tried (I certainly did not like eating Italian in Japan, but it can be handy if you need something). The room was very spacious (by Japanese standards): we managed to make us stay the two suitcases open, to move in two without problems, support everything on the practical table. Comfortable bed for two people (it was French, but not too tight). Available: slippers, basic yukata like pajamas, hairdryer, toothbrush (which was changed every night!), Good products for the shower, water, kettle and two very good sachets of coffee every day. We stayed on the 6th floor of 7, very close to a useful ice dispenser, beer and fresh drinks. It is possible to use the laundry room, and I regret not having tested it - but I was at the beginning of the trip :) The hotel closes at one o'clock at night, but if you want to enter after this time you can use the electronic key of your room.

An average hotel. Room size is decent but if you are on a closer look at the ceilings and underneath or around bedsides can be quite dusty. Have dust forming web-like at ceiling corners. But if you do not mind about all these dust and not a cleanliness freak, overall this hotel is pretty alright. We stayed for 3 nights and pretty quiet as well. Plus point was they provided a variety of bathroom accessories like gels, lotions etc. However, did not use it as unsure whether is it complimentary.

Our stay in the Shibuya Tobu Hotel was very pleasant. It was close to everything that we were interested in seeing and eating.The room is small to western standards but this is expected anywhere in Japan. Bed is comfortable, shower/bathroom is adequate and does the job. The rooms is abit dated but hey, we dont spend the whole day in the room, in reality we just use it to sleep cause we are out all day sightseeing.Staff is attentive and nice. Check-in was quick. They can do luggage storage if need be and they organised us a taxi to go to our next hotel.Its close to the train station. Alot of streetwear boutiques close to the hotel, eg: Bape, AAPE, Supreme, Kikstyo, and many more.Food places are abundant - there is a Denny's across the road, Mos Burger beside the hotel, 7/11, alot of ramen places, sushi places all around so food is not a problem.

Good place, clean, good location. Near to Shibuya Station and a lot of places for shopping. Almost all of the staff speaks English, if not they find someone that does. They got laundy service but is only open from 8am to 10 pm, it should be open 24 hrs and add some laundries and driers machines.

The staff are very polite and friendly, even if we have a langguage barier it did not stop them to help us and answer all our questions.The location of the hotel is very near to shibuya station.Near places. Mrt Shopping mallsCafes7/11RestaurantsThe room is good

This is a decent hotel, conveniently located in the heart of Shibuya a few blocks from the train station. The staff was helpful and professional. Our room was clean and quiet--unremarkable but perfectly adequate. It had all the expected amenities. It was somewhat small, but typical for Tokyo. There's a restaurant in the hotel lobby, but it offered nothing we could eat as vegetarians except for cheese pizza. Fortunately there are zillions of places to eat nearby.

If u are from Haneda airport, take monorail to Hamamatsucho stn then transfer to Yamanote Line to Shibuya. Hachiko exit. If you are from Narita, u can just take the Narita Express(for convenience). Walk on the right of the Starbucks u will see Tower Records building when you are walking. Turn left at junction just before Tower Records, walk all the way till u see a prominent TOBU HOTEL sign of the hotel. Very near the Shibuya station.Check in took less than 10 mins. Basic amenities provided. Toilet is small, like any other hotels in Japan. There is a Family Mart just beside the hotel. Proton bar in the vicnity of hotel. There are vending machines available.Breakfast is not buffet. There are 6 choices, 3 western 3 Japanese. Around 1, 028 yen for 1.Check out took less than 2 mins. Will definitely choose this hotel on next trip to Tokyo!

Arrived at Tobu hotel around midnight having booked on Agoda. Reception says no record of booking. I show the confirmation on my phone. Quite matter of fact no smiles or welcome from this lady, bad start. Everything to the letter in Japan, that is ok but dont forget we are customers. Hotel room small but good bed and shower many things provided tv good but only 1 english channel CNN which is not good unless u want their twist on everything. I missed breakfast by 2 mins and sorry too late. Location good if you like fashion. 24 hour Dennys across street. Cafes nearby. Has a laundry room for a fee maybe 1000 yen. Overall pretty good apart from snooty receptionist.

We booked the Tobu in Shibuya on the advice of our Australian Flightcentre (travel) agent. We wanted a mid-range triple room in a busy and main/central area of Tokyo.The hotel is quiet, clean and fairly modern, with friendly and accommodating staff. We came in late-autumn/early-winter and the room temperature was comfortable and readily adjustable. We have dined in the restaurant for breakfast and found the food very good and reasonably priced.We booked a triple room, but the hotel actually provides double or twin with extra bedding in a fairly small room, which we did not find sufficiently spacious to spend 6 nights in. The hotel staff moved us to a slightly larger room, where the third bed is a sofa bed. They waived the minor upgrade fee and we are very happy with the room size - being three large Europeans! The hotel is 10 minutes walk from the busy and well-connected Shibuya rail station. Shibuya is a busy district, and close to other areas of interest.We used the hotel to access Studio Ghibli Museum, Sanrio Purro Purro Land, Disneyland, Akihabara and several major shrines.This was our first visit to Tokyo, and we were very satisfied with all aspects of this hotel.

The location of the hotel is really great, not far from Shibuya and close to yoyogi park, best place for running in Tokyo. the room adn the bathroom are really better and bigger than others in tokyo at the same price! coffee tea and toiletries were provided. so convenient when your luggage was missing at the airport.

The location is great and very easy to find. Since i enjoyed walking / jogging, this hotel is very close to Yoyogi park where you can enjoy.Everything in the room is functional and the space is just enough for a couple traveler who will stay 4-6 days.

bathroom is a plastic cubicle inserted in your room, with empty spaces around the small bath tube that smell mold. staff is un pleasant, robots with fake smileswindows don't open and are blurred so you can't see the streetoh and they charged me 2000 yens extra for an hour late check out! (nowhere was it mentioned that checking out was at 11am, everywhere i've traveled to it's noon). Avoid this place, in Shibuya there are many more greater options!

The room was clean, recent, quiet and functional. The hotel location cannot be better to visit Tokyo and for Shibuya the price was reasonable. I would also recommend this hotel for business as it has everything you need.

The hotel is perfectly located near shops, restaurants and sights. Rooms are small, ideal for 2 adults only. Front desk staff were not too friendly but helpful and courteous once approached. Housekeeping staff were very helpful and friendly.

What really impresses me about this hotel aside from its convenient location is that the space is well thought of. You'd say it's quite small but its compact design was properly utilized. I enjoy the innovation they put on the toilet. This is really value for your money.

This small hotel in Shibuya district is clean, quiet and comfortable. The rooms are small, but not too small. The place is a short walk to the subway so everything is easily accessible. Our room was a little too hot at night , no matter how low we set the temperature!would recommend this hotel.the service was good.

I am over the breakfast period but the front desk staff were asked me get a coffee rather than wasted the breakfast value of ¥1040-, very caring to us.Place was convenient but not much view for room with window

Very clean with friendly staffs and very close to the Shibuya crossing lane. Despite it's located very central, the hotel is very quiet with a reasonable price and the bed is comfotable. I highly reccomend!

We stay 3 nights at the hotel. On the last day we were waiting for a taxi in front of the hotel for 45 minutes and no taxi pass by. It was raining all day long. We went back to reception and ask to call a taxi but one of the male staff said all taxi are busy during this time. They dont even try to call. Very bad service. Do not expect assistance from the staff.

My first trip to Japan was wonderful. The hotel staff were amazing. The location on the hotel is perfect , a five minute walk to everything. We were there when typhoon lan hit and things just went along like normal. A truly professional establishment.

hotel is on good location, and there is good indian resorant near hotel. the rapoongi metro station is around 1to 1.5 km from hotel.balle salle shibuya first is also upto 1.5km from hotel.famous shibuya metro station also 3 to 4 km from hotel.you can see a famous tower within 3km.

Very nice hotel with a convenient Pronto in the lobby. Very close to the center of Shibuya but far enough away that it is quiet and relaxed. Rooms are nice and mostly up to date. Will definitely consider staying here again.

Enjoy every single moment. But the environment of the hotel is very complicate as there are a lot of construction are on progress outside Shibuya station. Therefore, highly recommend mark a good map for finding the way back.

Very expensive, bad condition, old building, old facilities and furniture, unfriendly staff, do not stay here if you can, avoid TOBU at all cost. A VERY EXPENSIVE COST AT THAT! It's also not that close to Shibuya station, a hard uphill trek.

Room was larger than most Tokyo hotels. Cleanliness could've been better (saw ants in the toilet). Service at the reception was good however they declined to help us call for a taxi as we needed one for all our luggages. Other hotels actually helped us to call for one.Overall pleasant stay. Extremely great location. Would stay there again!

The hotel is very well placed, in the center of Shibuya, but also in a quiet place. the Breakfast is ok, the wifi is ok, the reception is ok. The rooms are a bit small for european standards. They could be cleaned better.

the hotel is located in a convenient location with a nice cafe downstairs. The reception is friendly and helpful. The room is comfortable. The room was not properly cleaned during the stay and only 'neatened up'

A short walk from Shibuya crossing this hotel was clean, conformable and typically small. The air conditioning did a good job of keeping the temperature controlled although it could be a little loud. You are spitting distance between to two 24 hour stores in case you need any emergency supplies. The staff are friendly and professional and the rate was reasonable given the other options I had. I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel is near the train station and major shopping areas. Room size was very comfortable, esp for Tokyo. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good. Amenities provided were of good quality. I'd definitely stay here again.

Shibuya Tobu Hotel was a great stay for a great price. Friendly staff, great location and comfortable rooms. It has easy access to Shibuya Station, restaurants, theatres and coffee shops. If I'm ever in Shibuya again for business or family vacation, I will be staying at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel.

Very comfortable room, fantastic location, very helpful staff. The hotel cafe was also excellent, I had a few breakfasts there (good Japanese and Western options) and a really good dinner. I would certainly come back.

He location is good for shopping and takes 10mins by walk to the Shibuya stations to transit anywhere in Tokyo. I also took there breakfast in the hotel with Japanese and western style, small portion but taste good. There are many designers' brands and various of restaurants around the hotel. But you got to walk by slope to the hotel.

Good location. Near to get food. Clean room and hotel. Our family enjoy with atmosphere and the hospitality of reception. Good price. We really enjoyed. Recommended for family to stay here.Thanks Tobu Hotel.

Room for 3 was twin beds and sofabed. Quite tight but still clean, good airconditioning, accessories nice and location perfect within 5 mins walk to Shibuya station. Liked the area and hotel, perfect for our family travel :)

Brought my son to Japan for the first time and was looking for a good location for a teenager to not be bored. Thank God, I found one. Located in the heart of Shibuya Crossing, the Times Square of Tokyo. Excellent shopping, dining and a nice cafe for a quick bite when you're tired. Professional and friendly staff. Would stay here again!

For that price you will find absolutley nothing anywhere near the shibuya intersection an this place is few minute walk down the street in a quiet clean preaty part of the area... privete room small but extremley functional your own bath which is becoming luxury in japan .. for that money ppl there sleep in pigeon boxes and capsules and what not...I highley recomend...

Location of the hotel is very convenient, not far from the JR Shibuya station and the shopping area. The room is clean and the price is reasonable. Staffs are very nice and helpful. Free-Wifi is also available in the room and the lobby.

The hotel location is great, I do not like the bed and pillow as I feel its too soft. Well cleaned, no drinking provide in the room, little disappointed. But compare with price in Shibuya area this hotel is one of the best selection.

A stopover in Shibuya Tobu Hotel with adult family after trekking Kumono Kodo for 5 days was perfect to finish our trip. Nearby design district & good food. Hotel comfortable but breakfast could be improved.

We stayed in a triple and it while cozy (expected) the room was perfectly suitable for our needs. The beds could've been more comfortable (super hard) and the pillows too (super hard buckwheat pillows). We won stuffed toys from the nearby arcades and used those as pillows instead. All in all a functional room in Tokyo. If traveling this way again I don't feel the need to stay in Shibuya and we would probably opt for more low key places. But if you want to be in the middle of it all it's a good hotel to stay and we would recommend it.

The hotel service personnel were all very professional, friendly and very accommodating. I stayed in a budget deluxe room which was very clean, well maintained and well equipped basic sleeping and bathroom amenities. Good wi-fi connection is a plus. Tobu hotel is very close and walking distance to shopping areas (i.e. Uniqlo, Gap, Muji, and Loft department store among several others), and good places to eat ( i.e. Ichiran (for Ramen), and Ueno (best budget sushi place). Convenience store (Family mart) for quick night snacks is also located almost beside the hotel It is also just a few blocks from the famous Shibuya Crossing.

Hotel is very clean and has good location. Price is kind of ok for that location. Not far from Shibuya station. Also close to many nice things to see. Rooms are small, but totally regular for Japan. Also quiet.

Great spot close to food outlets. The staff were very obliging with the dilemma I had in room bookings and could not have been nicer. Only stayed for one night so didn't explore too much but the area appeared to be very vibrant being only one block from Shibuya crossing.

Our room was clean and comfortable if a bit small. I particularly liked the fact that you can open the window for fresh air. It's a little out of the way from the core Shibuya hustle but that has its advantages (it's and easy stroll). There's a shabby but friendly Denny's over the road that's a great spot for a relaxed and good value breakfast. Staff were friendly and efficient. Overall, I liked this place.

The hotel is in Shibuya, a very nice and exciting place, and next to the main stations, shops, and anything you need. The rooms are not very big but comfortable, the furniture is not very new. The toilet is very small, as everywhere in Japan...

Clean and full of kitchen not so far from city, Room in this place most expensive from 9 nigths around in Iceland 555555, But receptionese help us to introduce about sightseeing & resturant around this city.

Stayed here for 4 days. Rooms are smallish - Japan style. Still they're clean and comfortable. Everything you need really. Unlike some other reviewers, we found the staff very friendly and helpful. Location is excellent - about 6-7 minutes to Shibuya station and even closer to the fun part of Shibuya with loads of eating options. We'd happily stay here again on our next trip.

Stayed here for 3 days. The hotel has small rooms . Found the staff a little too rule based . E.g. They serve the breakfast from 630-930. On my checkout date I asked at 625 , if I could give the coupon and just take the juice ( as was in a hurry ), the staff rudely said "No" only after 630.Even while checking in they didn't give the room even few minute before 2.

Rooms were clean and hotel is in a solid location, but check out attendant was extremely rude. Everything was pretty solid up to that point. We apologized for our late check out and told the front desk to charge us whatever they needed to, to make up for it. They called every hour yelling at us telling us to hurry up. Also they told us it would be 1000 yen per hour after stayed, which we said was reasonable and ok. Stayed 1.5 hours got charged for 3 hours extra.

There has been miscommunication regarding luggage delivery but the staff was very attentive and mitigate the situation quickly. Furniture and room condition is quite old fashioned and a bit run down but overall stay is good. The room space is acceptable.

Excellent location. Short walk from Shibuya station and near many restaurants, bars, and stores. Nice modern hotel and the staff is friendly and helpful. The solo room is a bit small, however it's about standard from what I've seen of solo rooms at other Tokyo hotels and was also clean and comfortable. Still a great value for the money.

Walking distance to everything! Its near the Shbuya Crossing and Hachiko statue!!The staff and the housekeeping services are very ,very nice! I highly recommend it and definitely would come back here!

it would have been nice if breakfast is included in the rate we paid like most hotels it saves you from running around the city to find a decent meal. good thing reception staff speak a and understand English well.

Beautiful modern lobby which we were quite surprised about as for the affordable price we were expecting something a lot older. There was a popular, really modern looking cafe in the lobby which added to the atmosphere and made it seem like were staying in a trendy hotel

Very nice staff, nice and clean rooms, near to metro station, convenience stors, restaurants and shops. The windows aren't clear so you can't see outside and not all of them can be opened. You've been there for two different times because it's truly well located and it's comfortable and very clean.

Nice amenities on the bathroom and it always feel clean size of the room little disapointing but the rest are execelent no complain mostly the furniture were up to date close to every where easy acsess downtown shibuya and harajuku

The Hotel was easy to find and is close to Shibuya train station. The hotel was quiet, clean, and the staff helpful and friendly. I was pleased that we could open the window to get fresh air.The bed was very comfortable

Facility is 5 minutes away from Shibuya crossing. The area is located in a very quiet neighborhood close to City Hall. Facility has as majority of the amenities needed for a get away vacation. Room is very small like every hotel in Japan in comparison to hotels in the United States. No safe in the room I'd stayed in and needed new carpeting. The facility has a laundry room as well with hours of operation of 0800-2200H which is very convenient for me to use during my visit.

We stayed for three nights in a room with double bed. Can't complain much on the small size of the room since all tokyo hotel is more or less the same. Impressive little washroom with the best amenities I've ever seen in a hotel. Location is very near to the hustle and bustle of shibuya yet not too close. A convenience store just beside so no problem in getting little snacks, alcohol, water fancy bakeries or onigiris (triangle sushi)

didnt need to tried another just take this hotel when you have a tyrip to shibuya. The places are cool, safe and near everything. confienent store and bus stop just walk, branded store like zara and etc are in your hand, yhe vending machine avaliable at several florr, WIFI is super!! facility for bath and another so completed

Bit pricey for small basic room with no view or ability to open window, but you you won't find cheaper in area! Great location & really helpful staff. Short walk to Shibuya stn with shops along the way. Would def stay here again. Staff recommendations for resturants were excellent!

Very satisfied. Can't ask for more at this price. Location was very good. Room was of a decent size, fits 2 adults and a toddler comfortably considering most Japanese rooms are small. Will definitely consider this hotel again.

Our family of three stayed here for nine nights for Christmas and New Year 2016-2017 and could not believe our luck at the position and quality of this hotel. It is in an amazing spot not far from the Shibuya Train Station, surrounded by quality shopping and food, a 'Family Mart' right next door and great entertainment venues. The staff were always so helpful, the breakfast was fast and delicious, the rooms, though small, which is what you expect in Tokyo, were clean and had everything you could need. On the second floor are two washing machines and dryers, which made this side of things an absolute breeze. Thank you Shibuya Tobu, we will be back!!

located in a quite road but just few steps away from shibuya station and center of shopping and restaurants, staff always very friendly and helpfull for any need, rooms are pretty small but I guess this is typical of japanese hotel, wifi working also inside the room, clening service excellent, very good value for money considering we spent three days across new year holidays

Great location right down up the road from food, bars and shopping. Room was very clean there was 3 of us and they had 2 beds and a lay down couch in the room. Would recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay for a couple nights.

Nice location just a few walking minutes from the Shibuya craziness. Very clean and quiet room. Small as usual in Tokyo for this price range. Nice coffee shop in the lobby. Fast Internet included in the price. Nice shopping and eateries around. Would go there again.

Recommended budget hotel in Tokyo prime area especially those who love night photograph in 2016 illumination festival. Walkable distance from Shibuya hotel and surrounded by many store. Shibuya never sleep.

Nice and clean hotel. Rooms are for Japan/Tokyo concerns nice and spacious. Walking distance to some really nice places. A walk to Shibuya Crossing is nice. The Meiji-jingu park is really relaxing in this big city.

Just a 5-8 minute walk from the railstation Shibuya away. You find nice shops and restaurants in walking distance. Busshuttle to the airport is 10 min away. Rooms are bigger than in other city hotels in that category. Very nice and frendly staff.

I stayed here for 6 nights in August and don't think I could have chosen a better location in Tokyo. We arrived at Shibuya station and exited via the Hachiko exit right onto Shibuya crossing. We were literally 5 mins walk away...what an amazing experience. The hotel was lovely, modern, very clean with lovely staff who couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was a triple and plenty big enough for our needs, dressing gowns, slippers and great toiletries. So much to see and do in the area and so near to the station. Highly recommended.

We were able to walk from the Shibuya Station or take a very short taxi ride to the hotel. Hotel room for two was comfortable albeit by Japanese standards. Breakfast was included and offered both Western and Japanese choices, which were equally tasty. Entrees are ordered and there are also a few Japanese food buffet items. Caveat: Although the staff can technically speak English, I was genuinely shocked and offended by the way a staff member addressed me. Some staff do not understand nuance and must have been instructed to be forceful when speaking English. A receptionist scolded me in English in an inappropriately loud voice and with an exaggerated facial expression when I asked him to call a taxi one hour before my scheduled departure! Whether I had asked for a taxi within one hour or in ten minutes, his delivery was very offensive and unprofessional. Another receptionist whose English must have been limited, firmly and unequivocally told me she could not order a taxi for me (because it was during rush hour and apparently impossible). Rather than offer alternatives or an apology, her firm denial came across as rude (even to my Japanese friend who I shared my experience with). Not a deal breaker, but just be aware of this hotel's staff's English limitations.

This hotel is exceptional value considering how expensive quality room sin Shibuya can be. This hotel is just a short 3-4min walk from the Shibuya crossing and the rooms themslves were very well kept and comfortable to stay in. By japanese standards teh room we were in was very large. We had 3 adults staying in 1 room and there was plenty of room for all of us to house our luggage and move around. I could not recommend this hotel enougha nd would be back here again the next time I am in Shibuya

The hotel is very well located - 5 min walk from shibuya main station. It has an great Italian restaurant just inside. Service was welcoming and the room was spacious. It was very well priced for the size of the room and location. There isn't an onsen and our wifi didn't work in our room so we had to go to the reception to check booking details / google maps etc etc. Double check this as they say you have wifi in your room. They have a laundry room on level 1, yes!! :)

Its not the best location in Shibuya as its a little uphill but its close enough for the price we paid.We booked a room for 3 pax, everything is find except for the fact that there is not enough space to open all luggages.

I stayed here for one night for a short business trip. This hotel is located near the center of shibuya. About 5 minutes walk from shibuya station. The hotel is nice and conveniently located. Around the area were several food choices and some street stalls. The hotel was generally ok. The room was well kept and organized. Breakfast was also served but not buffet but still, a good set meal to start up your day. I had a great stay here.

I spent 3 nights in a single room here.Room itself was minuscule, like many in Asia. It had all the services and the bathroom was actually very well equiped with free toiletries, toothbrush, etc. Many hotels in Paris, for instance, have similarly small rooms, so this is nothing bad per-se, only to be taken intO account if travelling with large luggage.Bed was comfortable and the air conditioned worked very well.Service was excellent, from check-in, where I was greeted with a smile. I would like to congratulate specially the front desk staff for their politeness and eagerness to help with any requests.Breakfast was varied and served in good quantity.one can choose between asian options and western options.Overall, a good choice hotel in an excellent location if one wants to be in the centre of the action. Slightly far away from more typical tpurist attractions in Ueno or Asakusa, though.

this is my 2nd time in Shibuya during the Halloween period, Despite the crowded streets elsewhere, the hotel offers a tranquil place to rest for the night. No loud music and large crowd that parties through the night. Location: Its a good distance to cover from the Shibuya Station, but under 10 mins. Something to note, you can walk to Harajuku shopping belt in under 20 mins. Room: Clean, and decent size (not smaller than usual) for a tokyo hotel i reckon, small bathroom as usual, but it has full toiletries available. Nice. Services: I didn't use much of the services, except the concierge for luggage and they did lend us 2 umbrellas for a rainy day.

As noted by another reviewer they tried to put us in the smoking room however t I insisted and threatened them to take further action at which point we were given a non-smoking room...I wonder what game they are playing at.The room turned out to be tiny with no space for luggage which even obstructed the door, the breakfast is ghastly (I had to return the rancid salmon steak having a strong fishy smell far from fresh), coffees, beverages all of the cheapest quality therefore I suggest you get breakfast in the many places around the hotel.On the bright side the location is very good.

Even Special request are taken care of.Like I asked to print my online ticket.No Problem.Like I said friendliness of the staff is excellent.Okay ,the rooms are a bit, small, but it is the middle of Tokyo.Anytime again

4 min walk to hotel from Shibuya station. I was a first time solo female traveller and felt so at home in this district. Close to bars and restaurants (Genki sushi!) and Shibuya shopping hub. Would def stay here again. Hotel was clean, spacious (for Japan) and well maintained. Cafe downstairs looked great though I didn't eat there as too many options at your doorstep. Speaking of which.. A 7/11 type convenience store is right next door. Excellent accomm in Tokyo.

They have everything to tick the box. They did not have the high level of warmth and welcome that was expected in a Japanese hotel at this level. Service cannot be faulted but difficult to really praise.

Read the other reviews carefully. Most of this hotel is smoking and you will get stuck in a smoking room if you use a booking site. They were "full" when asked to change without even looking. This seems to be a pattern when reading reviews. Thank God we only booked 1 night. Most expensive and worst hotel we stayed at in Japan.

Located in-between shibuya and harajuku. Gentle up slope on the way to hotel. Great for those who enjoyed walking.. not for lazy travellers. Room has leftover tobacco smell but negligible. Lots of food choices plus the best ramen- Ichiran (two outlets spotted) and Luke Lobster (no queue, diagonally across).

We spent our first three nights in Japan here. Good location, helpful staff and a nice room. There was an initial problem that we were put into a smoking room when we had requested non smoking but, upon checking the room found it was OK.

Very pleasant and helpful staff. Comfortable room well maintained by cleaning staff. Only downside was the pronto restaurant in the premises - but the Pronto chain generally are not particularly flexible for foreign visitors.

It was wonderful to me during my stay in this hotel. Staff are very friendly no unnecessary queries and always helpful which is very important to a visitor. I think who loves to stay the heart of city he/she can choose this hotel to stay self or with family as well. All brand items shopping mall are just walking distance.

Getting to the Hotel from the Shibuya train station is so convenient. Besides, this train station feeds into most other train stations that will get you around to the sights in the city and beyond. There's lots of shops. The best is the Loft. There's a great Chicago type pizza place delicious. There's a lemonade and lemon tart stand. And many 7/11 type stores near the Hotel.

I would like to extend my heartfelt thanks to the staff for their dedication to us, and eagerness to assist us in all aspects of our stay. They offered tips about Tokyo sightseeing as well as maps and recommendations. They responded positively to my requests and requests and would go to full lengths to provide me with satisfactory service. Already I miss Tobu Hotel and will definitely make it my only stay on my next trip to Tokyo. Tobu Hotel sums up the spirit of Tokyo and Japan in every way possible.

The location was great, close to shibuya station which connects the area to the rest of Tokyo, staff were friendly, yet the rooms and toilets were soo tiny, also, the hallways stinked. We moved to another hotel and paid the same value and was much luxurious and close to an important station too.

This hotel was so nice!! It was right in the action of Shibuya! Easy to get to, easy to find. The room was so nice and clean! Of course in Japan the rooms are a little smaller than in my country (Canada), but it's the perfect size! The view was nice too!! (The picture below was the view from my room)

I stayed here for 2 days with my friend. The facilities, service, location is great. I could find easily and walk from the station to the hotel in just 15 mins. It took me just 2 mins to walk to the center.

Hotel is located very close to Shibuya Station, shopping, many attractions and restaurants! Cleanliness was awesome and breakfast was ok. Would definitely book the hotel again and recommend it to friends with the info that they should be prepared to get really small rooms.

It's taken me over two years to get around to writing this, the ordeal was too much. We chose this hotel a couple of years back after being stuck in Japan due to heavy snowfall stopping all flights and having to extend our trip by a few days.So, with this in mind, there were only a couple of rooms left in this hotel. On the surface it looks quite nice, but do not be deceived. After an 18 hour journey from Hakuba, finally getting through the door of the room to be greeted with the full on stench of cigarette smoke was a kick in the balls. This smell could not be got rid of either, it's ingrained.That wasn't the worst part, the worst part was using the awesome Japanese toilet, then a few hours later noticing that someone had deposited their bum waste all over the water nozzle, which I had previously blasted over my nether regions. GREAT!! THANKS FOR THE GERMS TOBU!So yes,..disgustingly filthy rooms, would not recommend. The only plus point is that it's in a great location.

We stayed one night here. The best thing is the location, walking distance to the Shibuya shops. The hotel itself felt a bit dated and not the best value. Our room had windows that just opened to a view that was just a next door building wall.We got a 4 bed room for our family. The extra 2 beds were stuff and not very comfortable. There was a laundromat in the hotel which was convenient.

Tobu Hotel has a very convenient location to explore Shibuya and also nearby Harajuku on foot. Shops and eateries are plentyful in close neighborhood. The hotel has small rooms, bathrooms and beds but everything you need is there and it's - as I find always in Japan - very clean and tidy. Despite the location, it wasn't noisy. It's not a great deal moneywise as you obviously pay for the good location but still fair. If I want to stay in Shibuya again, I'd certainly check the Tobu first.

Shibuya Tobu Hotel is located next to the heart of Shibuya with walkable distance. The hotel is near everything such as clothing shop with many famous brand in the world, restaurants, catering services, bars or pub. The room was small but clean, and price is not too expensive. This is a good place to stay and very convenient to discovery Shibuya.

The greatest location! Literally only minutes away from Shibuya station, Shibuya crossing and all the hostle and bustle, but placed in surprisingly very calm street. Convenience store right next door. Fair walking distance to Harajuku and Meiji Jingi shrine - even for minor kids.Perfect base for exploring and siteseeing Tokyo.It would have been great if the window in the small room could open. No view/window is blinded. We stayed in a double room with extra bed/sofabed.Didn't try the breakfast as it was not included.Overall a nice and clean hotel - nothing extraordinary. Very helpful and friendly staff. Fair price. And what a great location. Absolutely great valuable for the money.

We stayed at Tobu hotel our first night in Japan (but by the airport) and on our last night in JApan (in Shibuya). Both times the staff has been very kind and polite and the rooms has been clean and comfortable. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel for as long as we wanted the day we left (that was great since our flight didn't depart til late in the night).

As a repeat guest of this hotel (six visits in two years, over 30 room nights) I can say that the area is excellent, but unfortunately there seems to have been a recent management change at the hotel. Repeat business doesn't seem to be a priority, nor do specific room requests matter. Japanese guests get top priority...

Staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. Rooms are very clean and causy, well equiped. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the Shibuya station in a very good location, very beautiful architecture, next time we are going to choose the same hotel.

Convenient place, easy to reach, competitive prices and nice hotel for stay close to anywhere( shibuya station, parco, 109 etc) hotel staff serve very well amd have cheap and good restaurant around and at the hotel

Nice Lobby for work, perfect location for walks or getting around Tokyo, also near parks and walking / running areas. Very nice offerings.Just bit slow check-in. But in all other perspectives friendly and good service.

Room was small. Had problem putting my two bags. Great location . Family mart next door. Lots of restaurants. Lots of western restaurants like Denny's , McDonald etc for westerners. High speed wifi . Decent breakfast

Very good location in Shibuya area - convenient for visiting Shibuya. Close to transport connections - trains and underground. Hotel room is small (but that is typical for the hotels in Tokyo unless one wants to pay a fortune).

We initially chose this hotel for the price and convenience it offered; hotels that were just a few minutes walk away were more than twice that price. The room was very small with no closet space but it was expected for the location. We booked a room with 2 beds and a pull-out sofa bed and there was barely any space left to move around. However, I'd imagine it should be much more comfortable if you're just sharing with one other person. Hotel is not far from Shibuya station, just a 10 minute walk or you can take a taxi for just approx. 700-800yen. Shibuya shopping central is just a 7-10 mins walk away with innumerable restaurants. All the typical amenities were offered: slippers, toothbrushes, toothpaste, cotton pads/Q-tips, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. Overall, I will recommend it to anyone who does not mind the lack of space and prefer a cheaper yet still central hotel within the city.

A good place to stay while on vacation. Clean rooms and facilities, good location, nice staff.Would definitely go back there.Rooms we stayed in are small (1 double room). If you're in it just to sleep then its fine. Very hard to move around with 2 people inside. Very small area to pack things. Also paid breakfast choices can be improved as it was almost the same everyday.

The room is super tiny small!! You can't put down the lugagge anywere if you still want to be able to put your feet on the floor. There is no cupboard to put your stuff away. But it was clean. Staff was nice but could not help me what train to take to the airport. I did not want to pay for a bus that would be leaving from shibuya station, where i could take a train for free and shorter time since I had the japan rail pass.

Stayed in Shibuya Toby hotel in May 2015, previously stayed in Shibuya Exell but this time we chosen cheaper hotel. The best location, Yoyogi Park just a few minutes away, not far from Shibuya crossing, train station. Bus to Shinguku stopping just near hotel. A lot of shoping around, beautiful supermarket just down the street and a lot of small ones near hotel. Evian water in the lobby of the hotel just 200 yen, cheaper than in Australia in Supermarket. Room with 2 beds was quite good size, but no views from window on that side of the hotel. TV just 1 English chanel. Was beautiful weather and many restaurants and caffes had summer terases. It was beautiful. Love Japan and especially Tokyo.

in 10 day traveling thru Japan i havent experience such a lousy service !front desk staff needs to come down from there high chair.very disappointing.Rooms are ok, clean! Location is good ! the price you pay is for location and not more ... max 1 night

Best location to wonder around urban Tokyo. Staff are friendly and helpful. Pronto on G/F is handy for breakfast, afternoon tea as well as snacks. Clean room with fine amenities for us, a family of three, not mentioning the room rates are reasonably priced.

Found this last minute, was a way better price then other hotels. Room was a decent size for one person with everything I needed for my stay. I was lucky to find this place, will plan ahead next time :)

Make sure you come out of the station at the hachiko exit. Walk over the famous shibuya crossing. There's a bit of an uphill walk past all the shops and it's on the left hand side on the main street. Easy to find. If you carry on up the road you get to yoyogi park which is lovely. There will be events there during the Olympics in 2020. We had a twin room which was quite small but was adequate. Bathroom quite small. Clean and had a decent cafe type restaurant. Enjoyable stay.

Friendly staff, good location, clean and quiet room. The room was not as small as I thought. I have really good time to stay in the hotel with my family. It will be one of my selection to stay when I travel to Tokyo next time.

Because of the many positive remarks on Tripadvisor, we decided to stay here. Most of these remarks proved to be true, but one major issue was that non-smoking rooms were not available. The room smelled really bad and on top of that no window could be opened and the air conditioning appeared not to be functioning. It was really warm in the room and despite a humidifier also very dry. Although we were really tired we could not sleep well and got a severe headache. Despite the great location we will never stay here again.

It was good, the checkin process was smooth and the rooms were comfortable. The location is not that near shibuya station but near enough. It was near to a lot of shopping and food places so that should make up for the initial 10 minutes walk from station. We had a senior folk with us so the 10minutes and slight uphill walk was tough on him. Other that that it was ok.

Great location only a couple of minutes walk from the heart of of Shibuya. Convenient to the train, shopping areas and parks and gardens. Beds really comfortable, room was very small but fine as we only used it to sleep.

Convenient to shibuya & harajuku district. But room size is the smallest one I had ever experienced in Japan hotel before. My room size even smaller than inn in Japan. Room price is a little bit high so the price to room value is in average only.

The service is polite and professional they will point you in the right direction. The bed was comfortable, had a desk n chair. A hot water heater, coffee bags, tea bags hair dryer. We enjoyed watching Japanese tv when in room however we were out most the time. The location was perfect everything in walking distance. Shibuya station and Harujuko stations were both close. We took the trains early in the morning between 7am-9am and they weren't as crowded, I advise going to sites; Tokyo Tower etc early in the day and beat the crowds then we would be back to hotel between 3pm-5pm take a break then walk around the hotel area, plenty of shopping, sites and restaurants

Staff so helpful, convenient location, clean, comfortable beds, they provide pajamas. It was a pleasant surprise! I booked it at the last minute and it was one of the only available roons left. It was a triple with 3 twin beds. Close quarters but we did not mind. I would stay here over and over.

Pros -Super close to the JR and Tokyo subway lines (about an 5-8 min walk). Walking distance, literally 2 blocks, from the heart of shibuya. It was such an interesting place to stay! Loads of shopping, American chains and Japanese clothing, bars, and restaurants! We never had to walk far to get supper yummy food (all types from American to Japanese), there were SO many choices! We walked shibuya every night after exploring the rest of Tokyo and we could've done more! We LOVED the area. I can not stress this enough. Crossing the worlds busiest crosswalk everyday was treat. Right next to a 7-11, Starbucks, and an awesome udon restaurant! You can do your laundry on the second floor (coins, and buy detergent from the front counter) friendly staff, clean free wifi Cons -Hotel room was on the small side and needed updates. My husband couldn't dry himself in the bathroom as there wasn't much room

Great place close to the station...good staff and many options surrounding the area for food and other goods. 10 minute walk to the station and the shibuya crossing. I would definitely come back here again !

This hotel is located within walking distance to all the attractions in Shibuya and the train and bus stations. Clean comfortable and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Laundry facilities were a bonus. Our room was very small but had everything we needed. Bed was great.

Staff are helpful.The location is a bit of a hike from Shibuya, I get a little bit problem since there is heavy rain when I arrived, but I'm quite happy walking in Tokyo, so this wasn't a problem for me.職員很樂於助人。由車站往酒店的路會經過斜坡,碰巧我抵達當日下雨,感覺有點困難。但我還是喜歡在東京街上行走,所以不是太大問題。

Clean clear the saver is great, not big room but very comfotable, making me love Tokyo ! And if I have a chance travel in Shibuya next time, I will choose Tobu hotel again! And also will introduce it to my friends!

Room was very clean and the hotel accommodated 3 people in a twin room, with the use of a fold out bed. Location was good, a short walk from Shibuya Station and close to a lot of shopping and eating options, although the area isn't the cheapest in Tokyo. We stayed here at the start of our 2 week trip round Japan and the hotel agreed to hold our bags until we checked in again at the end of the trip, as we had one last night in Tokyo before we flew out. This was very convenient and of no extra charge.

Stayed here September 2014 with my cousin whilst in Tokyo. Good size hotel, wonderful location. We got a good rate but anymore I would not have been pleased. Lovely and helpful staff arranged a taxi for us. Free wifi in reception. Breakfast was minimal but that didn't matter.

As title. Good place for fashion shopping, and easy to transfer the metro, no matter walking around in the Tokyo city, or go out to the country side such as Kamakura, Yokohama, Fujizawa, or the other cities.

Newly renovated hotel about 10 minutes walk from Shibuya station. Nice hotel with Japanese standard room size, comfy bed, clean toilet and free wifi. Convenient store just next door and many restaurants, shops and shopping malls along the streets.

It's located in the middle of Shibuya and Harajuku, which make the location extremely convenient. It is walkable distance to both shopping places. However the hotel would not be able to provide two keys, so that you have to leave you key in front desk if travelers does not stay together.

The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly in helping us find our way around Tokyo. The room was also nice and well kept. The hotel is a short walk from shibuya crossing and is also walking distance to yoyogi. Would definitely recommend.

Good location with several great eateries close by. Close to Yoyogi park & metro. Found the Time Out guides in the foyer a real bonus and supplemented guide book and online stuff! Friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay again.

The location is near the shopping center in Shibuya and Omotesando. There are many restaurants nearby as well. The Shibuya JR and metro station are just in your 7 minutes walk, which is very convenient.

Very good service and awesome location in shibuya! Good size rooms and clean, staff was very helpful and kind. The resturant in the Hotel have good food and Nice drinks, supermarket 10meters from the Hotel!

Not much more we could ask for. Great location. Clean room. Good service. Well thought of facilities. A little cramped than we're used to at that price. But relatively affordable compared to other hotels in that part of the city.

Staff helped me out at the front desk to make a call to credit card company. Was thankful they were able to help, as I had no cell phone and the pay phones were not cooperating. This is the only hotel in Japan I stayed in so can't compare with other local hotels, but price was high compared to what you'd pay in Canada for similar.Good location close to "the busiest intersection" and a nice Starbucks.5 min walk to the train station.Very clean.

Overall, the hotel is better than what I expected! Room was very clean and service was good. Some people at help desk speak English. Shibuya subway station is close from the hotel (probably 7 mins walking).

New City, New York

review_body: We really enjoyed staying at the Shibuya Tobu. The hotel is right in the middle of a Shibuya with restaurants and shops right outside the entrance. The room was a bit cramped but most Tokyo hotel rooms are, i think. Best part was that they had rooms with triple sharing which is so hard to find in Tokyo. We would definitely stay here again!

This hotel located in the centre of the Shibuya, it was very convenience for us. We could walked around, shopping and walked back to the hotel to put the shopping bags or rest for a while then went out again :) The hotel lobby was spacious and the breakfast taste good.

Great location in the centre of everything for tourists. Staff very professional. Didn't eat but the food looked good. Hotel has several restaurants too. And a beauty room.Pillows might be a bit hard for some people - also air con was very warm even on the lowest setting. Make sure you can open the window.

I stayed in this hotel during my business visit to japan.Location was great & so was the checkin staff. The lobby was big & spacious.The only problem was the decor of room was slightly old & some renovation is required.

i was pleased with the service provided by the hotel staffs and the food was awesome as well. I liked the way they treated me , I found hotel clean and room service was good too , and I would like to saty again

Nice location among shibuyaYou can walk through the street that connected as network.Near Onizuka tiger footwear shop,parco,loft Family mart and 7 eleven are next to hotel.Melon bun is opposite,bread lover need to try.For negative, i need more light in room.brighter will be best.But for all this place is best for all.

hotel was in a great location. staff was very accommodating - booked a smoking room, but requested a non-smoking room on a high floor and they provided me with both. hotel held our luggage both before check-in and after check-out. room was very clean. hotel was within walking distance to restaurants and shops. wi-fi in room wasn't the greatest though.

We stayed here for 4 nights on a 2 week holiday to Japan and the location of the hotel is what really makes it shine. The rooms are as the standard Japanese hotels are: small and compact but super clean. Staff were friendly enough and the breakfast is served at the cafe on the ground floor as you enter the hotel. Breakfast is quite good for the price and is of a Western style. I wanted to give a special mention to the decor of this cafe which I would gladly remodel my own office to look like.. Beautifully tasteful, modern and super trendy.Price is a bit expensive but hotels in Tokyo normally are. It's the location close to Shibuya station (8min walk uphill from station to hotel) and proximity to other restaurants and shops around which is why we would definitely be back here again. Really nice area.

We stayed this place for 4 nights, first time in Japan. The staffs were lovely and very helpful. The location is excellent. So close to the main areas of Shibuya. A short walk to the famous crossing and the stations and to all the attraction streets. Easy place to access food and shops. This place made is easy to start our trip.I highly recommend this place to everyone.

Conveniently located in the Shibuya district. It's lovely ambiance welcomes you. A short walk to everywhere interesting! Cordial staff. We even extended our stay. Would definitely recommend to my friends visiting the area soon.

Had a lovely stay at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel in September, it is so clean and tidy, and although the rooms are small it was very efficient, the bed was so comfortable and the pillow was great too, needless to stay we slept very well every night, the staff are very helpful and professional, and know their city very well, even helped us with catching the Bullet train to Mt. Fuji, their directions on how to buy the Shinkansen (bullet train) Tickets were spot on. Hotel is very close to all the great shopping and the Famous Shibuya Crossing and the Hatchiko Statue, very convenient to the train station and YoYogi Park and Meiji Shrine. Will definetly stay here again, when next in Tokyo.

This hotel is just a short walk from Shibuya Station and it is close to a few easy breakfast places. The rooms are small, but clean. The front desk staff is friendly. Our experience was that they spoke limited English, but it was enough to get checked in and find the essentials.

We stayed for one night, hall ways smelled a bit like smoke and were meant to be a non smoking floor - staff where very nice and helpful.Close to the heart of Shibuya, value for money!15morecharacters

The location is amazing! Near the Shibuya crossing and Shibuya station. Many stores and restaurants around.The staff is very friendly and helpful and speak english very well. There is a laundry and a dryer you can use. And a vending machine with drinks in the floor.

The hotel is very well located...at walking distance from Shibuya crossing and Shibuya JR and Subway station.Rooms are small...but very clean.It is the perfect place for first time visiters.Rooms rates are in line with Tokyo standards.

Awesome place to stay in shibuya! Nice view!Clean!Good service!Nice place!Good place to stay!Near family mart and 711!You can leave your bag for last minute shopping if your leaving already! Thankyou!

Good location and not far from the train station. Also close to the shrine and yogi park. The room was small but for the price it was worth it. I would stay again if traveling without the family. The area has great shopping and eating places.

It was a great hotel with great location. Located near shibuya station, shibuya crossing and shopping place, all in 5-10 minutes walking distance. Got 7 eleven and family mart nearby if you happen to get hungry by midnight. Hotel room was ok and staff was friendly. Look forward to stay here again.

Very good!Everything was as se expected, people very nice and polite, room clean, good location. Near Shibuya's center, restaurants, bars, train and subway stations. Good facilities.Good for couples. Good for tourists friends.

It was a nice hotel, located really near to everything, train, shopping and dining place, all in just 5-10 minutes walk distance. You don't have to worry get bored in night since all the entertainment place is walking distance. Room was ok, complete with bathtub, staff was friendly. Look forward to come again in next visit.

Close to the station and convenience stores in Tokyo. Spacious room, very clean, good facilities. Friendly English speaking staff. Comfortable bed, with the option to change the sheets daily if desired.

Stayed at the Tobu Hotel for 2 nights in July.It's a standard hotel in a fantastic location in Shibuya. The rooms are clean and comfortable.It's close to lots of great shopping and restaurants. The hotel is close to Shibuya Station and Yoyogi Park and an easy stroll to Harajuku..

I was stayed at 3 days on this hotel and nice location , easy for shopping , looking for food and meals Near train stations Staff very kinds and helpfull Breakfast very badBed at room very poor cause the matras very badBlankets and toilet very poorNeed to changes

The hotel was decent enough. Room is tiny but its what you should expect in Tokyo unless you have a very big budget. The wifi is really good and the staff are friendly. The location is utterly brilliant. There are literally hundreds of places to eat, drink and explore around this hotel. Its a short walk to Meiji Jingu Shrine, Shibuya crossing and to Shibuya station. We couldnt have been happier with the location and all the things to do in that area.

Good location, near railway station to other places.Near shopping areas and restaurants.Friendly and careful services with self support cafe and Chinese restaurant.The price is acceptable to all normal travellers.

I would have given these guys more, but whether I'd not made my booking clear or they ignored my request for a non-smoking room. that's what I ended up with for the first night of a five night stay. The staff were gracious and apologetic, but if you don't smoke, a smoking room is distastrous. I thought I could sit it out for one night but one hour was enough. I had to go to another hotel for the night, they had no other rooms to offer. So be clear about this when booking Asian hotels in general.The room itself was big enough and reasonably furnished. But being the cheaper one, including my later replacement, it was at the back of the building so I got the double whammy of an opaque window that couldn't open. No view, no air , not a great combo.Location is OK, but up a reasonable hill and a good 5-10 minute walk from the station. The Excel which I stayed at last year has the best location in Shibuya. Even the "non-smoking" room I was relocated to still had cigarette smells. There are no 'no smoking' signs in the rooms and I suspect the largely Japanese businessman clientele blithely ignore the rules.It's a nice enough place, but I think there are better choices in the area.

A great place to stay if you're in Shibuya. It's about 2 minutes walk to the crossing, and that means access to eating and shops. It's just far enough away to not be bothered by the continual drum of noise that happens at the centre, but close enough to be a casual stroll to whatever you're looking for. It's also only a few minutes walk to the station although as it's up a bit of a hill, I wouldn't recommend hauling too much luggage up that way. The rooms are average size for Japan but kept clean and we found the staff some of the best on our stay in Japan. Prices are good and would stay again.

The Good  - Location is walking distance from Shibuya JR Station. It is also near a park. - There are 24 hours convenient store near the hotel, a Family Mart on one side and a 7-Eleven on the other side.  - Internet is free in the Lobby - Our room was cleaned on a daily basis. - There is a vendo machine available inside the hotel. - The Front desk personnel were accommodating and tries their best to assist you even if they speak minimal English. - There are a lot of restaurants near the hotel.The (not so) Bad - The rooms we were assigned in was dated. Furniture and fixtures are showing age.

Very nice and clean room. For the price unbeatable comfort. Excellent service and very friendly staff. The location is top! The extra bed wasn't very comfortable though, that's why I'm not giving five stars.

Stayed here twice now . Better than average size rooms for Tokyo and is 10 min walk from station . We only had one day in Tokyo so better to stay in shibuya as its only three stops on express train back to Narita airport . Very friendly staff and I left some brand new shoes behind which they Mailed to New Zealand . Well worth the money

Our stay in Tokyo was made more worthwhile with our lodging in Shibuya Tobu Hotel. Construction in the hotel was on-going but the stafff made sure we werre accommodated in rooms that would not be bothered by noise. Staff was very accommodating and went out of their way to please.

I book a room for two nights with a semi double bed at this hotel by mid June for a low price and I was a bit scare of getting in a bad place because of the price. Surprisingly the hotel is big and very clean, front desk staff are very polite and speak a bit English. Room and bathroom was a bit bigger than typical rooms in japan, very clean and quiet. No window view. Good ac, nice almost soft bed and pillow (Japanese beds and pillows are hard as hell!). The hotel is in a very centric and save area 10 minutes walking distance from train station. The hotel is going through some renovations in the lobby which is not mentioned in any travel agency and I think is the reason of the low price. There's a bunch of convenience stores and restaurants next to the hotel and even a Deny's in case you miss having an American breakfast. I also want to mention my room was always clean and I forgot in a couple of occasions to put my values and money away and I didn't miss a thing or cent. I really recommend this hotel.
