review_body: Great Location. Rooms are clean and very average but considering the price it was a good deal. Be aware of their recent renovation. Banging, drilling, hammering starts at 9am. You can hear people talking in corridor.

We had a three-bed-room with a tremendously huge double-bed, all with perfect linen quality. The beds were so big, that there was nearly no space left to move in the room. The bathroom war very small, as usual in Tokyo. The staff was friendly and spoke english. The location if the hotel is pefect with only a short walk to shibuya crossing and lots of bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Browsing for hotels with private bathrooms in Tokyo, I found Tobu Hotel. It is one of the cheapest (but still not cheap enough to be considered a budget hotel, for sure) with that criteria in mind. It was located in the heart of Shibuya, but still about ten minutes from the station. The staff were very friendly and offered me a cold towel upon checking in (they also let me check in early.) You have to leave your keys at the reception when you want to go out, and present your card when you get back to get your keys once again, but the receptionist recognized me and didn't ask for my card anymore lol. They charge minimally for outside calls (24 yen for two outgoing calls). Cleaning lady was nice enough to ask me first if I wanted my room cleaned.

The Shibuya Tobu Hotel is very centrally located in a busy area, 7 to 10 minutes walk to the Shibuya subway station. Its a fairly modern hotel but the rooms remain classical. We appreciated its quietness and they kindly gave us a quiet room in response to our request at the time of our booking. The staff of course were friendly (as always in Japan) and helped us reserve a taxi the day of our departure. It's great value for money.

The hotel has a very nice and convenient location. Lot of different places to breakfast nearby. Even if small rooms are very quiet even if in center of Shibuja. Service is excellent and people well know good restaurants around.

If you want to be at the shopping center of Tokyo and is looking for a decent & low budget hotel in Japan, then this might be the hotel for you. My son and I stayed at their twin room and it was good enough for two people. The room was neat and clean and basically had every essentials you need. My only comment would be that it didn't have a cabinet and I wish the room was a little bigger.If you are going to take the train everyday, this is a 8-10 min walk from shibuya station. If you don't want that everyday exercise, check out other hotels nearer the station. Otherwise, I think it is a good hotel and I would consider staying at this hotel again.

Could not fault the location of the hotel in regards to shopping and transport. staff are friendly and most welcoming to tourists. Would recommend this to people wanting to stay in the heart of the city.

While we friends were touring Tokyo we stayed in this hotel for couple of nights. Before I write any further, I must say that the location of this hotel is remarkable. You have seven eleven on one side and family mart on the other. So you don't have worry about if you have late night hunger pangs or massive cravings for midnight beers. Though, the hotel is situated on a less crowded street but it's not far from the happening area. Walk roughly 200 meters and you would get to experience the late night vibe of Shibuya. So staying in this hotel becomes a real deal as you can sleep well in a quite area after enjoying all the late night madness in the back streets. Believe me, Shibuya's night life is immaculate, it is full of restaurants, pubs, karaokes, shopping, 24/7 shops and almost every thing a traveller would love to have. Coming to the room part, the room I stayed in was of a decent size. Even if you call it small, believe me , you haven't seen what small is meant in Tokyo. It was utterly clean and from shampoos to tooth brush it had almost everything. The only downside was it didn't have a big window that could open toward the roadside so that we could enjoy the great view and breath the fresh air. Anyways, it didn't bother us much as we hardly stayed in the room. We only came to the room to get some quick sleep. The hotel has a lot of good restaurants & cafés in its close vicinity. I am a vegetarian and it can be a bit of a challenge to grab a bite of my liking in Tokyo. But thanks to MOS BURGER ( joint next door) I could have my soya patty burger. I thoroughly enjoyed it and delicious is the word for the burger and chips I tasted. There are many bakeries around where you can enjoy scrumptious cheesecakes and hot coffees. Let's talk about prices that this hotel exhibits on different broadcasting channels. I recommend grabbing a deal on makemytrip, booking .com, or on any similar portals disseminating information for tourist destinations & accommodations definitely works out the best. The prices do not burn a hole in your pocket if you book it a week before you plan to travel. Comparing it with other hotels in Tokyo, the kind of overall package ( location, service, room size) this hotel provides, it is very reasonably priced. Overall, I loved my stay here. I would love to stay here again whenever I visit Tokyo next. For now I would say Keep up the good work guys. You made my stay beautiful. Cheers bigtime

Hotel is very comfortable, small rooms, typically for Japan i guess, but perfect for spending a week there. Its in the nicer area of Shibuya, also close to Yoyogi park. Nice shops, not too much traffic. I recommend those who are not into the pricy hotels and want to be in the city. The only thing that bothered me was some of the rooms dont have a proper clear view windows, but a "milk glass" windows.

The hotel was in a good location, walking distance from Shibuya Station.The staff lovely. They let us leave our bags for a couple of hours after checkout while we explored Harajuku. There is a convenience store practically next door. We had a great time and would stay again!

The hotel is located 10 minutes from shibuya station, so the position is perfect! The room was clean but quite small. fortunately we had a small corridor to open the suitcases. Inside the room there was everything, also the yukata and the shoes to use inside the room. the staff was friendly and spoke english. Inside the hotel there was a japanese restaurant and a cafè, but near there are many other places, both for breakfast and launch/dinner.

Great price (we booked early), excellent location, staff were helpful when one of us became ill. We'd stay here again. It was also particularly quiet for the area. Unfortunately, there wasn't any free wi-fi.

I stayed here for one night while I was passing through Tokyo, and I'm glad it was only one night I was here for.The hotel is in a good location, you can walk to Shibuya station and close to all the shops, restaurants and craziness that Shibuya has to offer. Compared to the other hotels expensive rates this property was proved quite well. But you do get what you paid for.The hotel is old and needs refurbishments. Rooms are very small (I know this is typical in Japan, but we were cramped with our two suitcases) Caters heavily for the Japanese tourists with very little help being given to non Japanese speakers.If you only need to stay a night or two max save yourself some money and book here but if you are in Tokyo for a week is spend a bit extra for a larger more modern hotel room.

Great hotel with everything you need. We stayed from 29th March to 4th April 2015. Room size is acceptable, queen bed, with a side table, TV, floor space for 2 huge 28" opened luggage & a toilet with bath tub. I would consider this a real deal at Shibuya. Since we don't smoke, we always choose the non-smoking rooms. Good Location, although it is a 15min walk from Shibuya station to the hotel, ladies might take longer than this to reach the hotel as there are shopping malls like 109, 0101, Zara, Loft, etc along the way. Surrounded by good cafes. 1 min walk from the right is the famous Ivorish French Toast Restaurant from Fukuoka, about 3 min walk is the Disney Store, next to the Disney Store is a building worth exploring. They have lots of fantastic restaurants from 7th floor upwards. Friendly staff who tried their best to answer our queries. Definitely will come back again.

Stayed here from april 5 to 13 with the bf and i must say im very impressed! The location is very good -less than 10 mins walk from shibuya station and next to a family mart :D we stayed in a semi double-smoking room on the 7th floorwhich was bigger than i expected and also did not smell much of smoke which i was happy about! Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were very clean, theres wifi in the room! Would definitely stay here again :)

Over the last 3 years I stayed 4 times at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel and every time it gets better and better. It’s not only ideally located in the heart of Shibuya but it’s also an oasis of calm in the heat of that neighborhood. It’s the ideal location to stay for tourism, whenever you travel on your own or with your family. You are 5 minutes walk from Shibuya Station with the JR Yamanote Line the most important tube line in Tokyo or the NARITA Express train to Narita Airport, a direct train from and to Narita, very convenient once again.From Shibuya Station you are 12 minutes commute from Shinagawa Station where you can easily take a Shinkansen to Kyoto, Osaka, Hiroshima…The staff of the hotel is extremely helpful and very kind to do everything possible to make you feel at ease and satisfied. A smily face will greet you every morning.I have been travelling in a lot of countries and hotels over the last few years and in my home country France or our neighbors Italy they would have a lot to learn from Shibuya Tobu Hotel when it comes to hosting. The rooms have a decent size considering the fact that once again you are in the heart of Tokyo and very important: They are always clean. Since this April 2015 I had the nice surprise to learn that you have now free wi-fi in the bedrooms which is very convenient. Price wise it is very reasonable, I’m not over selling the Shibuya Tobu Hotel but I just compare with what I recently paid for an hotel in Brighton, UK, not even during the busy season which was ludicrously expensive. Other very convenient points: you have a laundry in the hotel and even a dry cleaning service.

This was booked for our last night in Japan so we could get to Narita airport the next day. The hotel was close to the JR Shibuya station, only a 5 minute walk (downhill too), which made it convenient to catch the express train without taking a subway. It was also close to many shops and restaurants in the heart of Shibuya. The hotel itself was a bit worn compared to the other hotels I stayed in while visiting Japan, but then the price of the room also showed that too. It was cheaper than the other hotels, so relatively speaking it was what I expected. Comfortable, clean and quiet during the evening - that was perfect. I probably would not want to stay here more than one or two nights, but it suited my needs for one night.

This hotel has completed all of our expectations, really kind personal, comfortable room and close to shibuya. We would be happy to come back again. Greetings from ramón y virginia. Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

We stayed 1 night for our last day in Japan before leaving from Narita, the hotel is perfect for transport from Shibuya and is right in the heart of the Japanese madness but at the same time is quiet and allows a good nights sleep to recuperate! Would definitely stay here again and recommend it, there were notices about refurbishments but we weren't disrupted at all and the room was clean and felt really spacious compared to other accommodation in the area.

The hotel is very close to Shibuya crossing and station so it was easy to get around (7min walk)Wifi is only available in the lobby but it is very slow during the day. Otherwise you can pay for wifi in the room or bring a loptop and connect with a cable for free.Room good size and comfortable. Would stay again.

If you're looking for an affordable place to stay in the heart of shibuya this is a perfect place to stay. A block away from the hustle and bustle, makes it quiet to have a good night's sleep. The reception was ever-so hhelpful. It is a 5 minute walk from shibuya station so carrying luggage from the train station is not a problem.

The price was very reasonable considering that the hotel is near the Shibuya station and shopping district. From the Shibuya Station (Hachidog exit), it's only about 5-10 mins walk depending on your pace. 24hours cafes, restaurants, and convenient stores are within a 2 min walk from the hotel. You can also pass through yoyogi park and walk to harajuku - probably 15-20 mins. I also like the fact that the narita airport train stops at Shibuya station (although you need to climb a couple of stairs with your luggage).Staff was nice and very accommodating. The room was clean but small (which is normal). You don't have to wait that long for the elevator too. In the lobby, they have a lot of touristy flyers and guides which you can get (e.g. 101 things to do in Shibuya, Mt Fuji Tour, what to do in Shinjuku, etc).Wifi is only in the lobby though. Luckily I had rented a mobile wifi so it wasn't an issue.

Great location! Conveniently located down the street from Shibuya station which is perfect for not only the subway but Narita Express too. Friendly staff! Want a hotel that you can relax after a long day on your feet? Book now.

Clean nice rooms and a friendly staff. We were only there for 2 nights and only were at the hotel to sleep. For that, it was great. We had all we needed. Free wifi in the room would have made it perfect though. So 4 out of 5 stars.

Everybody has been so kind! Good English, the service was very good and the room was really clean. Very good position, net to the metro, restaurants, shops, karaoke and more !! Love it ! Fantastic experience !

Lovely hotel with friendly service. This was our first time staying at Shibuya Tobu and we would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel! It is a very good location close to train station and Shibuya crossing. The room is a little small however is larger than expected and bigger than other hotels we have stayed in. It is a comfortable size with a good size, comfortable bed and is very clean. The bathroom is small, but fine and very clean. Free Wifi is available in the lobby area but not in your room. We had a WIFI router so this was not an issue. It was perfect for our 5 night stay. Made our trip to Japan very enjoyable.

The room are too small and NO wifi or free wifi in the room area. For the lobby wifi, I'm not sure or comment. The hotel to the train station is a bit far. It is about 900 to 1000 meters. For the bus stop, it is just around the corner.

Very good location , very near the shopping mall and easy to find the resturant.The room is big and clean.The breakfast also yummy.The service also good. Just no wifi in the room and limited tv programme.

Bit expensive for what you get- quite a small room, wifi isn't free in the rooms, some staff seemed quite reluctant to help with things such as booking a taxi to the airport at 6am- we were told to stand outside and wait for one to drive past. That being said, it's in a great location.

You have to pay a charge to get wifi, to drink water, to watch tv, ... amazing! I think this hotel is already enough expensive. The worst hotel during my japanese holidays.Staff is not polite. They speak english but they won't help you.My room was so dirty, so disgusting!Choose other hotel!!

I think this was a my third stay, generally very happy but the room had a residual feeling of smokers. The central location, near the skatepark, 2 close by convenience stores, Family Mart and 7-11 to get nice chilled beer and snacks.I usually get the Narita express train from Shibuya but elected to get the bus, this was fantastic except for one thing. A hotel staff member said it was 8 minutes walk to the bus stop. I did a trial run without my snowboard/skateboard bag and it took me 10 minutes and I was not told that the bus stop was on the 5th floor of a hotel! Tobu made a reserved seat booking for me and I was under the illusion I had paid for a ticket and it was charged to my room, no cigar! On flight day I was 30 minutes early to iron out all the issues.I would stay there again but for $200 a night and no wifi in the room, not cool.

We had a pleasant stay at Shibuya Tobu in a 3 person room. Wifi was available in the rooms and lobby and the hotel is not a long walk from Shibuya station. There is lots of shopping nearby and a 7-11 next door for easy access to cash for foreigners.

We arrived in Tokyo on New Year's Eve from a snow trip in hakuba. We arrived by train at shibuya station and the hotel was a 5-10 minute walk from the station, and it was very easy to find. The hotel is in a very central location and close to lots of attractions like the shibuya pedestrian scramble. The hotel room was small but nice and the staff were lovely and spoke English well.

Stayed here for three nights with the family this week and were so disappointed. Hotel is very dated but clean but only two floors of non smoking, so when we arrived there was no availability for two rooms. Two of our children were severe asthmatics so it made our stay extremely difficult. Only good point is the location. Right in the middle of everything.

Nice hotel, about 10 minutes to the Shibuya crossing. A lots of choices of restaurant, shop, bars. The room are very small even for Japanese standard, but well appointed. Unfortunately there is no Wi Fi in the room and I had a tablet, so can't connect to the internet with wire, but they offer me a pocket Wi-Fi for 500Y a day, and you can also use a land line they provide with the wire free. I booked through Booking.com, it was cheaper then booking directly with the hotel. I left my luggage for about 4 days, they kept it without charge.

Cozy hotel with fair price in the heart of Shibuya, friendly hotel staffs. Rooms are bigger than other hotels but could be better with "FREE WIFI" for guests in room. U would recommand Tobu hotel to everyone for their to Tokyo.

Nice hotel, great value. 8 minute walk from the station, tons of things to do in the immediate area. The room is a typical Japanese hotel room, maybe cramped for those used to US hotels. However, it was comfortable and not bad at all as long as you know what to expect.

Good position and very fair price. Near to major interests in Shibuya, shops, mall, bars, restaurants. I enjoyed so much this hotel and the Prince Washington very fair, considering position and the average of other hotels

A few minutes from Shibuya station, nearby to Shibuya 109, Tsutaya books, Shibuya crossing, Hachiko, stores, pubs and restaurants. The service and rooms is ok. I liked the experience in Shibuya Tobu Hotel and i recommend.

It has a great location, in the heart of Shibuya, near Parco Department Store, Apple Store and many others. It's a great option for shoppers and there are many bars and restaurants nearby. I didn't spend much time in my room (Tokyo has too many attractions!), but when I did it was a very comfortable experience.

Stop looking - book this hotel. Location is everything to me and this was brilliant. I wanted to feel like I was in the heart of Tokyo and being five minutes from the famous Shibuya Scramble meant this is exactly what it felt like. The hotel can be easily accessed by Shibuya station and the Narita Express train stops there from the airport. The walk to the hotel is only about 5-10 minutes but it is slightly uphill. There are countless restaurants and shops in every direction and the beautiful Yoyogi Park is close by too. The hotel itself is fine - room is small but was bigger than I expected (and we were in the small double!), had a window and a flatscreen TV with 2 English channels. There was a vending machine down the hall and a restaurant that looked popular in the lobby (we never tried it). Bathroom was clean. Sure - the furnishings are perhaps a bit tired and worn but honestly for the price, this room is a bargain! There is so much to do in Tokyo you will not spend a lot of time in your room but you will be thankful to be super close to one of the biggest transit hubs in the city. The only negative is the lack of in-room wifi. Slightly annoying but it is available in the hotel lobby which was fine and there were plenty of chairs and couches to sit while using it.

Stayed at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel for one night while travelling around Japan.The location was great only about 10mins walk from Shibuya station (15 if you have a heavy suitcase) and you get to cross the scramble crossing to get there as well! Plenty of shops and restaurants around the area so never short of food choices.The hotel room was average size for Japanese standards but the hotel in general was very old and outdated. Just found the decor could do with a bit of updating. Like most other reviewers the no wifi in the rooms was a bit of a negative as well. The outdated decor and lack of wifi didn't ruin our stay by all means and for short stays in Tokyo this hotel would be perfect. I would probably prefer somewhere a bit more modern if I was staying for more than a few nights.

Great location, great value, great service. There is no gym in hotel but Yoyogi park is just couple minutes away for the morning run! Rooms are small but we knew this and we were OK with this.Shibuya station is just 10 minutes walk from hotel and you can easily walk up to Harajuku or Meiji temple in~15 mins.I would highly recommend this place.

Excellent location, as expected tiny rooms but the lack of wifi in the rooms means making plans, meetup with other friends extremely difficult. It should be part of the "SERVICE" just like most other hotels all over the world.

The hotel is well located, far of the chaos of the shibuya station but still close to the metro station and JR lines. The rooms are small but clean, the reception is open 24hr, there are many restaurant, stores, bars and etc on its surrounding. If you forgotten your electricity adapter for mobile phone or laptop in reception they can provide one. The wifi is free only in public areas (like most European hotels), however each room has an Ethernet plug where you can connect your laptop to internet.

Upon check-in, we requested a switch to a room with a queen size bed (king was not available at the time) and they did not charge us extra. The rate is pretty good considering the location and the spacious rooms. Wifi cost an extra 500¥ per day. Not a big deal. The only negative thing I experienced was that I had requested a non-smoking room but we could smell the smoke coming from the room next to us. Other than that, everything was great. P.S. Japan toilets are the best!

The location is perfect in Shibuya, easy walk to the station and also close to Yoyogi park which was great for a morning walk or run. It keeps you out of the chaos of Shibuya but is so close that can be easily accessed. Closely located to heaps of conbini and restaurants. Also not too far to walk into Harajuku if you are so inclined.Staff were really friendly and spoke good English.Make sure if you are a non smoker you are in a non smoking room. We unfortunately had to spend the first 2 nights in a smoking room which was awful as non smokers but were moved as soon as a room was available which made our stay that much more pleasant.I think free wifi in the lobby was sufficient during our stay and I think also made our stay better as there is no distraction of just being in your room on facebook, at least you can people watch in the lobby and it is quite comfortable.If there are good rates for my return to Tokyo mid next year I would definitely consider rebooking.

This hotel is right in the heart of the Shibuya district and about 15 minutes walk from Harajuku. A great base for shopping and nightlife. The hotel itself is a bit old and the interior a bit dated. Rooms are small (like most Japanese hotels) but clean and comfortable. Overall its pretty good value.

The room was quite compact but the location was amazing! It is centrally located and station was walking distance. Lots of food joints close by. It was value for money. The only problem is the wifi is only in the lobby and not in the rooms.

Centrally located on a good location, walking distance from Shibuya station. Neat, clean and tidy and has almost all basic facilities in room. Front desk staff speaks english.However, room is really small, and doesn't have space to keep the luggage etc. Also no Wi-Fi in room, it's only available in the lobby. If you need wifi in room you have to pay some $5 extra.

We decided to stay in Shibuya because it's one of the best locations for shopping, nightlife and convenient access to all of Tokyo, and chose Shibuya Tobu Hotel for it's central location close to Shibuya Station as well as its moderate rates. We were not disappointed, because for this location it was a really worth every cent.The hotel is easy to find from Shibuya Station (use Hachiko Exit, cross Shibuya Scramble and continue along the street between Tsutaya and 109 Men's department stores until you reach the fork in the road with 0101 City department store. Continue up the left street towards PARCO department store until you reach the hotel on your left hand side) and located amidst tons of small restaurants and convenience stores (my favorites: Saint Marks Cafe - Choco Cro for breakfast and MOS Burger, both located in the building next to the hotel - same building as 7Eleven).Even though both exterior and interior are a bit dated, the hotel offered all ammenities a city traveller could wish for (helpful front desk staff who spoke OK English, free luggage storage, ice and vending machines on every other floor, free WiFi in the Lobby and LAN in the room, huge TV with 2 English channels, small fridge, kettle and tea bags, slippers, nightgowns, hairdryer, shampoo, body wash, toothbrush, razor, etc.). Of course the room and bathroom are small, but that's normal in Tokyo. I found the room and the bed quite comfortable and it was very clean. It was a pleasant surprise that the room was really quiet even though it was smack in the middle of Shibuya.The only thing I didn't like was that they changed all our towels every day, even though they had cards saying that the hotel wants to safe resources, so they would only change the towels if you place it in the bathtub, not if you hang them up on the rack. Every day we hung/left some towels (2 small, 2 big ones) on the rack and the ones to replace in the bathtub or on the floor, but every day all 4 of them were replaced.It is good to keep in mind that check-in is at 2pm and check-out at 11am - no exceptions made unless you're willing to pay - and that there is no WLAN available in the rooms. We solved this problem by bringing a laptop and LAN cable, as there is a LAN outlet in each room.

The no internet shocked me.There was definitely no wireless. It's possible that the ethernet jack in the room did supply internet, but I somehow doubt it. Other than that, no complaints. I thought it was a little overpriced, but to be fair, I did book VERY last-minute. Clean room, polite staff. Checking out late was easy and in my case was a god send, but they do charge you 1000 yen per hour after checkout time (11am).

Right the heart of Shibuya, very accessible from Shibuya station. Very good price/quality ratio for a hotel so close to all shopping and restaurants areas.A very good option if you intend to both stay for shopping or simply enjoy the weekend's nightlife of Tokyo!

It was nice location, I stayed a twin room. Wash room was small. It takes about 15 min from the subway station. breakfast was ok. Officers were nice and they can speack english. There are lots of restaurants, bars and shops.

Hotel room is very small (really small !) but clean, nice & warming service staff (English speaking) the location is fantastic, Center between Harajuku and Shibuya area (15 mins walk) compare to price, it's really worth to stay.

Hotel rooms are small but very clean. Shibuya is great for shopping and restaurants. Staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a happy hour at thd hotel bar. Only negative is the pillows are uncomfortable.

We stayed here last week for three nights. We had tried different hotels, and this one was our least favourite one. But for the price we paid, it was fine.The hotel is definitely of an older date. It was clean for the most part, but in our room there was undistinguishable stains on the walls.The breakfast buffet was average. The first morning a lot of the food was gone including the coffee, and was not refilled even though there was an hour before the breakfast closed. The worst part of staying in this hotel, was that there was no wifi in the room. The only way you could get internet was as far as I could make out, in the lobby on some PCs. We were not informed about any of this. We used our portable wifi hotspot we had rented, but the signal and reception in the room was very very poor.All in all, things that can be ignored because it was a cheap stay, and it is what you can expect. The location was great though. Just 7 minutes walk to Shibuya Station and Crossing.

I was really surprised that the location was really good. For the cost, it's really worth the stay. Room was really small but as a solo traveller, it was fine. The hotel was even able to help me book a taxi to Haneda airport at a discounted rate, almost 2000 yen off the usual price. Great choice.

Had a 2 week stay in this hotel and it was great. The staff were very helpful and organised activities for us. They also helped with any train journeys we had by advising of train lines and how long journeys would take. The rooms were very clean. We had a twin room which had a bed side cabinet, a table and chair, dressing table and chair. Fridge, hairdryer and kettle. There was a full length mirror and a bathroom with bath and shower. The hotel is in a fantastic location. One way you are in the centre of Shibuya and the other way you are in Harajuku. Shibuya station is very nearby and you can get to lots of other towns very easily. If I came to Japan again I would stay at this hotel.

I was traveling with a friend and we stayed in a total of 4 places in Japan. This hotel was probably our favourite. The rooms weren't all that small for Tokyo, in fact there was ample space in our twin share room. A third person could have easily fitted in. The rooms were super clean, the staff always tried their best to help us. They even let us borrow umbrellas on the first day we got there as it was raining. It's the location that's the most appealing about this hotel. Just outside there are shops, restaurant, cafes, karaoke places to be visited. It's a short walk from Shibuya station and the scramble crossing. Being two girls walking back late at night to the hotel, we felt very safe as the location was always alive and bustling with people. The only reason this gets four stars from me is that wifi isn't free in the rooms. You can, however, use free wifi in the lobby so if you're happy to get all your social networking done there then you'll have no worries! I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a nice, central location.

If you want a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of bustling Shibuya, this is a very good option. It's so well located, next to plenty of bars, restaurants and shopping, and is a 7 minute brisk walk from the Shibuya station. The rooms though are very, very tiny (OK, I know this is Tokyo, but still), and not very comfortable. For instance, there wasn't even a cupboard to keep your stuff in. Just a bed, desk, TV, and a shelf to keep and hang stuff off.However, it was clean and had everything you require, including night suits, (long night shirts really) an electric kettle, and a hair dryer. They don't have free wi-fi in the rooms (only in the hotel lobby), but you can rent a wi-fi router for 500 yen/day from the reception. Final word: If you're thinking of an action-packed holiday where you only use the room to sleep at night, Tobu is a good option. If you like a little more luxury and nice hotel restaurants etc, maybe skip this one.

The Room - First time in Tokyo and was told to expect small rooms,lo and behold! The rooms are tiny! As tiny in Paris but seems they swap the cabinet space for toilet space. Got a double room which is a snug fit for 2 people with travelling backpacks. But they do make it up with the spacious toilet (with a, surprise surprise,small tub) and cleanliness. Bed's hardness is medium but the two pillows are filled with some seeds at the bottom which might lead to some uneasiness. They do provide nightwear. The usual amenities such as TV, soaps, kettle and fridge are present but if you want a vanity pack you'd have to like their facebook page and show to the front desk officer. No in-room wifi and mineral water.The Service - Check in was not a problem as the staff understands English. They are quite helpful and will take time to explain to you the trivialities that is Japanese room. Its more of a self service hotel with ice machines on certain floors and wifi only in the lobby.The Location - Shibuya is a busy place with many shops such as Bic Camera and Tokyu hands around. The hotel is not located at these areas but up the streets right at the top of the knoll. Just make your way up from Starbucks for about 10 mins, past Kirin Bar and you'll find the hotel with a Family Mart nearby. There's Tower records to the right about a block away and Dannys' nearby for reference.  Shibuya crossing is iconic. Coming out from the Shibuya station you get to see the famous crossing where all traffic stops to let the masses travel from left to right,right to left, diagonally and horizontally. The Good - Location location location. Despite being in one of Tokyo's busy districts, the Hotel finds itself in an oasis of calm. The Bad - The tiny room, lack of wifi and weird pillows...

We had a pleasant stay in this hotel. We visited Tokyo in time for the Hanami or Cherry Blossoms viewing, we are just lucky that there are still available rooms that time We booked thru booking.com month before our trip .The weather is good with temperature between 15-21 C. Hotel is near the Shibuya station where the statue of Hachiko is located. There are lots of boutiques nearby. We will surely be back.

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, it's around 10 minutes away from Hachiko but with so many sites to see along the way the distance from the station is a breeze. One minute away from the hotel is the lively side of Shibuya, but the hotel itself is quiet and calm. Nice restaurants around the hotel (great udon place called Hanamuru) there's a nice Kirin drinking bar and a nice Pub just 2 minutes away!! Note: i accidentally wrote this review using another log in but will use this profile for all my reviews

Location was extremely convenient as it was situated in Shibuya. The rooms were also very tidy and fresh. However there is no wifi in the room, only in the lobby. For 3 people, the room is also extremely small but still good value for money. The staff were very helpful though.

We stayed here for 4 nights and it was great. The hotel staff are friendly and the rooms were clean, although a little small (but you have to expect that in Tokyo), and the maids will make up your room daily if you put the sign on your door. The hotel is in the perfect location - there is a Family Mart (convenience store with really good prices), Kirin Beer Garden, Starbucks and MOS Burger within about a 50m radius of the hotel. It is also a short walk from Shibuya station which is on the Yamanote line which circles the city, so you can get almost anywhere really quickly. The only drawback would be the lack of wifi in the rooms (you can access it in the foyer) but I guess that just prevents you from hanging out in your room on your phone all day!

Value for money with great location. Walking distance to train station, so is easily accessible to anywhere. The hotel is 5 mins away from famous Shibuya crossing. It is also located near Menji shrine which is worth to visit. Many restaurants and shopping malls near to hotel, so do not have to go far for shopping .

The trip was indeed made comfortable by the cooperative staff. We had to book a smoking room as non-smoking rooms were not available while booking online. But when we reached the hotel and requested the reception to look for a non smoking room, we were accommodated in less than five minutes! The rooms were clean, well ventilated and the linen was fresh. Normal room supplies were always maintained. I wish they had some simple food arrangements to suit the palate of the travellers because they are in the hospitality business and a restricted food option is not a good thing. That is why they get a 4 star and not a 5 star rating from us. Strongly recommend the hotel for all pleasure travellers! Best of luck Tobu.

Our trip was a group of 4 so we choose to stay together in one room. The room was a bit small for 4, you can't open all luggage in the same time unless u'll have no space to walk. The extra bed is a bit hard and not comfortable but the rest was best we switch sleep on that bed. The location was the best thing for this hotel you can easily find some thing to eat, go to shopping , night life, subway are near by and no smoking smell in my room! :) lastly the bathroom is very new and clean not too small love it

Staff is borderline incompetent, and doesn't understand the fundamental logic of "Wifi". When I asked for wifi password, they told me I needed to "rent" a cable. When I was under the impression that wifi was included, imagine my surprise that not only do I need to rent a cable for a "wireless" internet connection, the limited communication skills of the staff do little to move the issue towards resolution.Also the plugs in the hotel don't support international standard inputs, even for a basic laptop input. I needed to go to a store & actually purchase a convertor for just the input; again maybe my expectations were not realistic, but I thought this hotel had some of the basic commodities of international hotels.If you need a basic hotel that doesn't provide anything other than a mediocre bed to rest in, then I recommend Shibuya Tobu Hotel. If you're a traveler that expects basic electrical inputs or internet access that doesn't require excessive efforts, avoid Shibuya Tobu Hotel. I doubt the proud incompetent staff would even care of the content of this review.- Businessman

Second time staying at Shibuya Tobu Hotel and loved it!!24 hour service desk with english speaking staffGreat location close to Shibuya station and a short walk to Omotesando and Harajuku.Room was cleaned every day at 11:00amWifi in the lobby and staff will hold you bags after you check out if you have a late flight.Also two restaurants in the hotel one which does breakfast.

We were visiting Japan and stayed at Tobu hoter location was very good, close to train station and night life Dennys restaurant is one block away. We stayed at Japan for 13 nights and we loved it.Room was small as must of Japans hotel, bathroom was ok in size, very clean. Reception personnel were very friendly and area spacious and nice.Food at Japan is very good with many varieties to chose from. Japanese are very polite, helpful and friendly. Information at train station and restaurants are in inglish. At present yen is same as dollar so it was not expensive.For my husband and me it was on of the best trips ever and we have being around

We stayed 5 nights with my teenage children and my husband. The hotel has the perfect location in a very nice area and surrounded by 7Eleven, Family Mart and other nice facilities. The rooms (we booked 2 rooms) had the perfect size. The beds were big enough 165 cm and 145 cm. The mattress and pillows were wonderful, the cleaning impeccable. We had in each room a kettle and free tea for make our stay more comfortable; we also had slippers and bathrobe. The rooms had very good thermal and acoustic insulation; as a result we could sleep deeply!Regarding the staff, all of them were very ready to lend a hand, helpful and friendly. They helped us a lot. They also printed us maps and timetables for trains and buses. They agree with everything we asked. They were wonderful. I have to say that all the staff speak and understand English perfectly (even the room ladies).I have been in other places as New York, Paris, London, Rome, Madrid… And this is one of the best hotels I have ever been. August I truly recommend this hotel and the next time I go to Tokyo I will stay again in it for sure!

Whilst not showy nor roomy(no Japanese Hotels are), I have stayed on 3 occasions and found the hotel very comfortable. It has the added attraction of being at a NEX stop(Shibuya) and short walk from the train station to the hotel. There are several restaurants in the basement area, if you wish to eat in and a great lobby restaurant that serves breakfast as well as other meals. If you want a good hotel in a good location at a good price, I can recommend. Going back next week for 6 nights.

Barry F
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed there for 3 nights with my family. Good choice for Shibuya area, close to Shibuya station, Scramble Crossing Walk of course and find so many shops. We were happy with The hotel is nice and clean, fast WIFI but only in the lobby, very small rooms for 3 people but is okay.

My family and I stayed there for 6 nights and we loved it! Friendly personnel, perfect location and all in all a really good hotel! There is LAN in the rooms and Wlan in the lobby, which is perfect when you're travelling with a laptop. There are also two PC's in the lobby which you can use for 100yen (70 cents) per 10 minutes

I stayed there for 5 nights with my friends. We were happy The hotel is very nice and clean.good breakfast, fast WIFI in the lobby,very small rooms,I stayed there for 5 nights with my friends. We were happy The hotel is very nice and clean.good breakfast, fast WIFI in the lobby,very small rooms,

The hotel is very nice and clean. It's in a very convenient location, just couple of blocks away from Shibuya crossing. I stayed there for 3 nights with my fimily. We were happy about it. The only cons is that in room wifi isn't free. Though you can access free wifi at the Lobby area.

Friendly crew speaking NO english, good breakfast, fast WIFI in the lobby, very good location, overall very good price/quality considering very small rooms, Shibuya is very nice and in close proximity lije te station (JR lines)

Location wise is perfect! Easy access to everywhere. The room and the hotel is very clean.However the room is a bit smaller compared to othervhotel and the room rate is also a bit pricey thats probably because of the location.

Good hotel, great location easy walk to Shibuya crossing, station and Harajuku, Meiji Jingu. No problems walking around late at night good bars and restaurants close by, we would definitely stay there again.

This is a typical Japanese business hotel: small rooms but impeccably clean with professional service. I would happily return. It's about a ten minute walk from Shibuya station (Hachiko) and close to lots of shopping and restaurants.

Tobu Hotel is close to the train station and a lot of shops. Famous Takeshita Dori is also walking distance from this hotel. The rooms are relatively small but very neat and practical for the occupants.What we love about this hotel is the staff's excellent service.

I spent five nights in this hotel and my family and I love the hotel. The hotel is relativelly small compares to luxurious hotel, but my living experiences there was superb. The hotel located near station, maybe about 10 minutes walking distance, the shibuya station, where the famous hatchiko dog museum is in the vicinity. The services was superb. The cleanliness was perfect. The staffswere very helpful, alhtough there were some occasions that we couldnot communicate because language barrier, but the staffs again very enthusiastics and very helpful. There were lots of 24 hours shops nearby to buy my daily needs,, such as soft drinks, snacks etc. There was free wifi in lobby area, but not in guests rooms, but it's not a peoblems, since I spent most of the times outside the hotel.

Hotel is located in a superb location. Near lots of good food outlets, shopping and busy area. 8 minutes walk to Shibuya station and easy to move around. Convenient stall is just located near hotel for getting drinks and snacks. Hotel is small but comfortable and good value for the price.

Tobu hotel is a really good example of value for money in tokyo, compared to other hotels on the same region, that Can be double the price. If you are on holidays and don't spend to much time at the hotel, that should be a good option. The worst point is that the internet Wifi only works at the lobby, that is shame when you think about the technology in Japan.

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, it's around 10 minutes away from Hachiko but with so many sites to see along the way the distance from the station is a breeze. One minute away from the hotel is the lively side of Shibuya, but the hotel itself is quiet and calm. Nice restaurants around the hotel (great udon place called Hanamuru) there's a nice Kirin drinking bar and a nice Pub just 2 minutes away!!

Was recommended this little gem by a friend and it was great!Convenient location: 5-8 min walk from Shibuya Station (Hachiko Exit); lovely tree lined 15 min walk from Harajuku Station, both on the main JR Yamanote circle line so you can use your JR pass and train for free. 10 min walk to a side entrance of Yoyogi Park (the main entrance was at Harajuku Station); 15 min walk to Takeshita Street in Harajuku. There are a few cafes and convenience stores located nearby in case you need anything as well.Good sized: We got a standard double room, beds are 140cm wide, which is actually 3 cm larger than the standard Australian double. Room was large enough so they didn't have to put the bed up against the wall which is good night. In other hotels, between hubby and I, whoever sleeps up against the wall has a tendency to knee it in the middle on the night! Hubby had travelled to Japan before and was impressed by the size of the bathroom by Japanese standards (i.e. the shower wasn't directly over the loo). There was a bathtub with a curtain and a shower head instead. Clean: The hotel room and bathroom was clean and they provided shampoo, conditioner and body wash in dispensers. There were also some other amenities such as toothbrushes, razors, shaving gel, disposable hairbrushes - things that you would not think of really!We didn't try to find WiFi as we had our own, but I believe there was complimentary WiFi or cabled internet available in the lobby. Staff at the hotel were friendly, nice and spoke sufficient english (some spoke english incredibly well) to help us with anything we wanted. We asked for a non-smoking room and actually got a non-smoking room - hubby's past experience (at a different location) wasn't so. Can't think of any negatives - we loved this spot!

Desided to stay in Shibuya while visiting Tokyo. I haven't noticed any negative sides of the hotel. It is neat, there is Internet access via cable (which was the thing I needed), very polite personnel, many cafes and FamilyMart nearby.

We stayed at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel for three nights. It is in a fantastic location. There is a Family Mart right next door and it is a short walk from the Shibuya train station. Take the Hachiko exit, cross the very busy intersection and stand facing Starbucks. Take the street on the right, then the second left. Pass Parco an your left and it is just up the road. The hotel staff spoke quite good English and were very helpful. The breakfast was ok. It was a mixture of Japanese style and Western style. I had bacon and eggs and toast. There was also fruit, cereal and yoghurt on offer. We had a twin room of a pretty good size by Japanese standards. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate and very clean. No free wifi in the rooms was a big minus. It was free in the lobby but we didn't find out until our last day that we could have hired a router from the hotel for a cheap rate (we were told by another tourist that you could get wifi for ¥500 per day). Still not sure if that is true because we didn't know about it and we were leaving when we heard out about it. We caught the Haneda airport bus from bus stop 92 which is located on the fifth floor of the Shibuya Mark City East building (across from the Shibuya station). The Narita bus leaves from around there too. I would stay at this hotel again especially if Wifi is available in the rooms. There are lots of restaurants around and great shopping.

The most positive point for the hotel is its location near Shibuya station (if you like shopping, restaurants and bars). Not too expensive, but no free wifi in the rooms and we had a leak in the bathroom.

The Shibuya Tobu Hotel was exactly what I needed for a short stay in Tokyo. It is close to the major Shibuya Station, with lots of great restaurants and attractions within walking distance. The room was immaculate, and the staff extremely helpful (even with limited English). Safe area at all hours. I cannot imagine a better place for my needs while in Japan.

This property is in the centre of town and walking distance to train station. The room is adequate but no free wifi in the room and no drinking water provided..The breakfast is very poor for what they charge.

I went through a third party site. They pulled a bait and switch. I did not get the kind of room I needed. The room I got was littye more than a closet with dirty, peeling wallpaper. Definitely not room for 2 people. Should have had 2 twin beds. Got 1 tiny bed. My son slept on the floor. Will never stay there again nor will I recommend.

We stayed there for 5 nights, the ubication is more than convenient, the staff is kind and the rooms are good for a reasonable price, I would defenetly stay here once again and will highly recommend it.

nice hotel,a little bit small rooms but in case of location it is not an issue, helpful stuff and invisible in a good way ) recommended place to stay around Shibuya - downhill are all the shops and clubs uphill beautiful architecture and huge yoyogi park, harajuku is around 15min by foot

Great location. Shibuya is a good place to base yourself if you are wanting to look around Tokyo.Room is a little small but that is usual for Tokyo. We had a window but it was frosted glass so couldnt see out it. We were never in the room so just treated this hotel as someowhere to sleep and it was perfect for that!

My family and I loved our stay here. It is a rather old hotel, needs some updating but for its price and location we would stay here again. We also enjoyed the quiet vicinity it is in yet it is a few minutes on foot from Shibuya crossing. Harajuku and the Meiji Shrine is 12 minutes away too.

I had a last-minute booking (just 1 day before arrival in Tokyo) and this hotel did not disappoint. I stayed here for a total of 4 nights, and I was so glad I chose to stay in the vibrant Shibuya area! Approximately 7-minute walk (moderate pace) from JR Shibuya Station. Get out from the main exit, walk to the famous Tsutaya building (where there is also a Starbucks), round the bend and keep walking straight, passing by Parco and Miu Miu, and the hotel is just ahead.For the price that I'd paid, location was certainly a huge plus point. It's at the quiet end of the busy Shibuya shopping street, and yet safe with several restaurants and cafes around the area. Yoyogi Park and Meiji Shrine are also approximately a 15-minute walk away, and Harajuku, 20 minutes on foot. Hotel was clean and equipped with toiletries and other basic amenities. Space of the room was sufficient. No wardrobe, just hangers (approximately 6) but that's probably what made the room slightly more spacious. Absolutely fine with me. The (minor) minuses: Table was too small (it was triangular-shaped) and no freezer in the mini-fridge to contain my ice cream. "Fake" window ie no view. Staff might not be able to speak too much English, but it wasn't too much of an issue for me personally, as I speak some Japanese. Very strict with the check-in time of 2pm (I'd arrived earlier at 1230pm)Ultimately, for its price though, this hotel met my expectations. I would stay here again!

Very pleasant stay at Shibuya Tobu. Minutes by foot from Shibuya Station, in the middle of a very active, young part of town, yet very quiet. Nice rooms and a very friendly and efficient staff. Breakfast buffet with a good variety. Wi-Fi in the lobby was perfectly sufficient for my needs.

We love this hotel for it's friendly and helpful staff, it's perfect location and price. Will hopefully return again. Shibuya is excellent area to stay in when visiting Tokyo, and the hotel location is very close to the train station with connection to almost all trains and subways.

The hotel was very quiet, we had no trouble sleeping. The rooms were fairly clean and the staff was more than accomodating. The only drawback was the lack of wireless internet in the room, although there was access in the hotel lobby.

the staff were helpfull and polite i was dissapointed that we were charged for wifi in our room even though it was advertised on trip advisor as having free wifi - the response was at front desk that this only including it in the lobby - i think this was a bit misleading the breakfast was great and definitely worth it good position also another powerpoint or 2 in the room woud have been handy

One cannot believe how peaceful this place is considering that Shibuya is one of the busiest parts of Tokyo that is so full of life!The rooms are quite small but its great if you're sight-seeing and shopping all day and coming back only to sleep at night. We had requested for an early check-in but the request wasn't entertained as such and that was a bit disappointing as we had travelled far and long. We didn't have any meal at the hotel and hence, no review of the food. Shibuya is buzzing with life and there are loads of good eating joints- even for those who are looking for burgers and pastas!The location of the hotel is mind-blowing and I would highly recommend this hotel!

They advertise that they have air conditioning but they turn it off during the winter and spring months so you only have heating. Not ideal if you don't want to open the window. Rooms are very small but that is to be expected Otherwise good location.

Perfect trip in tokyo, shibuya is really the place to be, tobu hotel is perfectly located in Shibuya. Rooms are perfect : clean, well equiped, service is perfect...I will remember this trip and this hotel !

Our recent stay at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel was a great welcome to our first time in Japan.We had booked our stay through a travel agent in Australia & she had assured us that this hotel was in one of the most central locations in Japan and therefore extremely easy to catch trains, walk to restaurants, shopping and sights. For example- Shibuya is close to Harajuku, Famous temples and shrines as well as many shopping malls.The hotel met all our expectations and the staff were so helpful- as we had extensive questions for them and they were able to go above and beyond for each of our requests even when some of the staff were not confident with speaking English to us.We would like to commend 'Okamoto Hiroshi' at the front desk who always helped us with every request during our 4 night stay in Tokyo. We look forward to returning back to the Tobu Hotel on our next trip to Japan.

New York City, New York

review_body: It is my 3rd time in two years at Shibuya Tobu Hotel. 7 nights in 2012, 2 nights in 2013, 6 nights in 2014 and I must say that I have never been disappointed. The hotel is ideally located, I repeat: IDEALLY LOCATED.The rooms are comfortable and clean and their size is acceptable regarding the fact that its located in Tokyo and in one of the most exciting place of the city: Shibuya. The staff is amazing, very kind and professional. I will definitely come back to that hotel and recommend it.

The location is perfect, but i think that to have wifi in the room is a must and if you want it you have to pay an extra charge. The price is good, but it could be cheaper because the room is not very big. You will have hairdryer, shampoo, etc that's cool.Thanks

I love where the hotel is located as it is near the JR Shibuya station as well as the subway station. Shibuya Crossing is just a few streets away. Family mart and 7-11 are just around the corner. With respect to the hotel, I would have rated it as a four-star hotel EXCEPT for the fact that I have to shell out 2,000 yen for the rent of my wifi connection for four days! Hello, the wifi connection should have been a perk. I also stayed in Kyoto and Osaka and the wifi in the hotels I stayed in are ABSOLUTELY FREE! I do hope that next year when I come back to Tokyo and stay in this hotel again, the wifi will already be a perk.

If i was to grade the hotel, it should only be a 3-star hotel. However the stay itself made it to 4-star. :)The room was small but adequate for one person with the double bed. If 2 persons are staying, it may be a bit tight. As with all Japan hotels, the room though small had all the necessary, toilet with warm seat and bidet, hand soap, shampoo, shower gel, toothbrushes, combs, tea, water kettle, bedroom slippers and hairdryer. Nothing more i could ask for at the very reasonable rate i was paying.I stayed in a smoking room, when i first entered the whole room had the smell of smoke. Thank goodness for the air purifier in the room which made it a lot better after a few hours. Trust the Japanese to be so meticulous that even an air purfier was available. The room was very clean, housekeeping did a great job. Drinks dispenser (payable) and Ice dispenser (complimentary) was available in the lobby of every floor.The location was excellent! It was close to practically everything- the Jr station, major departmental stores, small shops, convenience store, restaurants, cafes, Zara, H&M etc. To stay in such a centralised location at the very affordable rate would have made Tobu hotel a top choice for many. For shoppers, this is only a few Jr stops away from Harajuku and Shinjuku. Convenient indeed.Staff was helpful although limited by the language but they were polite and tried their best to understand my questions.There is only one drawback, wifi is not available for free in the room. Overall a wonderful stay! :) Thank you for the enjoyable and pleasant stay.

The hotel is close to everything you want to be in Shibuya and can be also very quiet and confortable. The staff is very helpful and kind. And they speak good english (which is not common in Tokyo).There is a FamilyMart (convenience store) right next door.

Slightly old fashioned look, with key locks to the doors. My airconditioner didn't seem to work much, but there was also an extra unit in the room so no problem. Only smokers room was available when i booked, but it didn't smell like a smokers room. Quiet rooms in spite of being in the middle of shibuya. five minute walk from the station, 10-15 min to harajuku and the meiji temple. Friendly and helpful staff. Very good value for little money. My only wish is that they would have WIFI in the rooms, not only in the lobby.

Good location, near train (JR) and subway. Excellent neighbourhood for shopping. Lots of good restaurants and cafes. Nice hotel, nice staff. Rooms are a bit small, but they are all small in hotels in Japan...

The hotel is in a convenient location and easy to find.The staff weren't interested in going out of their way to help. I read in previous reviews the the staff had booked robot restaurant for guests and having read on robot restaurant website it was best to book I asked the hotel front desk to please call and book for me. They insisted it wasn't necessary and to just turn up. We called the restaurant our selves and they were booked the next 2 nights, I would have been pretty angry if I'd just turned up after the hotels advices! Not happy with the hotels service. The room was clean and a good size.

The hotel is clean, and the staff is nice...the location is KILLER! so close to everything...seriously its one of the best locations if you want to stay within walking distance to Harajuku and Shibuya...i have been to Tokyo tons of times, but just discover this hotel...takes me 15 min to walk to harajuku and 5 min to be at Shibuya crossing (if you want to go there), tons of restaurants close by, convenience stores, and tons of shopping. This will def be my go to Hotel in Tokyo. The rooms are small but they are manageable, since most likely you wont be in the room the whole day when in Tokyo. But although small, everything was clean and neat. No safe, but theres a small fridge and a large screen TV. Great little hotel!

Love my time staying there. The room is a bit small but it is enough for a single or couple without kids. The room is extremely clean and you will find necessary stuff like fridge, hair blower and coffee machine there. The wifi is not free so you may need your own 4G hotspot for your travel anyway

New York City, New York

review_body: Very Good Hotel and bang on main road. Near to Shibuya station and happening place. I am missing my hotel and room.We enjoyed every movement of our stay. only thing I was missing WIFI in room. Which is basic these days and Hotel management to look in to this.

Great place to stay in Shibuya, shopping is within minutes away. Great service from hotel staff, clean rooms. Enough room for 3 girls, with twin beds and an additional extra bed. But little space for 3 large luggage, making packing a little difficult. Toiletries are provided, which is a bonus. No WIFI provided in the rooms, but it is available in the hotel lobby. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Hotel is somewhat hidden but once you find it, it's a great location in Shibuya! It's close to everything such as shopping, places to eat where prices are reasonable and most of all, it is close to the train station and the Shibuya crossing! I would definitely recommend to stay at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel for future travels to Japan!

Location was pretty good near the Shibuya crossing, though not a lot in this area other than shops! Despite this being one of the 'nicest business hotel' from a lonely planet book in 2010, it's in serious need of updating throughout. Room was small but adequate, bathroom was tiny. No wifi in the room which I think is also outdated.Not really worth the price we paid, but then it is Tokyo.

Ideal hotel for a stay in the Shibuya area. Quiet hotel, only a 10 min walk from the Shibuya crossing / station. Kind staff. Very good value, especially for the triple and quad rooms. Clean and, not too small rooms. Decent breakfast. A recommendation.

The hotel is ok, rooms are ok, nothing very fancy, nothing that makes you think "wow, this is cool". The staff is nice but nothing crazy.However, we booked 3 rooms, 2 were 25% more expensive than the 3rd one, and the 3 rooms were exactly the same size, same standing. The staff couldn't justify it. Quite annoying.

We loved our two night stay at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Really nice room. It is very close to the JR station and within walking distance of lots of shops and restaurants in the area. The staff were really helpful and efficient.

No-frills hotel located in the hip Shibuya city, 5 mins' walk from the famous Shibuya Scramble Crossing.Surrounded by countless eateries and shopping malls, it is bustling with life.It may be difficult locating the hotel from the train station at first, but follow closely to the map and it should take no more than 15 mins.Simple hotel with small rooms but great concierge staff who were helpful and could speak basic English.Free WiFi only in the lobby.Overall good for a shopping trip but would not recommend if you have a lot of luggages because hotel is located on a slope!

Really amazed at the location. Easy access to rail and people very friendly and helpfull. The place is always buzzing. Recommend the Chelsa Hotel for the live music scene. Endless choices of little places to eat out of.

Stayed in a twin smoking room. Location is fantastic. 5minute walk from Shibuya Station, Hachiko exit. 10 minute walk to Harajuku station and Takeshita Dori. 10minute walk to Yoyogi Park which has 2 outdoor basketball courts! Room was big enough for me and my father, I didn't realise I'd booked smoking which kinda sucked, you can definitely smell it, but that was my mistake. I'm not usually too fussy with pillows, but I found these quite uncomfortable. That would be my only complaint. The staff were fantastic, their english satisfactory, we were able to leave our bags in the lobby on the day of check out.

The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic for someone who wants to be in the heart of things, both day and night. Shibuya Crossing is just around the corner, restaurants are everywhere (a great noodle place next door), convenience stores within a couple minutes walk and within walking distance of Yoyogi Park and Harajuku.The hotel itself is quiet and clean. Free wifi and information pamphlets in the lobby. Enough English spoken by staff for quick checkin, luggage hold and some small gifts for sale. The rooms were decent sized by Japanese standards with a couple English channels on the TV. The fridge and toiletries are very handy. The only negative I can think of is the pillows were like rocks but I don't think that's uncommon in Japan.I stayed 5 nights here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel or to stay here again.

I stayed for 6 days in this clean and nice hotel. It's in the center of everything in Shibuya may be in Tokyo. You can easily walk everywhere and go everywhere. It's so close by walking to Harajuku also. I highly recommend this hotel. And I will be staying for sure for the second time. Small Hint: Don't stay in the rooms which are back side of the hotel. It might be a little bit noisy.

After a one night stay back in November 2011, we chose to base ourselves at the Shibuya Tobu for the duration of our 10 night stay this time. Shibuya is such a fun part of Tokyo that it makes a fantastic base. The heart of Shibuya can be a bit manic, yet at only 5 minutes' walk away the hotel is in a much quieter area. Service is competent and polite, semi-double room is small but clean, location is FANTASTIC! One little annoyance is there's no luggage rack in the semi-double. Even this small and basic addition would have made a big difference in terms of space, as it means everything (eg two large suitcases, plus whatever shopping you do!) has to sit on the floor - and there's not a lot of floor to spare!You may not realise, but no more that 5 minutes walk away (in the other direction to where you will normally be coming from) is Yoyogi Park. A nice quiet green space, well-utilised by Tokyoites wanting to escape the hustle and bustle, do some exercise or walk the dog. Keep going through the park and you will eventually reach Meiji Jingu Shrine and Harajuku. Yoyogi Park also hosts great markets some Sundays. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again on our next trip to Tokyo.

Basic hotel, small but comfortable rooms.Good breakfast included in the price.The best thing about the hotel is the location. Only 5 minutes walk from Shibuya station and crossing. You have to pay for wifi in the rooms here, that's the only strike this place gets.Decent hotel & fantastic location for the price you pay.

Good value for money and conveniently located for the things we were seeking to get out of our stay in Tokyo. On the NEX express train, Shibuya is easy to get to, from the airport. With well posted signage and a bit of forward planning we navigated through Shibuya station and up the road to the Tobu Hotel. The rooms suited our needs and were well maintained, neat and tidy. Check-in and check-out was quick.

This hotel is very good located. Shibuya is one of the best places to stay to experience Tokyo. The train from Narita Airport stops at Shibuya station. Then there is 5-10 min walk to the hotel. We stayed in a small double room. It is small and there is no closet to store your clothes. Bathroom includes bath-tub and a electric Japanese toilet with warm seat and so on. Bring cord or pay for WiFi. There is 24 hour reception. The staff speak good English and are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is ok, not extraordinary, it is a mix of western and Japanese food. I recommend this hotel.

Amazon location, great coffee across the street, tasty buns at family mart, and yummy crepes just around the corner.If you are going to the robot show, be sure to ask the hotel to book and you can save 50$!Rooms were small an staff who didn't speak English were touch to communicate with. If you want to go to the sky tree- make sure you book through a travel agency to avoid the hour wait. :)

good value for the price and very great view on the park staff speaking english and friendlyusual size of room and usual bathroom (still the same size and dispatch in each of the 8 hotels stayed during our trip)

It's reeealy convenient to go shopping from the hotel, just 5 mins walk from the shibuya 109, and the room is clean and neat. The staff are professional and kind, if u have any question, just go to ask them, they will try their best to help.

Love the location . In fact just by staying there , one could get anything you want. Remember use the hachiko exit , then you will come out to the infamous Shibuya crossing. Take the 1 O'clock if u r facing the starbucks ( on the 2nd floor), then walk pass Zara then turn left and keep walkng you will see Muji and Parco. The hotel is just right next to it...

Nice place to stay in the middle of the fanstastic place of Shibuya. Very convenient and easy to find, nice and professional staff, clean and quiet rooms even in this very lively district.Rooms are well equiped and spacious enough, which can be a challenge in Tokyo for the related budget. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Tokyo.

The location is good situated in the busy Shibuya shopping area and 10 min walk from Shibuya station. You could also walk 15 min to Harajuku another great shopping area. I have an extra bed in the room so it makes the room a little cramp, but the room is clean with clean amenities like towel, bedsheet and bathroom. The only gripe is my room window face a wall so I dont get outside view from the window

First of all, the staff was amazing and really knows what customer service means! They were very fluent in English! Mayo and her colleagues helped me enormously when I needed to buy a SIM data card. Without them I would be lost and helpless! Thanks so much!!!The room was average/good. You only need it to sleep and shower anyway. Pyamas, toothbrush, etc all are included -should you really travel light.The hotel is very close to the centre of Shibuya with its many shops, the JR station and the other areas of interest. Clean and affordable!

The hotel is near to Shibuya JR station and Tokyo Metro, abt 10 mins walking, lotsa eateries and shops along the way. Will be staying in this hotel again when I am back to Tokyo. Room kinda small but enough for 2 persons.

rooms are so small with basic amenities, shower toilet bathub, we requested non-smoking but they gave us smoking room with freshly smoke scent, theres a vending machine outside our room were we bought some drinks, advantage is its very near the famous shibuya crossing and shibuya station convenient for transporation, when we arrive it was midnight with heavy rain from the typhoon we even if its near shibuya station (10-15min walk) we are not familiar with the place and the rain is heavy so we took a taxi and pay 800yen to reach the hotel, restaurant shopping malls are all within reach, at the reception we exchange our dollars but there is limit only $300 you can exchange per day per guest. you pay during checkIn. its small expensive but centrally located in shibuya tokyo.

The hotel was in a great location, just near the famous Shibuya Crossing where the film "Lost in Translation" made the location famous.The room was small - whilst I read that time and time again with reviews on here, you simply don't comprehend just how small until you get there.Whilst it was a bit cramped it still had most of what we needed and we didn't spend that much time there anyways - preferred touring the city.Getting there: If you fly in to Narita you'll want to take the Skyliner or Narita Express out of the airport. We took the Skyliner into the city which was fine but you do have to change over at Nippori station. Narita Express is great for getting to the main Tokyo station which sits on the circular Yamanote Line. This line connects all the major parts of the city including Shibuya.When you arrive into Shibuya Station look for signs or ask for directions for the Hachiko Exit. This is a big station and the wrong exit could be the difference in getting lost and getting to your hotel.The staff were friendly and if they didn't speak perfect english, they were near enough to it. Staff were also helpful with other services such as booking a tour. We grabbed a brochure from the lobby area for the The Gray Line Tokyo Tour (definitely recommend) and a member of staff at the front desk was kind enough to call the tour company and organise it for us plus gave us detailed instructions on how to get to the pick up area.

Just got back from my first trip to Japan. My mother is a travel agent and found this hotel for me. It was wonderful- get for walking to the train station and walking all around Shibuya. so close to Yoyogi park which is great to walk around. I visited other areas of Tokyo like Ginza, Roppongi and Shibuya was my favorite with all the neon lights and things to do. Hotel check in was no problem in English. Room was small, but they all are in Tokyo. Was clean and had vending machines which was great. Internet only came in at the lobby but that's fine. There was only BBC for English tv which got annoying quick but nothing you can really do about that in Japan!

Perfect location. About 5-8mins walk to Shibuya crossing. Restaurants and cafes around the area. Perfect shopping spot.Hotel Service is excellent. Staff very helpful. Good quality for the money spent.

This hotel is very well located. In shibuya but quite close to Harijuku it was a fun place to explore Tokyo from. Shibuya is a very fun area to stay in with lots to see and do. The hotel rooms were fine - very standard normal Japanese size. There is a great park just up the hill for a relaxed afternoon. It is probably a 10min walk to the station though but lots to see on the way!

Location is about 10-minute walk from the Shibuya station. It's near enough that you can drag your luggage along the road path. There were 3 of us in the twin room. The extra bed made the room looked a little bit small, but otherwise, hotel room is quite standard compared to the average Tokyo hotels. Room and bathroom are clean. There was construction going on during our stay, and the workers were smoking a lot. We could smell smoke if we open the room windows, hence had to leave them closed most of the time. Reception was friendly, very helpful to tourists who can't speak Japanese. Unfortunately, free wifi is only available at the main lobby. There is also a printer should you wish to print anything at a small cost

Very pleasant, medium-priced (for Tokyo) hotel that caters to Japanese business men and foreign tourists. The assistants at the front-desk were very friendly and tried to be helpful but had limited English and we had to get assistance from an interpreter friend from time to time. There are a limited number of non-smoking rooms, so be sure to request when making the reservation if this is important to you. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for those who are on a relatively limited budget.

Hotel Tobu is definitely more than 7mins away from Shibuya station, considering the crowd and traffic and as well as lugging your own luggage. It’s tucked away at the end of the shopping belt, away from the bustling crowds and malls.The moment we stepped into the hotel, we were greeted by the strong aroma from the coffee house located in the lobby. It seemed like the coffee house’s kitchen has very poor ventilation. We were not allowed to check-in early even though the room was ready. Staff at the reception speaks good English, service was curt, and they looked tired even though its only noon time.We requested for a non-smoking room during booking but were given a smoking room as they claimed that it was all taken up. The hotel provides air purifier in the room and this really helps with the strong cigarettes stench. Room was really small and not much room left after we placed our luggage. The furniture in the room looks tired and dated. Only tea was provided, however, there is drinks vending machine along the corridor. On the second day morning I found a small cockroach in the toilet and informed the staff who apologised profusely but when we came back, the cockroach’s carcass was on the toilet’s basin. I felt that they could have at least returned to check after spraying the insecticide. Free Wi-Fi connection is only available in the lobby. Limited and uncomfortable seats in the lobby showed signs of wear and tear. Not a pleasant place to hang around for long. Service was also curt during checkout. The plus point for this hotel is its close proximity to shopping malls. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel as the staffs were as tired-looking as the hotel.

Very affordable and nice location.you have to walk about 10min from Shinjuku west exit to get there. But the road to the hotel is no crowded and well-maintained.Clean and comfort room you can experience for its affordable price.
