Incheon, Incheon, South Korea

review_body: Great location a few blocks from train station. Small room but clean. Great bathroom huge bath,Close to shopping, McDonalds around the corner was handy for breakfast. Wifi was around $15 for 24 hours and free in lobby. Dennys across the road. staff spoke limited English but were willing to find someone who could help us,Worst pillows I have ever slept on.

Clean and very central...good for young people...Many shops and restaurants..Near to shibuya station.. Near to harajuku- walking distance and to meiji shrine..Nice staff and helpful...Rooms a bit small for 3 persons...

The location is wonderfull, but the room was small, and could be cleaner. 3 persons in a room is hardly possible. For internet, ask for a cable at the reception desk. Wifi is not for free. Staff is friendly, bur not always understanding english

Stayed at the Shibuya Tobu hotel two weeks ago. My friend and I arrived at Shibuya station and it was hot, really hot. So we didn't feel to walk around with our luggage trying to find the hotel so we took a cab from the station. It cost 710 yen. However the hotel is not far from the station only 7 minutes walk which we did with our luggage on the way to our next destination (we are sad and we timed it). The hotel is placed around loads of shops and places to eat, just opposite is a Denny's, open 24hrs and good for breakfast as well as a pancake shop, Coffee and Roaster and a Excelsior cafe just to mention a few places to grab a coffee or breakfast. Most staff we encountered spoke English and were very helpful.The rooms were clean and comfortable. Downside was no gym facilities and no free WiFi in the rooms but in the lobby only.

Shibuya Tobu Hotel is a big hotel located in Shibuya.Its location is excellent, it is close to Shibuya Subway station where the JR Yamanote line runs (the most pratical subway line for tourism in Tokyo) and the atmosphere in the neighborhood is really cool (very young, loads of cool shops, restaurants and bars).The atmosphere in the hotel itself is not particularly intimate or warm but the staff was rather helpful and the room was nice, well equipped and a reasonable size. It was quiet too which is really nice in such a busy area of the city.We would definitely go back to this hotel if we go back to Tokyo.

It´s a 10-minute walk from Shibuya station.Shibuya station has a lot of transportation options nearby: bus, subway, JR, even the train to the airport (Narita Express). The 10-minute walk is uphill; it´s important if you have a lot of lugagge.The staff is kind and they explain to you all the details about the city, especially if it´s your first time. Their English level is not very good, but they try their best.The room was good. It´s spacious (by Tokyo standards), quiet and it has many amenities.They have wi-fi in each room, but it´s not for free. Please, wi-fi for free!!!! Nowadays free wi-fi is as important as free soap!!!!They don´t have closet (typical for Tokyo). It´s a problem if you´re going to stay more than 3-4 days.

With only a 7-minute walk from Shibuya JR-train & Metro station, Shibuya Tobu Hotel is great for sightseeing around the Tokyo area. Shinjuku and Harajuku are only one trainstop away.Even more so, the hotel is located just off-center to the Shibuya hotspots, littered with shops, restaurants, 24-7 convenient stores and a great nightlife.Hotel staff is friendly and speaks decent English, which is very convenient. Free Wifi is available in the lobby only. Computers with free printing service are also present, which are very handy for online check-in for your outbound flight.

Nice location in Shibuya, rooms clean and finally not so tiny compared to other hotels in Tokyo, staff not very helpful. We had much water in the bathroom, a man came at 10pm and stayed til 11.30 to repare, didn't say a word, then another man brought for excuse complimentary...water !!

I was travelling with my daughter to celebrate her 18th birthday for a final, girly, trip before she leaves home to study Japanese at university next month. Like most girls her age she wanted to shop and Shibuya ticked every box especially as she's petite even by Japanese standards - most of the staff in 109 knew her by the time we left! The hotel is 5-10 minutes from the Hachiko entrance of Shibuya station and easy to find; head for Starbucks, pass Seibu, turn left and walk up the slight incline towards Parco and the hotel is across the next junction. We arrived at 12 and were unable to check in but the receptionist let us leave our luggage and said we could check in an hour early at 1pm. We had a twin room which was big enough but could have done with a wardrobe and we had to drape clothes over chairs as there were only 2 hangers on the tiny rail. The room was clean, there was no smell of smoke, the shower was effective but don't flush the loo before turning it on or you get scalded. The bed was comfy and the pillow was a little hard but ok. The minifridge was ideal for storing water, snacks and the cans of G&T I'd brought from home to keep me sane! We had the buffet breakfast a couple of mornings which had enough western staples and Japanese food for us to try.We'd originally planned to move to an airport hotel on our final day but didn't fancy negotiating the late afternoon crowds at the station so extended out stay, at the discounted rate I'd paid, without any problem and the 6am NEX got us to the airport with plenty of time to spare for our 9.30 flight.The only negatives were the lack of wifi in the room, but we'd rented a portable wifi which I'd strongly recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo as free wifi hotspots are rare, and power sockets - there were only 2 so charging phones, cameras, laptops, etc and drying hair was a logistical nightmare at times!

The location is nice. It's about 10 minutes walking from JR Shibuya station.There are lots of restaurants, fancy shopping centers and famous department store such as Seibu around the hotel. The room we stayed was a bit small.We did'nt have enough space for our luggage. There are free Wi-Fi in the hotel lobby only.

I stayed one night, and wouldn't do it again. The room dis not smell fresh. The wall had what appeared to be a large bloodstain on it. The mattress was way past its prime, with two springs poking fully out. The shower ran hot and cold. And there's no internet in the rooms ... just an option to sit at an expensive terminal in the lobby. I'll give it two stars because the location is great.

I stayed here two separate nights; one stay was booked through Booking.com and another was booked through Agoda. My stay for booking.com did not offer me an option to book a smoking or non-smoking room, so Shibuya put me in a smoking room. I was upset, so for the next stay, they made sure I was in a non-smoking room (via the Agoda booking). Lesson learned: If you are booking through any 3rd party site, email the hotel to make sure your reservation was made for what you expect.

New York City, New York

review_body: I read a few reviews of this place before my recent trip and figured it would be pretty good. Turns out it was better than that! First, I had read that it was "kind of far" from the station. If you consider a 5 block walk up a very slight incline through a very nice neighborhood, then you are either older than I am, or you love being in a resort - which this is not. The walk was easy even in 85-90 degree heat. Plus, you are a two block walk from Yoyogi park. Nice. The front desk was helpful and spoke decent english. The lobby was clean with computers with internet access (1$=10 min.)...might have had wi-fi too. Did not try the restaurants - but food looked decent. The room was clean and fairly large for 2 people. Bathroom and shower were nice. Bidet was bidet ;-) Only reason not to give 5stars was that the beds were a bit too hard for my liking...as in VERY hard. I hear this is the japanese way though so it may be similar wherever you stay. There was construction next door but we never heard it. Loved the Shibuya neighborhood...better than Roppongi or Shinjuku for sure. Lots of food, shopping, fun, beautiful women and a great hub for getting around. Add in that it ranged form $115 to $150 USD per night, and you can't go wrong.

This hotel is a japanese size hotel room so please keep in mind there is not as much room if you are use to a western style room. There was not much of a view from our window in the hotel so if you are expecting a view of the city this is not the hotel for you. I love the location of this hotel it is great walking distance to everything that one would want to go in shibuya. It has a Starbucks down the street and a apple store 4 mins walking if you need to use wifi. The room had complimentary wire Internet, but if you feel the need to Instagram your trip like I did, having wireless so close by was a plus. I also enjoyed the shower had a dispenser of shisedo shampoo conditioner and body wash. For the cost I would stay here again.

Just 5 -10 minutes walk from Shibuya station. Staff didn't speak a lot of english but were trying their best to help us and were extremely friendly. Rooms were rather small for us Europeans but very clean and had everything we needed. Bathrobes and slippers were provided and were a good laugh for us tall Europeans. Would certainly stay there again.

Overall, I had a good stay here with no complaints. I used it as a home base for one night, just to set down lots of luggage I'd been tired carrying around with me. I was out late that night and returned to hotel around 4am without any hassle. Bonus, the cab driver knew right where it was so I didn't have to attempt directions in Japanese. Also bonus, there checkout was 11 instead of the common 10 so I had an extra hour to sleep. Final bonus, I asked the mostly fluent English speaking staff if they could call the next hotel I was staying out and arrange an early check-in. The staff was able to help with that no problem. All in all a good, mellow, easy and comfortable experience. (Btw, I didn't notice if there was a fitness center and I never used room service, so I can't comment on those items.)

Our stay at the Tobu Hotel was flawless. We arrived pretty early for check in but there were no issues leaving our bags for the few hours until our room was ready (I know this is a standard service but it doesn't always happen). The staff were really friendly and were all smiles every time we left and returned. Free wifi in the lobby and a paid service in the room if you prefer.You may or may not know but for short-long term stayers in Japan gaining access to a phone network (for voice calls or data) can be an absolute nightmare. I finally found a company that just sells data sim cards, however you need to register the sim by phone! Obviously mine wasn't working so I asked a receptionist (M.Gomi) and she was absolutely great. She called the number and helped translate to me what needed to be done. The process didn't work the first time and even though I didn't want to annoy her, she insisted that I come back to her so she could finish the job. She was a great help and her English/customer service were great also.I'll be back.

Great location as its not so far from shibuya station. Service was excellent and Very friendly staff. They really make sure that you find your way around Tokyo. I loved the fact that it was close to shops like uniqlo, gap, disney shop, etc. Restaurants abound too from japanese food, fastfood and desserts.

Great location right next to shibuya crossing. Rooms are small but fine if you don't plan on staying indoors all day. Only downside is that the free internet can only be used in the lobby. Also no breakfast which is a shame.

This hotel was not very impressive for the price, but the location made it worthwhile. The room itself compared to a Toyoko Inn, except with nicer Shisedo brand bathroom products. If you've been traveling much in Japan, you'll notice the beds are rather hard and if you're not used to that it can really mess up your sleep. I found the pillows too big and they were full of heavy bean-bag stuffing which I did not like. The staff was nice, but not much English support around at times, otherwise I would give them a much higher rating. The reason to stay in this hotel is definitely the location. Within easy walking distance from Shibuya station and tons of stores and things to do in this area of town. Shibuya has a great lively atmosphere that makes it fun to just walk around and experience Tokyo.

The location is great, staff is very nice and helpfull. The room we had whas very small, but that's Tokyo... The beds were hard and also the pillow was hard. But I rate it "very good" because of the location and price.It's just within 10 minutes of a walk to Shibuya crossing and Shibuya station. You walk along the best streets of Shibuya.

The Tobu Shibuya was a great option for a weekender in Shibuya. I only stayed 2 nights, with the purpose of enjoying as much as possible of what the neighbourhood had to offer. The room was small, but had what I needed, it was clean, comfortable, quiet and in a great location. The staff are helpful. If you like to spend a lot of time in your room when on holidays, this probably isnt the best option, as it's set up to sleep, shower, watch some tv etc, but if you are looking for a cosy base, as you get out and about it's perfect. Good value for money also. My only advice would be to check where it is on a map in relation to the station, whilst only a few blocks away, with the crowds, chaos and numerous streets to go down, it's not the EASIEST to find. If you have a map it's super easy though.

This hotel has a pretty reasonable rate considering it is in the heart of Shibuya, the most desirable neighborhood of Tokyo. It is about 5-7 minutes walking from Shibuya Station (subway and train), and close to everything - shops, restaurants, karaoke places, arcades, pachinko (if that's your thing), cafes, etc etc. But it still located in an avenue quiet enough to get some peaceful sleep. The staff was great, very attentive, and the room size was very good for Japanese standards. Beds were comfortable... the view of the room wasn't the best (facing another building and can only see the avenue below from an angle), but honestly, who cares about that :) In Tokyo, you shouldn't spend much time in your room anyway! And yes, the room did have one of those super hi-tech Asia-only toilets that do everything!

A ten minute stroll from the station. The hotel is clean and well serviced. Staff are very helpful, have good english and are friendly. A great location, shops and restaurants all around. Reasonably priced. Wifi is available in the public areas. I found if I connected outside the room and then came in, I would stay connected. However if I connected in the room initially- I would drop out. Strange but true on multiple occasions. I would recommend this hotel.

This Hotel is located right in the heart of Shibuya. Less than 10 minutes walk to Shibuya station and it's about a 15 minute walk to Harajuku and Yoyogi park. Being in the heart of Shibuya consider all decent eatery, shopping and whatever it is you please to be right outside.The hotel staff were very friendly however there was a language barrier when we asked to find a printing place, as the printer in the hotel was not working. They have folders upon folders and went searching for places where we could get something printed and came up with nothing. So we thought we'd check out one of the many internet places around (we ended up at ManBoo! Which I would recommend to anyone just to get a really cool club card) and asked them if they did printing, which they did. It seemed to be a bit of a slight in an otherwise great service.The room was a basic, generic Japanese hotel room, with all the basic amenities that you would expect. Wi-fi was non-existent in the room so if you are dependent on your internet fix I'd recommend going to ManBoo! But, having said that, Japan as a whole isn't very up to free wi-fi, it seems to be a luxury that a hotel would even have anything in that regard. In any case we would usually go to Tokyu Hands (2min walk away) instead of sitting in the lobby which always seemed to be occupied by other guests. They have a few couches in the lobby and we're talking enough space to fit maybe 5 people.The hotel also has a restaurant which we never took advantage of.All and all I have to say this hotel was great and I would stay here again. It being so close to everything being the main reason for going back.

Having Stayed at this hotel twice, Last September (2012) and March (2011), me and the wife are definatly going to be staying here again, when we go in September (2013), Excellent staff, always willing to help, easy access to Shibuya station (only 5 mins walk away), great location as there are 100's of restaurants within a 15-20 minute walk, so much variety and so much choice, great for shopping but for always enjoying the nightlife without having to worry about the trains, so much to see and do here. Can;t wait to stay at this hotel again....

We chose this hotel because of the location and the price. It's about a 5 min walk away from the famous Shibuya crossing so the location of the hotel couldn't be better!This hotel is a great "base" for exploring Tokyo. It's really easy to go just about anywhere from the Shibuya train station.The room itself was ok, we weren't expecting much because we knew that the hotel rooms in Tokyo are generally really small. But it had everything we needed though (big enough bed, shower, fridge, internet, etc).There was a smell of cigarette even though it was supposed to be smoke-free. We bought a cheap air freshener from a nearby shop so it covered up the smell.The cleaning staff came every day way too early and even though we had put that "do not disturb" sign they seemed persistent to come there. Otherwise the staff were really friendly and helpful!Overall we enjoyed our stay there and if/when we are going back to Tokyo we'll probably choose this hotel again :)

The hotel is at an excellent location 5-10 min walk from Shibuya Station, clean and has everything one needs. The standard room hosts a queen size bed, a desk and enough little space to walk around 3 sides of the bed. The bath box is ok for one person at the same time. In the lobby there is free WIFI. With closed window you won't hear anything from outside, but we even slept with open window. So, noise was not an issue at all. We would stat there again.

Advantages- in the heart of Shibuya, you are 6 or 7 minutes walk from the Shibuya train station and famous crossing- Close to lots of shopping, nightlife and restaurants. Which is the best if you want to party considering that trains stop running between midnight and 1am.- The hotel provides free wifi, not a lot of other hotels will do that as they usually provide those plugs you need laptops for, which is useless if you have an ipad or mobile phone where wifi is more useful.- it's extremely affordable considering the location. Book early saves 20%, worked out to be $100 a night (split between two people that's only $50 considering that hostels in the area were charging $45 pp for a private room).- The room is small but reasonable. They also gave us these face cream samples, you have your standard toothbrush and toothpaste etc provided.DisadvantagesStaff speak very little English

review_body: I booked our room a week before going to Tokyo for 5 days and through the website Agoda. I received 30% off which was great and obviously put a smile on my face before going.The hotel is located in a fantastic location in Shibuya, and just off the main drag so you have a little peace before you hit the lively buzzing scene. The room is small (but we are in Tokyo remember) and with all the modern facilities one needs. Cleaned daily and to perfection. The hotel staff are lovely, obliging and have all got a fair bit of english language knowledge. Much better then my Japanese! :) I would recommend anyone to stay here.

I don't agree with the other reviews that it's dingy or old. The decor is a tad dated but for the area the price is very competitive for Shibuya - we paid about Y15000 for a twin during early April, which I think is just about the cheapest rate during such a busy period (there's probably about 2 other properties which are not in as good a location). I've stayed at Granbell Shibuya before which is 'cooler' but it's smaller and more expensive. If you want a better bargain for the area you really need to go to Shinjuku for a bit newer etc.. but Shinjuku is a totally different vibe from Shibuya..!Positives - twin room was very big, super fast lan (we had a wireless router with us), window that actually opens, real bathroom (not the plastic slot in ones you get at business hotels), free buffet breakfast, friendly and helpful staff, easy to get to location (just a block away from Parco, easy walk up from JR Shibuya station)Negatives - decor done in the early 90s (if you're really care about style); the rates are better (and there are more 'plan' options) in the Japanese only booking system

The location is good. But rooms look old and dingy. Not dirty just look old. I already have my expectations low on room space in japan, but this was smaller. Overall, it was the location that attracted us the most. Its abt 5-7mins walk from shibuya station, that is if you know exactly where to go.

This hotel is in very good location in Shibuya! only about 10 minutes walk to the station and is on a quiter street which believe me is a plus! The staff were very lovely! even tho we spoke little to no japanese they were still always smiling and theres not one time we went downstairs and were not greeted! The rooms are small, but considering other hotels it is fine. for english people the tv has fox 8 ! The price we payed for 5 nights was pretty good! you can walk to harajuku through yoyogi park. and as the weather was FREEZINNGG the warm ac was delightful! OH and there is a school across the road, and they play instruments like a marching band but only around 10am , not that loud but might effect some whingers!

Everything is almost perfect. The room looks clean although it would be to narrow for somebody. However, it lacks Japanese hospitality you would usually find in Minshuku. Also, it is a bit too pricey, but compared to some hotels in the area, it is still a good deal.

It is in a great location, very close to the crowded shibuya, like 10-15 min from the shibuya station. The staff it is very educated and helpful, and the room was very clean and quite big.There is only wifi conection in the main hallI think the walls need to be repainted, but for now is okGood value for money

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and the room rate was extremely reasonable. We booked early via Expedia and was offered a very attractive rate at approximately USD100 per night. This hotel provides all necesities and amenities. Size can be a little challenge for plus size adults as the room is really tiny. However, i guess most hotels in Tokyo has tiny rooms. There is no free wifi in the room but you can get free wifi in the lobby. Walking distance to Shibuya station takes about 10minutes and walking back from station to the hotel is slighly uphill. Walking distance between Tobu Hotel and Cerulean Tower (where most pick up for day tours are) is about 15 minutes and this is manageable. You will be spoilt with choices in terms of shipping, restaurants and drinking places at Shibuya.If you are young/young at heart and do not want to splurge too much on accomodation, you should definately consider this hotel.

Like most mid-range hotels in big cites like Tokyo, the rooms are not the largest! However, they are big enough and quite comfortable especially considering that we barely spent any time during the day there. The location really is the selling point here! The hotel is a five minute walk from the most lively part of Shibuya, and near the Shibuya station. From here, you can easily get to anywhere in Tokyo. Wifi is not available in the rooms, but it is very reliable in the lobby! I would stay here again!

Hotel is in the perfect location for exploring shibuya, far enough from the busy parts to not be noisy, but a 2 min walk and you are right in the action, with shopping, restaurants and bars everywhere. Rooms are pretty standard for Tokyo, small and basic, but the have everything you need and are very clean. If you don't plan on staying in the room much then this hotel is great for exploring the area. Great value for money too.

This hotel offers really good value for money. Its location is excellent, just a few blocks away from the famous Shibuya crossing. There are lots of dining and shopping possibilities around and also a lively nightlife. From Shibuya Station you have great train connections around the city and also to/from Narita Airport. We got a really good price for our semi-double room. The room was, as this type of rooms in Japan normally are, tiny. The room and the bathroom were extremely clean, but a bit scuffed. Our window was made of patterned class, the kind of you can't see through, and couldn't be opened more than a little ajar. But that was ok as our room didn't actually have a view, it was facing a fall. The bigger rooms and the rooms on the upper floors probably do have a view. The staff were polite and efficient, but I can't really describe them being friendly. We didn't try the breakfast as there were so many different breakfast possibilities around. I think this hotel is a great choice for those who appreciate a super location and value for money, but aren't that demanding on the room itself. I would be staying here again.

We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel.Location is pretty easy and if you come out to Shibuya Crossing (the massive crossing by the Hachiko (dog statue) exit, you will see a Starbucks ahead of you. Cross the road with Starbucks on your left, and walk until you see Zara on your right, then turn left. Go past Parco mall and you should come up to the hotel.It's about a ten minute walk with luggage.The rooms are tiny, and apparently this is typical for japan but even then I was surprised, but at that price range it did seem very good value.As a guy who is pretty tall I had to duck a little to use the shower (if you are 6 foot or under you will be fine) and the bed was small for a couple. There was no breakfast included, but that was fine for the price we paid, and the room was clean and the toiletries provided were sufficient and nice to use as well as things like a comb, shaving kit, dental kit provided. They also supplied an iron when requested.They have wired internet in the room (I used my own portable travel router in the room) and wireless in the lobby.Staff were helpful and they even had pyjamas in the room that were replaced daily, and nice little touches like all your shoes/slippers will be lined up and clothes folded. Very happy with it and gave 5 stars as it was pretty much as advertised.One point of note is that there was a school or sports centre where kids are playing sports which was quite loud (whistles of the coach/referee, kids shouting etc). Perhaps there are rooms away from this which I would recommend you request.We had a no smoking room and didn't smell any smoke.

Room was very very small! Front desk staff were alright, free wi-fi in the lobby was pretty slow! Good location and value though.It was walking distances to many enjoyable local restaurants. The only thing about it was walking to the hotel from the main street which most people would do, it is slightly uphill and it can get quite tiring especially with all the shopping that you've done!

After deciding to extend out stay in Tokyo by one night at the last minute, we had to find new accommodation (since the hotel we had been at previously was very expensive to book when not done online and in advance!).Some googling led us to the Shibuya Tobu, which was in our price range and had a room available same day. Done!The location is excellent, right in the heart of Shibuya. The reception staff were very courteous. The room was okay....clean but smelled a bit like smoke and the bathroom was clean enough but could be cleaner, if you get what I mean!Recommended for value and location!

When I travel location is everything, and this hotel is perfect locationwise. 4-5 minutes walk from Shibuya station and in the middle of everything, but just enough off in a sidestreet to be calmer and not too noisy. Rooms are quite small but good, (have been to smaller), clean and nice. The TV has BBC which is nice when being far away and not understanding the language. There's wifi (a bit slow) in the lobby. Didn't try the breakfast as it wasn't included, but as you are in the middle of everything there's lots of cafees and stuff around every corner.

We recently spent 5 nights at the Shibuya Tobu during our trip to Japan. Really enjoyed our stay. Our double room was a bit small ( customary in Japan) but very clean and bed was extremely comfortable. It was possible to open the window which provided a lovely fresh breeze. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is excellent! Right in the heart of the action yet quiet. Loads of restaurants nearby serving Japanese fare or British Pub around the corner with excellent fish and chips, really good Italian nearby, burger places, breakfast shops. Also VERY expensiveshopping. Tokyo Hands store a few blocks away and a must.To access from Shibuya station take Hachicho exit ( end of platform). Once outside at this famous crossing look up and you will see Starbucks. Bear to the right and walk straight up the street which I believe is Seibu. You will walk up 2 stoplights  Zara will be on right side and Oicity will be on left corner which is white buildingwith a silo like tower. Turn left and pass Parco Mall and you will see the Tobu sign.Only small issue was the faint smell of smoke but apparently it is possible to secure a non smoking floor which I was unaware. Also some additional hooksfor hanging towels or clothes would be an inexpensive and welcome addition to the room.

Just left our stay at this hotel and overall impressed for the price we paid and would recommend. I wanted to stay somewhere central in the middle of all the action so we didn't have to travel and it was important the place was clean. Tobu Shinbuya delivered the location is perfect right in the middle of the Shinbuya shopping district with hundreds of restaurants and shops on the doorstep. The room was very clean and hotel staff friendly and helpful.The room is small but I expected this being Japan and such a great location for the price I was prepared for a simple, small room. The bathroom makes you feel cramped inside, I had to shower with the door open as I felt like I was in a closet.Another negative is that there is currently construction going on next door and there would be loud banging from early morning till night. The construction did stop overnight but I would have preferred the option for a sleep in. If your thinking to book this hotel keep in mind from the date of this review construction is happening so you may not get quiet if that's what you value. Looks like a building is being put up and as of my stay November 2012 only the foundations where laid so I believe this will be going for a while yet.If I come to Japan again and the construction is over by then I will come back to this hotel as the location is unbeatable for the price.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Great, central location - 4 minutes walk from main underground station; nice (if small) rooms equipped with the funky Japanese toilets; clean; reasonably priced; decent sound insulation; free wifi in reception area; comfy bed. Shibuya was a good place to stay but is primarily a shopping district, Shinjuku has far more drinking/eating options, should you desire anything more than ramen.

This hotel property was basic, but clean. Though appearing a bit impatient at times, the staff were overall courteous. I only stayed at this property for two nights, but I was very satisfied and would stay again while in Tokyo as the location is the best! You are right in the heart of the city center, near trains, shopping and loads of dining.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Loved this hotel for its convenience, I thought that the 10 min walk at the end of the day would be the last thing you would want to do but as the last reviewer said, it's a fun walk with lots of shops on the way home. Shibuya is great for shopping and nightlife, with eateries everywhere. This hotel was spotlessly clean and great value, would not hesitate to come back or recommend.

The shibuya tobu hotel is a few blocks away from the 'action' of shibuya. About 10 min from the shibuya station. It's a fun walk. There's tons of stores on the way. You cross the shibuya famous crossing where the best view is at Starbucks on the way to the hotel.Hotel is very conveniently located. Has a choco-cro bakery and a MOS burger near buy. A AX armani store across from it... There is NO wifi in the room. Don't know why people always complain about that. It's common in Japan. We brought a router and we had our own wifi in our room. Room is small (but no surprise) It is clean.It's not luxurious but it's clean. To me, it was the ideal location because it was a few minutes walk to all the action in Shibuya (food and shopping!). Tokyu food show is a nice food hall with lots of options.

The Shibuya Tobu Hotel is a nice refuge from th hustle and bustle of Shibuya, whille being close enough to the action that you can step out the front door and be amongst it in minutes. It is up near Yoyogi park so it is also in a good location for an early morning stroll or jog.The rooms are a typical size for Japanese rooms, however they are clean and the bathroom is well provisioned with useful things like razors, toothbrushes etc. Internet in the rooms is cable and you need to BYO cable. WIFI is avaiolable in the lobby.The staff were lovely and very patient, and were fairly good at understanding English. Overall the hotel represented great value for money.Would thoroughly recommend and would go back if we were to stay in Shibuya again.

This hotel is convienient to the Shibuya attractions, shopping, etc. It is well kept, clean and comfortable. The rooms we stayed in were small but this is typical in Japan. My only complaint was that wi-fi is not available in the rooms. Also there is a faint odor of cigarette smoke in the halls, etc. but again smoking is not as restricted in Japan. It did not bother me much but if your sensitive to smoke be aware that most places in Japan allow smoking in some indoor areas. I did not see anyone smoking inside but assume there are smoking rooms available.

We don't want to spend our travel budget on expensive hotels and so work to a tight budget. Sometimes it doesn't work out. But this time it was great as the Tobu is excellent value. It's small, clean rooms had all we needed. We spend all day out exploring so we don't need all the luxury of an expensive hotel. Shibuya is a good area and the station close by makes access to the rest of the city easy. Staff were helpful. Recommendation for restaurant was fantastic. Yes I would recommend it.

I would advise this hotel because of the location. Of course the rooms are small, and windows have no view, but after all it's a 100 euro room in the center of Tokyo.. Very close to attractions and railwaystation. Only problem - internet connection via cable. Ou can use your iPad only in the lobby.

We spent the last leg (week) of our 3 week honeymoon at Tobu Hotel. Mainly to save some money since we knew the shopping in Tokyo would demand more from our pockets, and that got prioritised.They were nice enough to upgrade us since we were on honeymoon, so gold star for that. Only problem was that it was a smoking floor, and someone had obviously been smoking in the room right before we got it, and this even tho we specifically asked for a non smoking room. When prompted about it, the man at the reception desk gave us a spray-bottle, and told us to "spray this, smell go away", while firmly explaining to us that this was NOT a smoking room. We stayed a week at the Cerulean Tower prior to Tobu, and the service felt like the total opposite.We had bikes, and the old man guarding the garage took care of them every evening, free of charge. He actually seamed pretty excited about parking bikes.The subway station (shibuya station) is a 5-10 minutes walk away, the Yoyogi Park is 5 minutes walk the other direction. There's a lot of shopping in shibuya, and it starts right outside the hotel. So the location is PRIME. This combined with the price of the hotel makes the Tobu Hotel a good choice.The hotel is obviously a Business Hotel, something you notice by the lack of anywhere to put your clothing, or unpacking anything at all. But, you pretty much get what you pay for, since you can get away staying at the Tobu MAD cheap.... for people going to and from Narita with the friendly airport limousines, be aware of the fact that there's no pickup at Tobu. Minor thing, but you should know.Not very romantic, and the windows only open 1 inch, but very cheap. So if you're on a romantic getaway, make sure to balance out the un-romanticness with some romantic events in Tokyo.

Hello Great Hotel. Recommended. Will Stay again.Very close to all the action. Subway station 5-10 minutes walk away. No free internet access in rooms. Two computers downstairs in reception if you need to contact the outside world urgently! Will costs you of course! Cold drinks vending machine and ice dispenser on on each floor. The hotel room was very clean and of decent size. No American size rooms for the same price obviously. Staff speak excellent English. Off to learn Japanese now ! Japan see you soon!

This hotel was decent. Staff were kind and helpful. It is located in a great area with not a far walk to the metro. The rooms were tiny and was the bathroom but this is to be expected in Japan. It was very clean.

We booked this hotel based on location and reviews and were not disappointed. This was our first trip to Tokyo, and with literally only a few Japanese words under our belt (sorry/hi/thankyou/beer) we were unsure what we'd be in for!Luckily even though the hotel website is in Japanese you can easily book a room through one of the many English hotel booking sites.Before we arrived I sent a few email enquiries all of which were replied to with 'good' English, which was certainly reassuring for us. We arrived early morning well before check-in but comcierge staff were more than happy to store our bags while we went on our first walk around the Shibuya area! In saying that, the location of the hotel is excellent, easy walking distance to Harajuku (via the lovely Yoyogi Park) and all the sites of Shibuya (shopping, nightlife, restaraunts, train etc). The major train station allowed us to make several bullet train day trips (via Shinagawa) during our stay and super easy connections to Tokyo areas.As for the hotel room itself, each floor has a couple of vending machines offering alcohol and coffee drinks which is handy! The room while small (this is Tokyo!) was nowhere near as small as our expectations and accomodated us perfectly for two weeks. Noise can be heard from other rooms, but this was never bad enough to be an issue for us. Though it's worth mentioning you may need to switch the TV on if you're not interested in hearing all your partners bodily sounds while they're on the loo :)Saying that there's a desk/tv/small fridge contained in the room also.All in all we were very happy with our stay and would likely come back if staying in Shibuya again (the location of the hotel is a major perk). Also worth noting the hotel service was great, they even accepted delivery of our rental mobile SIMs that we had sent to the hotel and were very helpful for minimal Japanese speaking Australians :)

Very clean Hotel, fantastic location, helpful staff.OK so the rooms are small, but thats what hotel rooms are like in Japan.The hotel provides, toiletries, night shirts and wired internet access, there is a 32" flat screen tv in the room and access to BBC and Fox channels as well as the usual japanese channels.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, have loved our 5 days here.Also was very hot when we arrived and the first thing the reception staff did was give us 2 cold towels to cool ourselves down, a very nice touch.

I spent 7nights in Tobu hotel and it definetly worth every cent. Their rate is quite reasonable compering to other Tokyo hotels, especially for such central location.. Firstly the twin room that me and my friend stayed was fairly big for Tokyo standarts, clean and had simply everything that we needed from a hotel room even japanese style pijamas on our beds.. The staff were very kind and helpful , tried to answer every question we asked.Tobu hotel is very conveniently located just 5-10 min walk distance away from the JR station which enabled us to reach whereever we wanted to go in Tokyo.. To me Shibuya neighborhood feels like it's a city itself in a big city that perfectly reflects the young spirit of Japan with its crowd, shops and cafes..I would definetly stay in Shibuya Tobu hotel if i had chance to come back to Tokyo and reccomend this place especially to young travellers.

I stayed here for 1 night before meeting up with friends. Room- small, but perfect for 1 person. It just has the basics, no frills. No closet, a tiny bathroom, tv, and bed. It was very clean and the AC worked so I was happy. Even though it's on a busy street the room was surprisingly quiet. I had no problems with sleeping. Wifi was free in the lobby.I got a deal through Expedia for $150 (regular price was $220/night). I got the last one :) I just winged it and went there without a reservation based on a friend telling me that they stayed there. I wanted to see if the walk up price would be cheaper than Expedia. The staff told me that there were no Expedia rooms left...but I could see online that there was 1 room so I just booked it. They had no choice but to accept. $70 saved.Location- right in the middle of Shibuya. Minutes from the train station, food, Shibuya crossing, and a 20 minute walk to Harajuko. I like to shop so this was perfect- all the majors were just across the street. You can get lost for hours roaming the local boutiques on the side streets. It's true- the Shibuya girls have amazing style! I people watched all day admiring their fashions. The Harajuko girls also did not disappoint. It was crazy to see how "they" come out after 7:30...Food- too much to choose from! Anything you want is just a short walk away. It was my first night so I chowed down at the first ramen spot that I could find. Everything was delicious! I would highly recommend staying here and would come back again. Good if you're on a budget and want a good location. It's also very safe if you're traveling alone.

The hotel was located a 10 minutes walk up the hilly side of Shibuya. From the Shibuya station's Hachiko Exit/ gate, find Seibu and walk straight up until the traffic light Shibuya- Jinnan post Office and turn left, walk pass Parco Mall and you can see the sign of Tobu Hotel. The hotel room was commonly small. No free wifi in the room but there was free wifi at the lobby but only for Apple family and the Androids. Blackberrys can't access the free wifi. There were lots of restaurants (Denny's, KFC, Ootoya, McD etc), supermarkets (Seibu, Tokyu etc) and dept stores, shops nearby the hotel. The hotel was a bit outdated but clean. The service was only average to below average for Japan standard.

Fantastic location, just 10 minutes from Shibuya station and the walk there is pleasant, passing by lots of nice stores. There is a convenience store just down the road if you want late night supplies. If you walk towards the station and take the first turn to the right, there is a store called Tokyo Hands which sells lots of Japanese everyday stuff (found some interesting Green Tea and Sakura Flower Kit Kat there). Theres also a post office nearby if you want to mail some postcards home. Managed to get a great price from Hotels.com so staying here was affordable for us. Rooms were tiny, but not as tiny as other Tokyo hotels (Hotel JAL) I've stayed at so its okay. All in all was a good place to stay

Location is really good, alot shop , 7-11 , 24 hours restaurant, Shopping area ... Miu miu , Gap just door step ... Train sation need to walk around 10 min , but along the road is enough for you to shop ... Room is abit small , no free drinking water .. we have to buy ourselves ... Abit old ...

After our long flight, my boyfriend and I jumped on the Narita Express train, which goes directly to Shibuya Station, left through the Hachiko exit, and we were at the Shibuya Tobu Hotel in minutes. We stayed three nights and found it easy to travel all over the city to Tsukiji, Ueno, Ryogukan, Mitaka, Shinjuku, and Roppongi. It's only blocks from the station which offers easy access to subway and JR lines everywhere in the city. We also found it easy to walk to Yoyogi Park, Meiji Shrine, and Harajuku. Shibuya is a great area of Tokyo to stay in - there are restaurants and shops open late but it's not too crazy. There are a lot of upscale clothing shops, department stores, a Tower Records, and even a Denny's across from the hotel. It's a really exciting place to spend time on a weekend night when everyone is out and there are street performers around the station. The hotel was clean and modern. The room and bathroom were small - the room was pretty much just a bed. We were on the fourth floor and had only one small window with no view, but the staff were friendly and spoke English well and we weren't there enough to get bothered by the size of the room.I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, affordable bed to sleep in while exploring Tokyo. It's a great base for seeing the city and the rooms are fine as long as you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your hotel - we were out in the city pretty much unless we were asleep and got a discount through hotels.com (Stay 3 nights get 30% off), so it was a really great deal for us.

I stayed here with 3 friends on May 06-10, 2012. It was a very good hotel location wise, near great shopping malls, fast foods and restaurants especially the subway. I chose this hotel because it is a straightforward travel from narita airport, i dont like transferring much especially when you carry a luggage. if you want to take narita express you will get into the hotel in an hour i guess for 3,000 yen. if you want a little cheaper price take the keisei narita sky train (58mins/8 stops/ 1,130 yen) get off at oshiage stn., transfer to Metro Hanzomon Tokyo (30mins./13 stops/ 230yen) then get off at Shibuya stn..from there go to north side hachiko exit. then walk to the hotel, i cant say exactly how many minutes as i got tired of finding the hotel on foot and decided to take a taxi..i paid 780 yen for like less than 5mins taxi ride LOLZ! it was so funny. i still saved 860 yen (compared to taking express) and used that for my dinner ;]The hotel staff are helpful and polite. i love the warm toilet seat! genius! :] the rooms are small but cute and clean, anyways you just sleep there and you will be out most of the time especially at night where people roam the streets in fashion till like 12am! A very lively place, dont forget to take a picture with Hachiko! ;] will definitely come back!

Stayed here for 6 days straight, staff is really helpful. It takes only 10 mins to walk from Shibuya train station to the hotel. Lots of restaurants nearby, many stuffs to see, as it's located at the heart of Shibuya. Went to Hotels.com and got a great deal for this hotel, ended up only paying $80SGD per night. Hotel room is quite big and spacious, no complaints about the room.And from the hotel we even walked to Harujuku, took like 20-30 mins I think? Cheap, convenient and good hotel services too. Definitely a thumbs up!

The Shibuya Tobu is fantastic value for money & very conveniently located, only a 10 minute walk from the Hachiko exit of the JR Shibuya station.The room is spacious for Japan with queen size bed, air conditioning, a flat screen TV & a capsule bathroom featuring shower over a bathtub, toilet with bidet & lovely bath products.There are a lot of food options nearby, as well as several coffee shops including Starbucks. It's also very close to several department stores, including Parco, Loft & Seibu. Additionally, it's an ray walk to the Meiji Shrine & Yoyogi Park.

We stayed here for 8 nights during our trip to Japan. Generally, hotels in Shibuya can be quite expensive but we got a good deal through Expedia and ended up paying less than $100AUD per night.The hotel is about a 7min walk from Shibuya Station (exiting from the Hachiko exit). It was quite tiring dragging all our luggage through the crowds and up the streets to the hotel, so pack lightly! I was surprised that the hotel room itself was a lot more spacious than the other business hotels that we stayed at in Japan. We had a non-smoking room with double bed, width was 140cm and slept comfortably in this. Room amenities included (larger than usual) flat-screen TV, fridge, hair dryer etc (all the basics). The rooms however do not have wi-fi and require a lan cable to connect to the internet. We did not have one but simply asked reception and they let us borrow one for the duration of our stay. The bathroom was slightly more spacious than other bathrooms that I've experienced. However, one negative I must say and warn people about, is that the bathtub in which you stand to take a shower, has no high-edge/ribbing, so if you don't cover the whole edge with the shower curtain, water will spill onto the bathroom floor. Overall the room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a window room, but the hotel is located just off the extremely busy parts of Shibuya, so we were not disturbed in any way by the noise outside. The front-counter staff at Shibuya were not as attentive as other hotels - for instance, they don't greet you each time you enter/leave (I didn't mind, it was just an observation). Though they were very helpful (e.g. they helped me call up the next hotel we were going to stay at to confirm our booking - as I don't speak Japanese). As for Shibuya, you cannot ask for a better place to stay in Tokyo, if you want nightlife. Shops & department stores (e.g. Shibuya 109, Parco, Uniqlo etc.) are open until 9-10pm weeknights and a bit later on weekends. There are lots of restaurants and eateries in Shibuya which cater for all types of budgets and open until very late, if not 24hrs. Shibuya station is also very convenient for getting to other areas in Tokyo like Shinjuku, Harajuku, Ikebukuro etc because it is on the Yamanote loop, and the hotel is only a few mins walk from the station as well! We ended up exploring Shibuya most nights, after a day out in different areas - there's just so much to see. We found many hole-in-the-wall shops and eateries (e.g. if you walk up the street to the left of Shibuya 109, you'll approach a ramen store on the corner decked out in yellow. They sell ramen bowls for 550yen ($6.5AUD) and give you 2 free-refills of ramen noodles as well. It was delicious and comforting on a cold winter's night). Make sure you check out Don Quijote as well - a variety store which sells almost everything that opens til 4am everyday (or was it 24H?). It was so much fun browsing through everything late at night and then buying snacks at the end to bring back to the hotel.

The was a great value hotel for the price (AUD100 per night on advance booking and payment through hotels.com). Staff were really friendly and helpful. Room was surprisingly big and are clean. Location is excellent, being just up the road from the main intersection at Shibuya. Only thing to be aware of is that the rooms are on a central air conditioning which you can't control the temperature of and that there are some smoking floors. The room was warmer than I like it, but not unbearable. We were on a smoking floor and could smell a bit of smoke, but soon got accustomed to it. The ventilation is clearly better than on the smoking floors of many hotels in south east Asia. We didn't bother asking for another room as we knew the hotel was pretty full, and we are pretty relaxed about stuff like that (especially considering the price we paid). Not sure how we would have gone if we had asked for another room. Would definitely consider staying here again and would recommend it to friends.

This convenient and comfortable hotel is only a short walk to the railway station, shops, eateries and the famous Shibuya crossing. Great value place to stay. Would have no hesitation staying here again.

I decided to stay at this hotel because of a deal I found on hotels.com. I was traveling by myself so I didn't want to spend too much. I thought the room would be small but I was suprised to find it was bigger than I expected, similar to the size of rooms at hotels in the US. There was nothing special about the hotel as far as the furniture or the view, but the room was very comfortable and clean. The best thing about the hotel is that it is right in the heart of Shibuya. You walk outside the hotel and there are restaurants and shopping everywhere. The good thing about the location of the hotel is that its on somewhat of a side street so there aren't millions of people right outside the hotel and it is not very noisy. They had a restaurant onsite but I didn't try it because there were so many other options nearby. The area is very safe and clean.I'd reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a lively area while maintaining a little bit of privacy from all the Shibuya traffic. Its not too fancy but it gets the job done and is located in one of the more exciting areas of Tokyo. Would definately go back.
I stayed in a twin room and didn't find it too small. Location is one of the reason why we chose to stay there. Will surely stay there.

Tokyo is an exciting city, so are railway (world's expensive) and hotels ( pricey)! But Tobu hotel is your above average hotel - get twin singles than double ones as they're bigger in size! Took limited express train around 1000 yen, remember change train at niporri station, get out and change to yamanote line ( green), alight at shibuya station. Once out, (abt 7 min plus walk, pass by lots shops, eatery) look for star bucks, walk along right side, walk towards oicity mall, disney shop, parco. Hotel is Opp denny's. Note difficult get non- smoking room. Got highest floor and each floor has vending machines - beer, drinks! They have free ice too! Recept 24-hr with decent english friendly staff. Gonna go yoyogi park, meiji shrine stone throw away. Hotel extremely clean with exterior brown marble. They don't offer free breakfast but come on, lots of goodies outside! Love diy order of spicy beef veggy soup, egg, rice and fried beef w free drink at 680 yen - will get hold restaurant name later! Will try bullet train bk...slightly more pricey. Be visiting hakone for snow and disney!!!

I have mixed feelings about this hotel. The location is fantastic for nightlife, it's very close to the clubs so easy to get back to your room.The lobby is beautiful, but once you get into your room it's a different story altogether. The rooms are small, as to be expected, but what I didn't expect was the lack of effort to put in any kind of storage in that small space. There is no wardrobe or drawers, just a shelf with two hooks to hang up two items of clothing. Made our two week stay a little awkward. Our room was quite noisy throughout the night, despite our window facing a wall. Lots of chatter from the streets and some kind of generator noise. It did not stop us sleeping, but it's something to bear in mind if you are a light sleeper.On some days our room appeared not to have been cleaned, just tidied a little.The staff were always pleasant and helpful, and everyone who served us had good English, I cannot fault that. Internet in the room was included too. We did not try any food as it felt expensive and the hotel is surrounded by cheap places to eat. I especially recommend the udon shop next door (turn left out of the hotel, it is right in front of you and down some steps.)It's a 10 minute walk to Shibuya station, very useful for getting about as it links to Shinjuku which will take you anywhere. You can also walk to Shinjuku in roughly an hour.

A friend and I spent 4 nights in Shibuya Tobu Hotel in early February. Shibuya Tobu is in great location about a 4 minute walk to Shibuya station and the famous Shibuya crossing. It is close to restaurants, shops and bars.Staff were friendly and helpful ( they did send me the wrong way once or twice - but that equals some laughs!). The lobby has free wifi and the hotel has some good restaurants underneath the complex. The rooms were roomy for Japanese standards in Tokyo and most importantly were clean. Would stay here again in Tokyo and if I was in the Shibuya area.
Suberb service for such a small hotel Super freindly Staff always avaible and English was fairly good

This hotel is terrible. We checked in and learned that we were put in smoking rooms. We asked that they be changed to nonsmoking per our reservation request and they simply said no. They did not even try to change them. Then we went to the rooms, and discovered that they were both double beds. One room was for our daughter and nephew and suppose to be two twins. We went back downstairs and asked for that room to be changed - again, without looking they said no. We then asked for a cot, they said no, but would give us bedding for the floor. The rooms reeked of smoke as did the whole floor. The windows were frosted so one couldn't see out of them. The room was dirty. The rooms are very small, but that is typical and not of concern to us.When I ran the water in the bath to take a shower, it poured out on the floor - from under the bathtub! Same was true for the sink in my daughter's room. Back downstairs to report this - ad the desk attendants said they would 'check it'. They never did and we had 4 days of a nonfunctioning shower in one room and sink in the other.We ate the breakfast on only one morning - it was terrible - cold where it was suppose to be hot, crust and stale tasting - whether it was Japanese or western fare.The price is not right - the experience was terrible - and we would have forgiven a lot of it if they were the least bit interested in our problems - but they were not. Stay at the Shibuya Creston nearby - beautiful, less expensive, and great food. I wish we could have switched, but we had paid ahead and they would not refund our money.

Rooms are very small but that is typical in Tokyo unless you can afford a suit. The location is unbeatable! 5 minutes walking distance from Shibuya Station which catches almost all of the major train lines through out Tokyo. Shibuya is one of the most fun, safe, and interesting districts of Tokyo.
If look forward to nov 2012 If dream to before heregain

The first things worth mentioning about this hotel is its great price (AU$100/night for a double), and its fantastic location. Approximately 5 minutes walk form shibuya station and right in the heart of shibuya itself the location was great. Using the JR trains (yamonate line) we were easily able to travel around Tokyo. The room and bathroom were simple but clean . Unfortunately both were very small but at the price we payed this is to be expected. (Typical in Tokyo)In summary, if you're able to get a price like ours don't hesitate in booking Shibuya Tobu. Not extravagant but very conveniently located.

Considering the amazing price we got for this hotel, I wasn't expecting much but I can safely say the Shibuya Tobu Hotel vastly exceeded my expectations. Like other reviewers have said, you really can't beat the location. You're maybe 5 minutes from the station (closer 10 with heavy luggage which we hauled up there and back without incident), about 10 minutes max from Harajuku, Yoyogi and Omotesando and only seconds from the heart of Shibuya. The staff were very friendly and communication wasn't a problem, with at least one person on the counter speaking English. The cleaners were thorough and quick and although the room was a little small by Western standards, it really wasn't a hinderance. With so much to see just minutes away we weren't concerned with spending too much time in the room anyway. That said they had a few English speaking channels if you're feeling wiped out from endless days of walking.We were on the sixth floor and the windows were frosted so don't think there was anything particularly exciting to see outside. There was construction going on next door but the window was pretty thick so it wasn't too loud.Also free internet if you have an ethernet cable - it was fast and reliable. We also didn't have an adapter for my laptop (three prongs) but they very kindly lent us one. As for wifi, there might have been some in the lobby but we didn't use it. There are also computers in the lobby for internet use - 100 yen for 10 minutes... so if you've got a laptop, it's a much better deal because it's free in your room.I've stayed in three different hotels in Shibuya and this was on the lower end of the scale (Cerulean and Excel being the others) but I really wasn't disappointed. For a fraction of the cost of the other two, I really wasn't disappointed. It's not a grand hotel, but it's relatively modern and clean and that's all you really need. And when I return to Tokyo (no ifs) I'll be choosing to stay here again if I can secure another good deal.

The Shibuya Tobu Hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from Shibuya Station, in a surprisingly quiet location in the heart of Shibuya. The location of the hotel is the best thing about it, crossing at the famous Hachiko crossing everyday was a real treat. We stayed over a weekend and walked the streets all day and all night until 4am (jetlag) and still found restaurants and shops open and people everywhere, although the city does sleep at about 1am on school nights. Shibuya felt very safe and was spotlessly and mysteriously clean again each morning. I've been to New York and live in London but nothing pulses at night quite like Shibuya.It's rooms were very comfortable, staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke English and the price or our room was easily half that of any establishment in Shibuya. Because of the location you don't just get amenities on your doorstep, you get 'must visit' amenities. We often frequented the Starbucks just above Hachiko crossing and just watched people go by, and Ichi Ran (the best ramen place in the whole wide world) was a frequent stop at the end of our street.

We stayed at this hotel for a week. It was a located in a very convenient location, about 5 minutes from the Shibuya JR station. The room was quite small (typical of Tokyo hotels I guess) but very clean and well designed. Staff were friendly and pleasant, with somewhat limited English.Being in the heart of Shibuya, it was close to great shopping and food, also a short walk to Yoyogi park which is the home of the beautiful Meiji shrine.No wifi was a bit of a downer :( But there is an Apple store about a block down which we very often sat across the street with our iPhones to get online... ;)Overall it was a pleasant stay mainly for its location but nothing spectacular.

The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the JR Shibuya train station. We took a taxi from the station to the hotel for 710 Yen. Shibuya is great for shopping. Lots of restaurants and popular shops like Zara, Gap and H&M are on the way to the hotel from the station. Mc D , KFC, Denny (just opposite hotel) and a few family mart along the way to the hotel. Yoyogi Park is just 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Harajuku is also within walking distance. Besides location, the hotel is also very affordable. Paid 8000 Yen for twin-bed room, and slightly lesser for double-bed room. The double bed is very small even by asian standard. Hotel doesnt provide free breakfast, and there was no complimentary botteld water in the room. The rooms are cleaned every day. It's a good place to stay in Tokyo. It's very safe to walk even in late hours .

Shibuya Tobu is located five minutes from Shibuya crossing which makes it the perfect base for exploring what Tokyo has to offer. Small rooms, or extremely rooms to be correct, compared with european standards but still ok for a few days. We stayed eight nights which was ok. Would probably save more money and try to find a hotel with bigger rooms next time. Still - would recommend this hotel for tourists visiting Tokyo who are looking for a basic, reasonably priced hotel.

My girlfriend and I stayed at Tobu for 3 nights in mid-October 2011. We wanted to stay in Shibuya, because it was a popular district, and Tobu was close to the JR station at a decent price. The hotel is a 10-minute uphill walk on the busy streets from Shibuya JR station.The room size wasn't that bad, considering the dense area of Shibuya. We had a double bed, a small wall-mounted flat screen TV, and a small bathroom, which had no fan but was well equipped with toiletries (shampoo, soap, toothbrush, shaving gel, comb, hair dryer). The staff was very professional and polite.Outside of the hotel, you'll find many shops, department stores, convenience stores, and restaurants.The Shibuya JR station exits right onto the famous crosswalk and is a pretty cool sight to see on a very busy day. The hotel is also about a 15 minute walk north to Yoyogi Park and the Harajuku district, which is another nice area for shopping.

We booked the Tobu for about 120$ per night. This is the smallest hotel room I've ever seen... But it was clean, comfortable and totally worth the very reasonable price. Of all the districts of Tokyo we visited, Shibuya was definitely our favorite... And the Tobu is right in the heart of it all. A short uphill walk from mass transit (just look for the Parco department store), a few steps away from shops, restaurants and pretty much anything you could want.

A great place to stay for business. Friendly staff, cost effective hotel right next to NHK (national broadcaster) and other Shibuya businesses. Also convenient for the Narita Express train from the airport. This goes to Shibuya station, and it is a short 5-7 minute walk from the station to the hotel. Print out walking instructions ahead of time - relying on the GPS software on your smart phone may not be... eh... smart. Tall buildings etc do not give you the best chance to get to the hotel right away.Rooms are somewhat small - most rooms in Tokyo are - and the ironing board is exactly that, a board. Also no meeting room facilities at the hotel, but the reception offers good tables for a discussion. The internet is WIRED, so don't expect to be able to use any online tools in your by-reception-area meeting.

3 night stay in October 2011. Great location about 8 mins walk from JR station. Room was a good size by Japan standard and was clean and tidy. Decor was modern but not luxury level. The room was a semi double but unlike many hotels in Japan, the bed was not against the wall.Typical small bathroom - but with all amenities. Hanging space flat against the wall was creative for small rooms.There was no wifi but lobby internet was cheap.Great hotel for the current rate of sub $100 level.Would stay again at this rate.

We just stayed at this hotel October 5-7 and paid $102/room through Agoda, the Japanese hotel web reservation system. We were late in booking it and were glad to get the rate in the Tokyo market. The staff had fairly good english skills and were very helpful.The only negatives were a lack of wifi (they did have in room internet plug in, just not wifi), and the rooms are typical small oriental sized. They work fine, and the hotel is quiet, they just don't have as much room as westerners are used to. The location is superb. Shibuya is lots of fun and not in a major business area. It is actually somewhat laid back compared to much of Tokyo. It has great restaurants, entertainment, and shopping. And it is a 2 block walk to Shibuya station, which has both a JR station with a Narita Express stop, and a subway station with 2 lines so it is easy to get anywhere in Tokyo.

When we were planning our trip to tokyo I did not think that we would be able to afford to stay in shibuya. I was so glad to find shibuya tobu hotel. The location is close to the heart of shibuya. Its about a 10 minute walk to shibuya crossing and shibuya station. The hotel is simple, clean, and just what we needed for our week stay in tokyo. The only thing i wish the hotel had was free wifi, other than that our stay was great and this hotel was a great base for exploring tokyo.

Once we got to the Shibuya JR Station, it was so packed and crowded, we didn't know which was North or South, so we flagged a taxi and he brought us to the Hotel. Once we got there, we realized it wasn't that far or that difficult to find.Shibuya is a busy place, and this hotel is not dead center of it all. However, there are still people walking and yelling at night.We stayed here for 5 nights, and I only had one complaint about someone making a lot of noise above us. Trying to complain to the front desk was a nightmare. I don't think they understood the situation, nor did they do anything about it.I wanted to mail some post cards and the staff were able to do that for me. They were extremely friendly and recommended a few places to eat.The room was a great size and so was the bathroom. They must have a partnership with Dominos because they had a brochure to order from them.All in all, I enjoyed my stay here, and if I ever make another trip to Japan, and ended up in Shibuya, I would pick this hotel.

http://asienresor.blogspot.com/2011/09/tokyo-varldens-basta-stad-tokyo-movie.htmlWe stayed at Shibuya Tobu this summer and the best part of it all was the hotel' location! Just 4 minutes walk to the famous "shibuya crossing" with al the department store's and boutique's! This hotel is still located at a quite peaceful street near yoyogi park.the rooms are extremely small but they still fit a double bed, a bathroom with a tub, all you need basically. No luxury but not shabby neither!So if you want a hotel that's in the heart of it all at a good price, this is the place to stay!To see my short movie from tokyo, hit the link:http://asienresor.blogspot.com/2011/09/tokyo-varldens-basta-stad-tokyo-movie.html

After the B in Ikebukuro, we moved to this hotel on our last day in Tokyo, when Typhoon Songda was about to set foot in Okinanawa and affecting Tokyo while on its way. The Shibuya station is one of the busiest station in Tokyo city, so be sure to have a map ready and know your way. We took the Hutchiko exit after arriving, and when we came to the station exit, boy, there was a sea of umbrellas like what I once saw in a movie.Hubby told me to stay put at the station with the luggages while he went to ask for directions to hotel. He told me afterwards that everybody was in a hurry and those that did stop to listen could not understand him. Finally he got hold of a young guy who did some deep thinking, tried to say something then shouted : Police! Police, and then signalled hubby to follow him. This person took my husband to 2 policemen at the front of the station and told the policemen to help him. The policemen did not know the directions to the hotel either so he gave up and came back to an anxious me.I remembered someone did say something about crossing the traffic junction and passing a NHK directory sign, so we grabbed our bags, unbrellas and did that. We had to ask around a few more times before we finally found the hotel.. Actually the hotel is not that hard to find, just that I did not do my homework enough.The hotel is located in a nice area, with large department stores like Tobu and Seibu and many other shops around. The Family Mart is our favourite place of visit on our way out and on our way back. The Yoyogi park is just nearby but we did not see any interesting characters on that wet Sunday afternoon.The room is small alright but functional, and clean. There is no wardrobe and you hanged your clothings on the hooks provided. I am satisfied with the hotel overall.

Clean, well-appointed, but typically small Western-style room in the middle of Shibuya, Tokyo. Basic decor, very new furniture. Had everything necessary: capsule style bathroom, flatscreen TV, small fridge (not a minibar). Bed was the usual board-hard Japanese version of a Western spring mattress, no surprises there. No room for a closet, it had a coatrack with space underneath for your suitcase. Free internet via Ethernet hookup in the room. Unremarkable decor, seemed suited for the business traveller. No ambiance, rather stark in general.Check in was hassle-fee, the staff speaks enough English that we could meet in the middle using our very basic Japanese. Is in the middle of Shibuya very near the Parco department store. We did get lost on the walk from the train station by taking a wrong turn, but soon found our way. Many other useful stores nearby, including a FamilyMart convenience store and a St. Marc Cafe in the hotel next door, good for breakfast. This is one of the liveliest areas of Tokyo, shopping, food, and nightclubs abound!Despite being in the middle of the seething masses in Shibuya, the room was very quiet, only the loudest sirens could be heard in the room. The lobby seemed to have a condensation problem, though, there were drips from the ceiling over a couch and over the main entrance. Found no vermin in the room at all.

sure the hotel room size wasn't the biggest but the room was only for baggage drop offs and sleep. best location possible if you want to be in the middle of shibuya. this is where i'll be staying for my tokyo visits.
