review_body: After a 11 hour flight from London Heathrow we arrived at Narita Airport and got the Narita Express into Tokyo. The term 'Express' is a loose one as it took nearly 2 hours to get from the airport to Shibuya Station. Of course we appreciate the vast size of the city but in a country that developed the high speed bullet train we expected the transfer not to be as long. If one of us ever visits Tokyo again we have said that we would prefer to pay extra for a private taxi so it drops us off right outside the hotel even though it is in a very good central location. To say we had only looked at the short journey from Shibuya station to the hotel we managed to find it quickly. The only problem was dragging a months worth of clothes round in a suitcase when it was 40 degrees and with 100% humidity. Its safe to say we had both never experienced heat of this nature and for me, who had also succumbed to a broken wrist 4 weeks before and still had a brace on, the 10 minute walk has gone down of one of the worst experiences of my life. A taxi will take you to the hotel from Shibuya but after an 11 hour flight with no sleep we panic walked. Seeing the hotel in the distance was one of the greatest sights we have both ever seen and as we walked in and the air conditioning hit us it was what we imagine heaven feels like. The man on reception was quite friendly but told us our room wasn’t ready, it was only 11.00 so we accepted this as check-in wasn’t till 2.00. We then asked if we had a smoking room, which took a while to translate and resulted in us showing the guy a packet of fags and pointing in the direction of the rooms. He then said if we wanted a smoking room then we could go up to the room straight away. We booked a smoking room, so glad we asked or we would have been done over again just like on the ‘Express’ Train. The room was quite small but was very modern and had good facilities. The toilet provided hours of entertainment, all we’ll say is turn the shower symbol on full blast, sit on it, then get out of there fast. Was a really nice hotel, with a great location and excellent value for money to say it’s a 10 minute walk from Shibuya. We’d highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again. If you do use the Narita Express make sure you book return tickets with the vendor in the airport as we didn’t and was quite confusing on our return journey to the airport.

This hotel i located perfectly in Shibuya area, 5 minutes from the Shibuya station, to which the Narita Express train arrives and where several metro lines makes the rest of Tokyo accessible. The hotel itself is fine, small rooms, but clean, functional and good beds.The buzzing of life, shopping and food in the surrounding area makes this hotel a perfect choice for first time Tokyo visitors.It was my first visit and I will surely come back.

great hotel right in the centre of the shopping and dining district of Shibuya, the hip and trendy hangout for Japanese youths. It's about a 10 minute (slow) walk up a slight slope from Shibuya station to this hotel, and a very short walk down from Yoyogi Park, where you can see lots of street performers/street art & stalls esp on weekends.It's very clean (I believe this pretty much goes without saying for just about ANY hotel you stay at in Japan ---- the whole nation is THAT much of a clean freak, well based on my personal experience having holidayed 3 times in Japan so far) , and rooms are even slightly larger than what is the norm for other Tokyo hotels. We got a good deal on expedia where rates were 50% off (so approx $AUD70 p/room p/night) but normally I think rates are double this. If it was full price I'd definitely stay here again if the budget allowed it, as the place is a great base to explore trendy Shibuya. I prefer to stay in Shibuya over Shinjuku due to the better & younger shopping and dining and general people-watching and nightlife, however Shibuya seems to have far fewer hotel options so we always stay some nights in Shinjuku (more a central business district, although also has a fantastic array of department stores) due to hotel availability. Some staff had limited English skills so slightly lower rating on that point, but generally friendly and helpful nontheless.

Stayed here for 5 nights. I got a great deal on Expedia and actually thought it was too good to be true, but was pleasantly surprised! It is only about a 10 min walk from Shibuya Station, there are restaurants and bars all round and plenty of shops. The rooms are small but as was every room I stayed in Japan. Comfy bed (average pillow) but a great shower. You can hear a little bit of noise through the rooms at night but I think we had 3 very loud, chatty people staying next to us! I did not eat breakfast at the hotel so can't rate that. Would highly recommend staying at this hotel, especially if you can grab yourself a fantastic deal.

Tobu hotel Shibuya is a well managed hotel. Room is very clean and staff are friendly. It about 15 mins walk from Shibuya station, a little bit off Shibuya centre but lots of restaurants nearby. There is a family-mart next to the building. Room is value for money and I would recommend it for anyone visiting Tokyo but not stay in hotel for whole day.

We reserved a non-smoking room and on the day we got there, after a long walk from Shibuya Station, we were given a smoking room. We had to go back down to the reception and fortunately they could give us another room, this time a non-smoking room. Location was OK, a good 10-13 minutes from Shibuya Station Hachiko exit, room was not bad, and pretty clean too. A little bit noisy sometimes but that's Shibuya, it never sleeps. Good value for money though. There's family mart nearby if you need some cup noodles or food set.

If you are very fussy...forget itIf you are a down to earth person...this is your hotel in Tokyo.As far as your budget is medium-normal one,this hotel offers you everything you need.My room was spot on every single day,I have been in a few hotels in Europe and I have never found a housekepper service better than this.There were no noises at all during the nights I stayed in,just a small school near by but It didn't bother me at all,no busy road,no noisy guest.The best is the location,just five minutes from Shibuya/Station and 15 minutes walking to Meji-Ori Park.Lots of handy shops,supermarkets and restaurants near the Hotel.Negative things...well the receptionist don't speak much English but to be honest to Check in and out you don't need much.I have to say I didn't eat at the restaurant but most of the days was almost empty.Anyway if you don't want to pay a lot of money and be and a cozy and clean hotel this is your Hotel,not doubt!!!

We booked this hotel on hoteles.com very cheaply a few months ago. We really had no idea if Shibuya was a good location or not, but when we got there on 10th of January we were more than surprised - GREAT location, 5 minutes from the main metro and JR station, right in the heart of everything, with restaurants, caffes, Starbucks and shops all around. You can easily get walking to Yoyogi park, Takeshita street and Meiji shrine- it's a pleasant 15 minutes walk from the hotel.The rooms were a bit small, there was no place to step on once we opened our lugage, but they were cleaned every day.The bathroom is also small (compared to what we are used to in Europe), but it has everything you need including a hair dryer.The staff at the reception was very helpful, they even called our ryokan in Kyoto on our last day to confirm our reservation.My opinion is that this hotel was very well worth the money we have payed and I would gladly stay there another time.

Shibuya Tobu Hotel is situated around 10minutes walk to the JR and metro lines, the location is very good, you can find somewhere to eat any time of the day, there are many eateries open 24 hours a day.The location is on a quiet street and easy to locate, and there is a Family Mart next to the hotel. The hotel staff speaks limited english but after trying to communicate a few times i was able to get what i needed. When i first checked into the room, the toilet was extremely filthy and i requested for a cleaner to clean it but they ended up changing the room, which was even better, otherwise i would had to live in a public toilet smell room for one week.I bought 7 nights hotel room from expedia.com for only AUD$606 and was good value, as its considered cheap for a hotel and not a hostel. I would definitely stay here again if i returned to Tokyo again.

We have stayed at the Sunroute in Shinkuku but this beats the Sunroute. We opted for the slightly larger size room as there were 2 of us and at the Sunroute we had to climb over luggage. For the extra aud10 it was well worth it. At under aud90 per night it was great value. The hotel is five mins walk fr Sibuya (Haichiko Exit) = cross road, look up for 'Lost in Trans.' Starbucks (second floor), pass Disney's and Parco and it's opposite Denny's! Hotel lobby is understated and subtle. Service efficient. On our floor was an ice machine and inevitable vending machine. Of course rooms were clean. Free Internet cable--borrow cable at front desk. All toiletries, night shirts, shoes provided. I don't know what people mean when they call it a 'business' hotel but it was perfect for our vacation. Quiet, clean, efficient. The location is superb - i prefer shibuya cos i like the shopping there better than Shinjuku. Room size was larger than I expected. At under aud100 including tax... I cannot imagine better value. It's my new Tokyo hotel. Tip: great habadasher (cheap and unusual dress materials) just past L'Occitane. Download maps on iPhone before you go. Visit a manga kissen - buy a manga and look at the pictures.

To cuts costs, I wanted a cheap hotel in Shibuya and I got this for just over 7500yen a night with "Hotels.com", so at that price I was never going to be too disappointed.I've been to Tokyo before, so I knew the rooms would be small, but this was smaller than I expected. Also, the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen. It was like a prefabricated plastic room slotted into the corner of the room, which you stepped up into. The bed was large enough for the 2 of us, and fairly comfortable.However, although the room was small and we had to step over our suitcases, - it was clean. Other than the back of other buildings, there was no view to speak of. Also, it must be near a school, as each morning we could hear kids assembly early in the morning.The hotel was within a few minutes walk from Shibya station so close to the restaurants and bars in that area. There is internet access in the lobby for 100yen for 10min.If I wished to stay in Shibuya again and was offered this price, I would stay here.

Everything in Tokyo is expensive so to find a well located reasonably priced hotel was good. The hotel is on a main road down to the Shibuya station complex and has excellent shops and eating places within minutes from the front door. The hotel is well located for tourists and has good connections for all the main features of the City. The staff are helpful and friendly with typical Japanese efficiency and attention to detail. You ask, they help - you cant do better than that. Hotel rooms in business hotels are snug. They have every thing you need for a short stay but if you want to stay for a couple of weeks then you need a bigger hotel - try the Century Park or Hilton at Shinjuku. But they are very expensive. We stayed for two periods of two nights over a week whilst we toured round. Very good and well priced. The pillows are traditional japanese but the reception changed them for softer ones without any fuss. The lobby retaurant provides a buffet breakfast which is good valued and provides the energy for a business or leisure day in a bustling and vibrant city. We would certainly use the hotel again.
Walking distance to everything shibuya has to offer, Harajuku and Yoyogi park. Spotless. Small rooms, but decent for tokyo. Would choose it again.

The location of this hotel is great but our semi-double room was tiny. Staying for 5 nights with no wardrobe (just hooks on the wall) and no draws meant we couldn't unpack and had little room to store our packed cases. However, the room was clean and we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. Tiny TV set in the wall with nothing in English to watch anyway. On the upside there was a vending machine and ice machine on every floor and the staff were helpful and friendly. We explored the area and it is ideally located, close to Yoyogi Park, Harajuku and the station, plus all the nightlife and restaurants are only a few minutes away. Probably a good choice for a shorter stay.

We stayed at Shibuya Tobu hotel for our week-long vacation in Tokyo. It was the perfect place to stay. A stone's throw from Yoyogi Park and Harajuku, it is in the heart of the Shibuya shopping and nightlife district. The location is the highlight of the Shibuya Tobu. There are a million inexpensive restaurants nearby, a Citibank (which is essential because US ATM cards don't work in all ATMs in Tokyo), great shops, game arcades, late night food, great bars, and a lot of nightlife. It's also near all of the Shibuya record shops (try Disc Union), and some of the hottest clubs (like Club Asia and The Ruby Room). The main attraction in Shibuya is people watching and sightseeing, and the hotel is about a five minute walk from one of the largest subway/train hubs. That makes it easy to head anywhere for visiting more historic areas of Tokyo.The room itself is small, but everything in Tokyo is small--trust me. The bed was perfect, and we slept very well. The staff was helpful but non-intrusive and kept the room very clean. We got a great deal on the hotel, so the room was a steal. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Tokyo.

Reasonably priced and larger than average ( for Japan) size room and bathroom. Rooms are clean and functional. It's about an 8-10 minute walk to Shibuya station, so excellent for shopping, restaurants and accessing other major shopping districts in Tokyo. LAN acess but no business centre if you don't have a laptop which is annoying but HMV close by has an internet cafe.Staff were very friendly and spoke English. One negative - went to have breakfast at 9.30am and was told it had stopped serving. However plenty of cafes nearby. Would recommend if you are staying in Shibuya and don't want to pay 5 star prices but still want a decent room.

This Hotel is located a couple of 200 meters from Center Gai and 300 meters fra Haitcko crossing where you also find Shibuya station. Shibuya is a very Lively neigbourhood with many shops, bars and fine dining.It's a 10 minutes walk to Yoyogi park and Harajuko.I think you get more value for money if you for instance stay in Akasaka (3 stops from Shibuya on the Ginza line) where it's a bit more quiet than Shibuya. But if you want to stay where the fun is stay in Shibuya.The hotel is average. Nice little building and reception. The rooms are small compared to hotelrooms in US, but i think this is normal for Tokyo. Very small bathroom. The recepionist spoke a little english just enough to get the information we needed. The rooms are a little worn down, but overall it was a nice experience. But the best part of this hotel is the loaction.
